I was really expecting a fabulous dinner but I was truly disappointed. For an appetizer I ordered the sautéed shrimp. It was very good. I had the lobster tails for dinner. They were a bit over cooked and not sweet at all. For the price that was charged they should have been perfect. After reading the reviews of the butter cake, I was looking forward to it. Their desserts are so large that as one person I couldn't order it :(.

The lobster mash-potatoes are worth the calories. I brought in 25 with dinner at this location, I loved the free dessert for special occasions, I loved the feeling of floating in the sky great view was kind of hard to find the location but we made it, most definitely a must try over and over again

Mastro's is AMAZING! Every single thing I have tried at this restaurant is DELICIOUS. Their dining room is very unique yet has a classy fine dining feel to it. My favorite tables are located within the "tree house" because who doesn't want to be in a tree house? =)

I've been there a bunch of times and below are some of my favorite food items:
- Alaskan King Crab Legs - (Available by the pound) Comes out warm and ready to eat with the shells already cracked open. They serve it with melted butter but I prefer their cocktail sauce instead.
- Cocktail Sauce - Yes, I put this in it's own category LOL. It's AMAZING. This is the best cocktail sauce I have ever had. It has the perfect amount of kick.
- Shrimp Cocktail - huge, plump, and delicious! One order includes 3 shrimps. It comes out in an entertaining presentation because of the dry ice below the bed of ice.
- Dungeness Crab Cocktail - This is probably the best value for the seafood tower appetizers. You get a bunch of crab meat with a few different sauces: cocktail (again, its the best!), Mastro's mustard, and extra horse radish (super strong). 
- Bone-In Rib Eye - They seem to cook a little more on the rare side. Possibly because the plate comes out at 400 degrees. (Be careful!) The meat tastes fabulous alone but they do offer Bearnaise and Peppercorn sauce as an option.
- Sea Scallops - Perfectly cooked and savory (Appetizer portion has 3, Entree portion has 5.)
- Signature Warm Butter Cake - THIS IS THE BEST DESSERT EVER!!!! Warm butter cake topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and served with a huge side of whipped cream. It is quite large and well worth the price! Serves 3-4 people easily. 

The service is genuine and attentive. If you put any notes in your reservation such as a special celebration, they pay close attention to it. It was so nice to not worry about telling the server it was my boyfriend's birthday.

I know I listed a bunch of my favorites, but if you could take away anything from this review, TRY THE BUTTER CAKE! =)

Every dinner I have had at Mastro's Ocean Club has been delish!! I am heading there tonight and can't wait to have some of my faves.... Tuna tar tar, Chilean sea bass and the brussel sprouts!!! Mmmmmm. Can't beat having live entertainment as well. Managers and service is the best here. See you soon!

Mastro's Ocean Club is one of my favorite restaurants inside of City Center!  Although the designer of this restaurant claims that it is set in a treehouse, it feels more like the dining room of a luxury cruise ship.  

Their Caesar salad CANNOT be beat.  I'm a huge fan of the pretzel bread too and apparently my server noticed.  He won my heart by giving me an entire basket of it!

I wish they were still open for lunch.

If you are a fan of ribeye, do yourself a favor and come to Mastro's indulge and in what is the TOMAHAWK: a 33oz bone-in beast of a steak worth every penny of your winnings. 

This intimidating slab of wagyu beef was perfectly medium rare, well marbled, and seasoned with care despite it's size. Definitely one of the best, if not the best, steaks I have had. You can be a monster and eat it all, or even split it with someone and order a few sides. 

So what if Mastro's is in a mall or if the "treehouse" is a little tacky for your tastes...you'll forget after your first bite. Best mall food ever.
Check your steak. They taste great but always takes 2 shots to get it right. Always overcooked or raw. Awesome when they finally get it right.

Was there for a casual dinner, it was good but not great. The service at times was annoying, especially when they fill your water glass up every 10 seconds. The food was adequate but not spectacular. If you want a spectacular Mastros experience I would suggest going to the Mastro's in Beverly Hills, CA. It is above and beyond anything you'll experience in Las Vegas. I would go back to the Las Vegas location but only after some serious thought and consideration of some of the other steak houses in Vegas.

We've eaten at the Mastro's in Chicago before and we were looking forward to a great steak. The low down for the Mastro's in Vegas is below:

A) Service: Superb. Our waiter was fantastic. Best overall service in a restaurant we've had in a long time.

B)  Atmosphere:  OK. We sat "outside" so that we had a view of the mall. The atmosphere here is really not conducive to a great experience. You feel like you are eating in a mall food court. They should really try to find a better location with better ambiance. 

C) Food. Really good ( almost) There were 4 of us and we all ordered some variation of a fillet. Mine came out perfect, but my wife ordered hers medium rare and it came out close to well done. We were having such a good time with our friends that she didn't want to spoil the scene and return the steak. Otherwise everything was great including the shaker that they bring to your table with your cocktail, so that you actually can 2 glasses of booze for $18 rather than one. 

Overall, another great steakhouse in Vegas. Probably won't come back. Not because it was poor, but just because there are so many other places to explore in this restaurant town.
Beautiful Restaurant and impeccable service.  Request to eat in the treehouse and enjoy.

I ate here during my trip to Vegas in December. It was a great experience.

Service from beginning to end was excellent. Waiter was very nice and even scooped some food into my plate when the plate was getting emtpy lol. There was also a guy playing the piano and singing so that was nice too.

I ordered the filet mignon steak and I have to admit, it was one of the best steaks I have ever had. I'm from New Orleans and I have tried all the top steakhouses here like Mortons and Dickie Brennan's but Mastro's tops them both. Meat was tender and was full of flavor. 

Pricewise, it is pretty expensive but that is to be expected. Steak was about 55 bucks, sides were about 15 for me. G/f ordered a mixed drink that turned out to be 17 bucks. Total bill for 2 people was around 140.

I highly recommend this place if you want a classy place to eat in Vegas

My girlfriend took me here for date night. We had an amazing time seated in the tree house.  We both loved the atmosphere. 

Everything we ate or drank was overwhelmingly delicious. It would be to great a challenge to identify a favorite dish. Though don't leave until you have tried the signature butter cake.

The service was everything you could hope for. Our waiter Lionel was very attentive yet gave as the space to enjoy our date. We never felt rushed and every one one of his recommendations enhanced our meal. 

I hope this was the first of many visits.

Everything here was spectacular from beginning to end. I went here for dinner on a Friday evening. The restaurant itself is located inside of Crystals in an open area of the shopping center. Despite the open area, the atmosphere was still very nice and the live music really added to it.

My Experience:
Starters
-The bread was pretty good
-The Shrimp Cocktail was delicious and the horseradish was spicy!

Main Course & Sides
-I ordered the Filet, and having dined at another steakhouse earlier in the week, I must say, the filet here was incredible. This was probably one of the best filets I have ever had!
-The sides were just as amazing. We had the mac and cheese, green beans with almonds, mashed potatoes, and creamed corn. I would recommend all of them as there wasn't one I did not like.

Dessert
-I'm not a huge sweets guy, but I was told that I HAD to try the Butter Cake even though we were already stuffed. It definitely lived up to the hype as a MUST TRY dessert!

Overall, I had a great dining experience here. Our waiter was awesome and we never felt rushed. I would HIGHLY recommend trying this place next time you are in Vegas!
Had the chocolate pudding. Loved it. So delicious. Definitely very rich. One portion enough for two. Environment and service were great too.

Business dinner while in Vegas. The appetizer tower to start was just over the top good. My God. Dinner was good and desert was some sort of soaked pound cake. Wow. 

Just glad I wasn't paying...

Solid American, good steaks, but really, this place shines for dessert. Namely the Butter Cake.

It weighs seemingly 8 lbs. Two people would be hard pressed to finish it, especially if you just ate a huge steak.

Pricey dinner, but large portions and good food.  Great service, fantastic location if you sit in the "tree house".  Live music often and usually very crowded.

I'm a fan of the Mastro's steakhouse in Costa Mesa, but this was my first visit to an Ocean Club location.  My expectations where pretty high, although I must admit I was not particularly thrilled with the location deep inside Crystals.  However, from start to finish, this was really a first-rate experience.

Service and food were top-notch.  I even had a follow-up call from the GM the next morning to make sure everything was to our satisfaction (which it most certainly was).  I was particularly impressed when, after ordering a bottle of wine which they initially indicated was out-of-stock, the sommelier was able to hunt a bottle down for us. It was this type of service and their overall attention to detail that really impressed me.  

Normally, I stay at Wynncore, so if I had not been staying at Aria on this particular trip, I am not sure I would have made the trip up here.  Now that I've experience the Ocean Club first-hand, I won't hesitate to book a return visit.

Love coming here when we come to Vegas. Restaurant is located in the Crystal 's center, which is close to surrounding hotels. The staff is friendly and very polite. Our waiter Paul was awesome!! Food portions are a good size. The steak, salad and sides were cooked to perfection. The food was delicious. The most amazing dessert ever is the butter cake.

Mastros is my favorite fine dining restaurant in Las Vegas!!!! There ribeye steak is grilled to perfection and is so tender and juicy and the lobster mash is a must as well! I've been celebrating my birthday here for the last couple of years now but this year I was a little disappointed because they didnt serve the warm butter cake as my birthday desert

We ate here before seeing a show in Vegas.  We were looking for good steak, and couldn't get reservations at our top pick, so tried this place instead.  The weird thing about this restaurant is that it's in a mall -- it's a very nice mall, but it's still a mall.  Setting that aside, the food is very good.  We all got filets and they were delicious.  The sides are HUGE, so no need to go overboard on them.  If you can, ask to sit in the "treehouse" -- it's a part of the restaurant that juts out over the second floor of the mall, and gives you a "view" of the "mall" (I know that sounds silly, but it's pretty cool).

Great steaks cooked perfectly to temp and the seasoning was spot on.

Bone In Rib Eye - see above
King Crab leg - fresh , can't really screw this up if it's fresh
Oysters - same review as the crab legs
Gnochi with King Crab & Truffle - delicious side dish

Great wine selection and atmosphere.  I would give a more in depth review but a little too hungover, my palate was not firing on all cylinders.  But I do remember it tasted really good.

Husband and I were in Vegas for a few days and we had dinner at Mastro's on our first night.  I originally booked the table for 7:30 p.m. but as we were running late, I called and asked that our time be pushed back to 8 p.m. and the lady said it should be fine.  We got there at 8 promptly and were seated at the first table by the entrance.  It has its pros & cons.  It's good in that we were sort of in our own corner but bad in that there was a lot of traffic, people walking by and the table next to us was quite loud.  Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner tremendously, both the food and the service.  Our server was Rob and we really want to thank him here again for his excellent and professional service.  I hope he will read this review, but if not, I hope other diners will ask for Rob as he is really awesome.  He is very sincere and does just enough to make you feel welcomed and taken care of.  The food was really awesome.  We ordered lobster cocktail, a 33 oz Australian Kobe steak to share and a side of sauteed mushrooms and a bottle of Tomey.  Everything was delicious.  We were on a bit of tight schedule as we have a show to watch at 10 p.m.  at the Mirage and Rob did everything he could to get us of out there in time for the show.  Thank you so much Rob for a wonderful dinner experience!

WOW I was pretty impressed with this place and I've done my share of dining in Vegas. The decor was modern and in the middle had this treehouse area where there are more tables. That night, they happened to have the treehouse rented out so there was live music playing which got a bit annoying since it was loud. That was my main complaint. 

On to the food. We started with the seafood tower and I wasn't even hungry going into this dinner but I gobbled everything up. It had jumbo shrimp cocktail, kunumoto oysters, crab claws, lobster, and king crab legs, the works. It was presented with dry ice. They served it with cocktail sauce, this mustard sauce and atomic horseradish, when you mix all 3 it was a pretty good sauce that way too. 

I was pretty full so I opted to get a salad and I chose the iceberg salad. Now I have to say i always get dressings on the side but this dressing was a red wine vinaigrette but it was creamy looking. The waitress said it was emulsified but there was no cream in it. It was the BEST salad dressing I have ever had! I think i wanted to dip every lettuce in a spoonful of dressing, that's how much I liked it.  It just had this tangy taste (from the red wine) but a smooth creamy texture but it had no creme. YUM!

I tried my bf's steak and he had the rib eye and it was delicious, melt in your mouth meat. Our favorite steak houses in Vegas are Michael's (Southpoint) and Cut (Palazzo) but I think Mastro's takes the cake on this. We had so many sides, potato's au gratin, snow peas, yam fries, mac and cheese but I heard the gnocci here was delicious from the rest of our party although I was too stuffed to try. 

But the best part of dinner was the dessert! We had the warm butter cake, it tasted like a mix of pound cake and maybe cheesecake but it is served with vanilla ice cream and had a creamy inside, and sugar flakes line the cake to give it texture. Oh and it comes with homemade whip cream! I think that was better than the ice cream, I wanted to eat gobs of it. 

This is definitely a favorite now although the seafood tower is VERY pricey, it was probably half of the price of the meal, and we were with a party of 10. n

Mastro's really is as good as it gets.  They were so good, my bf and I came here twice during our three night excursion in Vegas.  The service here is impeccable, the food top notch and the ambiance exquisite and dramatic.  

The first time we were served on by Tanya who delivered exemplary service all night.  We ordered the seafood tower with beluga caviar, lobster, raw oysters, crab and shrimp.  Everything was fresh and even tastier with the atomic horseradish condiment, red onions, parsley, egg white, egg yoke and capers.  If you like it hot, the horseradish here is simply the best.  It will give you an amp, clear your sinuses immediately and possibly cause you to shed a tear.  The escargot was soft and delectable with a garlic and buttery taste.  I can't pick out what herbs they put on them, but there was a greater complexity on the palette to make it more interesting.  We ordered a nice bottle of Cloudy Bay sauvignon blanc to compliment the seafood.  Dinner was so satisfying, we didn't have room for dessert, but we ended it with a couple of dirty martinis.  Unbeknownst to us, they also bring an entire shaker with the remnant vodka leftover!  Let's just say we left a little behind.

Unfortunately, a couple hours later my bf fell ill, but I didn't.  As always when ordering raw shellfish, it's always a possibility to get a bad oyster.  It was only disappointing to have to end the night so soon.  However, the way Mastro's handled it was outstanding.  We didn't have to call them to inform them how our dining experience went.  They called the next day to make sure it was good.  I ended up speaking to Sherry and told her about our wonderful experience minus the bad oyster.  She was extremely empathetic and invited us back in to make it right.  We gladly accepted the invitation and dined at Mastro's again a couple days later.

We were seated in the tree house again and Lionel waited on us this time.  He was every bit charming with a sense of humor and also delivered immaculate service.  We both had to use restraint  from devouring the fine variety of artisan breads in the basket.  We both shared the Tomahawk Kobe Beef bone-in ribeye medium rare.  All I can say is wow!  This was the best steak ever.  The softness of each morsel, darker color and bolder flavor was a real pleasure for us.  We ordered the escargot again and tried the roasted brussell sprouts and sauteed spinach- both cooked to perfection and tasty.  Lionel recommended a nice cab which I can't remember what- maybe Hill?  Nevertheless, it was a perfect compliment to our steak.  We ended the meal with a nice sponge cake dessert with fruit, whip cream and a couple ports.

Dinner at Mastro's in their architectural masterpiece called the "tree house" was the perfect last dinner in Vegas before going home.  Their appreciation for their customers and solicitous attitude really make this place top notch.  We definitely appreciated all they did to compensate for the bad oyster from the first visit on our second visit.  We had an amazing time and are sure to return next time we are in Vegas. 

Thank you Mastro's for a wonderful dining experience!

A good friend of ours suggested Mastro's when we asked for a recommendation for a seafood on the Strip. So I made a reservation online for that night at 7pm on the Mastro's website. What I didn't know was that I had somehow clicked on the Chicago location. Luckily I was walking around the Crystals shopping center that afternoon and went to check out the venue and was chatting with one of the hostesses who offered to check on our reservation to confirm it .. good thing she did and we fixed my error. They were pretty booked that night but were able to squeeze us in. :) 

The service was pretty much top-notch from start to finish, hostesses, servers, and bussers,  all were very attentive and knowledgeable as well as being friendly and personable. Loved that they dish out our sides for us .. that's a really nice touch. 

The food, we had a variety of items which were all delicious but at the top of our favorites were the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi and the Signature Lobster Mashed Potatoes. Both are must haves to accompany any steak or seafood dish. We had the bone-in Filet which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious as well as the pan seared Chilean Sea Bass which my dining companions said was spectacularly prepared and seasoned. 

Dessert was over the top .. we had three .. Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake, 
the Cherry Crisp, and the Profiteroles. The first two were topped with Vanilla Bean Gelato. Both were to die for. I had read lots about the Warm Butter Cake and it was everything I had expected and more :) .. and surprisingly I also loved the Cherry Crisp .. I am not huge on Cherry anything but the flavor had just the right amount of sweetness and was not overpowering and the Crisp part is a crumbly granola like topping which is an nice balance with the Gelato and fruitiness of the dish. It's something I would definitely order again! 

My only complaint is that the server didn't warn us about the size of the Beef Carpaccio appetizer. Mom and I each ordered our own, and when they came out .. they were absolutely gigantic and even though we had a party of 5 we were unable to finish both. Being in the service industry myself, I would have definitely warned my guests about the size of the Carpaccio dish and suggested something else to order with it. 

All in all it was a fabulous dinner, the restaurant, even though it is in a busy mall .. has a nice ambiance, and we will absolutely be back.

I'm not feeling up for a lengthy review so I'll keep it brief. For two of us, without wine and dessert (the later was comp'd by our Mandarin Oriental Concierge) our tab was $230 + tip. I can say without hesitation having dined all over the world, and eaten at the best steak houses in NYC, Chicago, Palm Springs and LA, this was NOT a $230 meal. At best it was worth $120. 

Food= Our seafood appetizers were delicious - oysters and shrimp. For dinner we ate fillets, lobster, au gratin potatoes, and creamed spinach. The meat was good, lobster decent, and sides very disappointing. Usually this is what makes a Steak house memorable -not here.  The warm "pretzel bread" and butter cake dessert were by far the most memorable portions of the meal.

Atmosphere = you're eating in a mall - albeit a beautifully designed mall with every luxury brand in the book, it's still a mall. Within the tree house where we dined, you watch mall walkers beneath you. Ouch.

Service= Very good, attentive, but not $230 good. 

Overall 3 stars. For all of us Zagat's goons, I'd go with Food=21, Decor=23, Service=23.

Overall, I really enjoyed my meal but be prepared for a different ambiance! The restaurant is literally in the middle of the mall, with the tables pretty much out in the open. Not a huge deal, but definitely not ideal. 

I had the mambo salad (spicy caesar salad with no croutons), 8 oz. Petite filet and cheese cake for dessert. The filet was perfectly prepared, served on a burning hot plate that sizzled and continued to cook the sides of creamed corn, spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. Our table also shared the steamed mussels appetizer, which was excellent! Highly recommended!

Second time to eat here, almost exactly one year apart from each other--both times for a bachelor party.  We actually had the same waiter both times.  This place is fantastic.  We had a seafood tower for the appetizer with all kinds of incredibly fresh items (dungeness crab, two types of oysters, lobster, shrimp, snow crab, etc.).  You can get that made to fit a particular price point per person.  The scallops were incredible.  The wine selection is great.  Highly, highly recommend.

I LOVE Mastro's in Beverly Hills so I did not expect this one to meet the same high standard but boy was I wrong!  The service here was excellent!  We had a large party and they accommodated us with ease and the food was delectable!  Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas now.

I have been wanting to eat at this restaurant for quite sometime. My husband and I were in town for his birthday and ate here on January 23rd.  We arrived to a bustling restaurant and were seated at the bar. The bar is quite impressive. We ordered cocktails and as soon as they were poured, the hostess came to seat us. Another host came with a tray to take our drinks so we wouldn't have to carry them. Very nice touch. We headed to the "treehouse" and were seated. We had a wonderful view of the entire treehouse. The bar drinks were outstanding. Our waitress was attentive and polite. We ordered an appetizer which was good. I ordered the Sea Bass while my husband decided on the petit filet. As we were ordering, our waitress overheard us say we would share and offered to have both entrees split. We also ordered the lobster mash potatoes. When our entrees arrived, they both melted in our mouths. The filet was so tender and the sea bass was light and flaky. After enjoying our dinner, we ordered the butter cake we had heard was so magnificent. Indeed, it was one of the most amazing things I have ever eaten. We WILL be back in April and we will be bringing friends. This was a real dining experience. My only regret was not trying it sooner.
Still one of our favorite places to eat...not as good as the Newport Beach location but better than most everything in Vegas! Love the attitudes of the staff and food is always excellent!

This is actually 3.5 stars.  So me and the guys had dinner here last night and as usual the food is excellent (5 stars).  

The reason for the lower rating was due to service and ambience.  I've been to other Mastro's and their service has always been top notch.  They always anticipated your needs and followed up quickly.

Our main server here could have worked at Sizzler, Black Angus, Outback or any of those type of places and the clientele there would have thought he was good.  At Mastro's, not the case.  

I am a low maintenance client and in the restaurant business so I understand how it can be.  But last night's dinner service wasn't busy and Mastro's has a pretty good wait staff to client ratio so our needs should have been met fairly easily.  

My biggest complaint are the lack of water initially and follow up afterwards.  We didn't get water until are appetizers were served.  There was never a follow up after any of the dishes were served.  This is pretty basic service for a fine dining establishment so I will not give you any leeway here.  

My other issue is more of a personal taste.  Mastro's is located in Crystals Shopping Center at CityCenter and has an "open top" feel with views of the mall.  The restaurant is not enclosed so it feels like I'm dining at a very expensive food court.  As with typical steak houses they are usually dark but here it's pretty bright.  I didn't feel like I had the full Mastro's steak house experience.

While I really enjoyed the food and time with my friends I'm not sure I will go back since Vegas has a lot of dining options.

Poor customer service. Very rude hostess (Asian young lady with dyed blond hair working on the evening of 09/26/15). No eye contact when we arrived, no eye contact as we were speaking to her. We understood that there were extremely busy during the time and we had to wait, but interaction with the first person you encounter makes a big difference in your whole experience. The first encounter ruined our whole dining experience. We made the mistake of staying because we were so hungry even though we had to wait an extra half hour even with reservations. We were hoping the service after the first encounter would be better but the whole experience just felt rushed. The food was so so. The one star is for the Chilean Sea Bass which was excellent but the rest you can find at other similar restaurants. For the price you spend at a restaurant such as this, we expected better customer service at the very least.  Would not recommend as there are much better coptions in Vegas with similar menus, much better service, and much better ambiance (not in a mall).

Gr8 steak and seafood in this elegant and classy restaurant.  The wine list and bar menu are top shelf.  Desserts are other-worldly.  Service and ambience make me want to say "shut up and just take my money."  Just as good as the one in Newport Beach sans the ocean view.

What's that expression that a lot of us foolhardy guys toss about as soon as we get to Vegas? "Go big, or go home"? It basically gives us a free pass to indulge in things that are extravagant, luxurious and potentially dangerous. And Mastro's fits well within this criteria: the place holds meals fit for royalty, the decor is immaculate, and it can be hazardous to your wallet's health if you are not prepared. But for those of us still reading, and certainly for those of us who have had the honor, Mastro's is a must-dine destination if you're in town.

Located pretty centrally in the City Center shopping district, it's almost impossible to miss Mastro's: the opulent, wood-like "fishbowl" perched precariously at an elevation is definitely eye-catching, and I'm pretty sure I inadvertently photobombed countless tourists as they stopped to take pictures of this structure, which is actually a dining room. Before you can get to your table, you stop by a tiny hostess desk flanked by two gals who wasted no time getting us seated once we checked in with our reservation. You'll more than likely walk past an offshoot to another, more private dining room, a pretty spectacular bar and then make your way into the main dining room that is expertly laid out: whoever did the layout here did so in such a way that seating is maximized but not once does it feel crowded. And this is even more impressive when you consider the polished staff is zipping about without hesitation or collision.

And let's talk about the staff, right quick: simply put, these are professionals who know their craft inside and out. Our waiter, Lionel, was the epitome of providing an exceptional customer service experience. We were -THAT- table that upfront told him we had a show to catch later that evening, and without missing a beat, he assured us he would keep us on schedule and would not let the meal be compromised. His service, along with the refills and bussing provided by other staff members, made for the best, most efficient dining experience I have seen yet in years of visiting Vegas. Add in a visit from a manager who just stopped by to chat and make sure everything was cool, and you have a place with a team that cannot be topped.

But all the friendliness and attention to detail means nothing if the food is bogus, and Mastro's has this base covered, too. Oh, do they ever. My folks started with a bowl of clam chowder and a caesar salad, while I went with the lobster bisque. All three were perfect pre-show snacks for the main courses, and just typing this sentence out is making me drool with fond remembrance. Ahem. 

Mom went with a red snapper that was cooked to perfection and my surf-and-turf combo of a filet and lobster tail (which Lionel was gracious enough to de-shell table side like a boss) ranks among the best I've had at any place around the world. But the most surprising part was when Dad sheepishly admitted he had somehow never had sea bass before... and now that bar is set unfathomably high as his Chilean sea bass here was his favorite meal of this trip. A side of creamed corn and scalloped potatoes rounded out dinner, and wiped out my stomach. Somehow, my folks found room for Mastro's signature dessert, a butter cake that made me question how a chef can bake happiness, joy and euphoria into one pastry. It's that good (even though I had two bites and almost went into a coma with the straight gin I was drinking).

I cannot say enough positive things about Mastro's. From the staff to the overall "look" of the place, and most assuredly the culinary satisfaction each plate offers, it's a place that rewards all those who stop by for a drink or a bite to eat. Take those winnings from the casino and invest them here: I promise it's a much better deal than your favorite variation of Blackjack.

Nothing short of amazing.  We spent our anniversary dinner here.   The food was amazing, and the service was top notch.  We had sautéed shrimp as an app, and split the bone in filet, garlic mashed and 2 lobster tails.  All was great, but he highlights....
    1.  The sautéed shrimp was one of the bet things I have ever eaten.  Perfectly cooked.  And the sauce was to die for.  It came with soft garlic bread to sop up the sauce.  I would have been happy with this for my entire meal.  
   2.  I got lobster tail two ways, but the vanilla fried was amazing.   
 
   Lastly and maybe most important was the dessert.  I am it a huge dessert fan, and we probably wouldn't have ordered dessert if it wasn't for them offering it for free for our anniversary.   We are fans for life.   I think they call it butter cake.   It was insane.   We had leftovers and ate it for breakfast.   Soooo good.

We dined at Mastro's at the suggestion of my client.  It's an interesting location in the Crystal shopping center right off the strip.  The food was very good as was the service.  But it's spendy!  $18 glass of Glenlivet 12, $14 for Soli and Tonic.  And a word of advise, don't open the wine menu if you are faint of heart.  With that said, if you just crushed it at the tables and you got some money to spend - have fun!

This is the kind of over the top dining that I like to treat myself to once in a while. Gorgeous white tablecloth service, servers in white sportscoats, beautiful bar. I wish I could have spent 3 hours drinking my way through the meal and probably will allow myself that much time next visit. 

I had the 12oz bone in filet, it was excellent. Our table ordered the gnocchi & crab as a side dish. Delicious even for $26.  

It's a tiny bit awkward that it's in the middle of a massive shopping mall, for this kind of evening I wish I could just put on a nice dress and heels, take a cab and have a doorman open the restaurant door for me instead of trekking through a gi-normous mall up and down escalators to get there. However they make up for it with a cool bar and outstanding service.

I think I am in the twilight zone after reading the other reviews.  just dropped 4 bills here on my silver anneversay dinner for 4 - no wine either.   Service and atmosphere were great.  however this did not make up for the food.  I would give it 2.5 stars.  appetizers we had were calimari and Boston clam chowder.  the sauce that came with the calimari was not good.  The calamari was above average.  the soup seemed to lack a good seafood stock so flavor was absent although it had a good amont of clams.  we ordered two sides with dinner.   lobster mash potatoes was a good size serving but the lobster chunks were swimming in a puddle of butter.  could get the texture of th lobster meat but not too much on the flavor side.  string been were better bu similar.   I had the artic char.  seemed to lack flavor likely more than a day old.  sauce was tasty but I love the flavors of really fresh fish.  My wife had Chilean sea bass.   I had a bite at the end.  it was fishy like an old fish.   I have this dish often and this was the worst I have had.  I couldn't eat desert after this.   My kids had a new York steak and rack of lamb.  both were not cooked well and we're tough.  I am pretty sure I could have kicked as on the chef for these dishes.   the rack of lamb did have a good serving portion.  I was hoping I could be more positive and considered that my palate could be off because of something I ate earlier.  however the Chilean sea bass had some good flavors but was overpowered by bad fishy flavors.
Excellent service, lobster mash was delicious. Everything else was also........buttercake.

This place is always up to par. Great service and the food is perfect!! The seafood tower is so fresh and the steaks are cooked to perfection. The sides are all so good it's hard to choose. And the butter cake for desert is to die for!!!!! Always come back here

I am going to make this review short and to the point.  You should come here.  The food and drinks are superb, the wait staff are very friendly and attentive and the restaurant is amazing.  Worth the money for sure.
Get on it people.
Excellent service and amazing food! Wish i could eat here more often. Best appetizers and everything is cooked perfectly. And the butter cake is wow
YUM! The crab legs are always perfect, the filet always like butter, the pretzel bread always hot and the service impeccable! Amazing.

Went for a special dinning experience last night at their Las Vegas location . We typically dine at the Crystal Cove location in Orange County, CA. Very consitstant at what they do. Here, the experience was very different. 

We sat next to the bar in one of tgeir high tables. Started with an Escargot appetizer. However, the appetizer did not come with the Escargot schells which defeated the purpose of the experience of working your way through this delicatessen in anticipation of savoring your find. We have been dining at Matro's for 15 years and always order Escargot on schells. That is how is served!

All along the waiter kept pressuring us to order something else to drink besides water! The next appetizer was seared ahí tuna, which was overly spiced and was no presented well..

Some how the waiter probably felt we were not worthy of her service, so we caught her drinking beer with other customers at the next table over.

We decided not to order anything else and asked for the check which came 20 minutes later. As far as we were concerned this venue does NOT maintain its reputation and status consistantly across other locations.  Very disappointed, to say the least.
Any trip to Mastro's is always a good one!! The food and drinks are always perfect!!
Some of the best food that you'll ever eat in a treehouse! The seafood and steaks are out of this world. Highly recommended!

Growing up in Beverly Hills I have attended the Mastro's on Cañon close to 100 times. They have the best steak in the game, I don't care what anyone try's to say. Last night me and my friend Paul had the night off in Vegas so we decided to check out the Mastro's here in Las Vegas at City Center. It not the traditional Mastro's setting but the food was still remarkable! Our waiter Deion was the man he helped my friend choose the perfect wine to accompany his bone-in filet topped with foie gras! Which just melted in ur mouth! (Pause) I myself took down the 22oz Bone-in Ribeye cooked medium rare plus like a beast and enjoyed every single bite! Once again Mastro's was an A+! Pictured below was the Bone-in Ribeye.

I read all these great reviews and I just don't get it.  I've eaten at the Beverly Hills location on several occasions and LOVED it.  I've tried on many occasions to duplicate the Tomatoes and Onions at home, but never the same.  I've been in Vegas 4 years now, and never knew that this was here until about 3 weeks ago.  It was so beautiful that i couldn't wait to try it.  Since it was my birthday, I said "Lets go to Maestros."   Why am I the only person to have a bad experience here?

The waiters and bussers were waiters and bussers, no personality at all, but thats not what i went for, so no issue there.    I wanted the Tomatoes and Onions.  When the server sat the plate down, i asked "Those are sweet onions, right?"  He replied "Yeah!"  They were not. Three slices of tomato and 2 slices of a regular onion that you would put on a hamburger, burned the inside of the nose.  Calimari was very good.

We both ordered the 22 oz bone in rib eye, mine medium rare, my guest Medium, with a few sides:  Gargonzola Mac & Cheese (Pretty damn good), sauteed spinach, and Burnt Brussel Sprouts, which they were.  When they sat the plate down, the steaks looked like they were for Fred and Barney, and they tasted that old.  These were the worst steaks that I've ever had.  I sawed (literally) a piece off of each end and could not go any further. A chainsaw wouldn't help. The taste was like that of a 30 year old cow.  My asked asked "Does yours taste like an old cow?"  "CLEARLY!"  The busser asked if we wanted everything to go:  I said "Sure, but please place this steak in a separate box", as i intended to give it to one of the homeless people on the bridge.  When he heard us discussing how awful the meat was, busser told us that he could put it on the grill a little longer.  I told him that that wouldn't help it.  So, He boxed it up and the waiter gave us the check.  NO ONE (Manager, waiter, etc...) ever asked, from the time that the steak was sat down, "How is it?".  At Del Friscos, or Hugos Cellar, or descent restaurants they always say "Please cut into the center and let us know if that is prepared correctly", before they ever walk away.  I guess that they are tired of seeing the sawing action. After Paying, waiter said "Till next time" to which my guest replied "there wont be a next time!"

Trust me, I really wanted this to be an awesome experience, as it was my birthday, the place is BEAUTIFUL, and it took some talking to get my guest to go with me.  Check was only $250, but $130 of that was a total waste.  I could NEVER go to this place again, not even for free.

Called in to ask of I can wear sneakers.. the lady said yes! So.. I went in for an amazing birthday dinner..  Steak Filet,  lobster mashed potatoes,  and green beans with a nice glass of wine. Finished with a delicious chocolate cake with a single lit candle.. 
 with freshly whipped cream in a side dish! Heaven!  My waiter with his beautiful smile knew exactly what I needed on my special day! Never had to ask for a thing. His eye contact let me know.. he understood it was MY day! He spoiled me...
Thank you so much. Food was amazing, service exceptional,  the restaurant was beautiful,  peaceful yet elegant!  I loved it and can't wait to return.

Daniel was my server, AH-MAZE-ING!! Service team was incredible, each dish was delicious and cooked perfectly. 
I enjoyed the sea bass, tender, rich in flavor with the scalloped potatoes. A glass of Haan Point Noir and the Butter Cake with fresh whipped cream, as recommended by Daniel. I dined alone as I'm on a business trip, they were kind enough to take care of my wine and dessert, truly a nice gesture!

Believe the hype. This place is worth the hit on your bank account. 

They took 5-star dining to a whole new level via a phone call the next day to see how our experience was the night before. Some patrons might not like this unsolicited call, but I didn't mind the show of courtesy. 

Must haves: bone-in ribeye, truffle crab gnocchi, and brussel sprouts. 

Further proof they're all about customer service: they automatically split our entree in half for us (no split fee). Also, we were apprehensive about ordering the full order of the truffle gnocchi, so our server offered to give us a half portion (for exactly half the price: $16). This was NOT on the menu, and the half order is more than enough for 2 people (I can't imagine how huge the full order must be). If just two of you, I highly recommend you ask for the half portion and order something else. 

So, here's a PERFECT meal at this Mastros for 2 people at ~$100 (no alcohol)-

1. Bone-in Ribeye 22oz ($59)
2. Half order of the Truffle Gnocchi ($16)
3. Brussel Sprouts ($11), or whatever other side dish you prefer

That's A LOT of food for 2 people. Trust me. And everything's mindblowing. 

Lastly, can another unoriginal idiot please post another unoriginal picture of the restaurant's structure? There aren't enough of them on yelp. Thanks.
Ate there last night and the seafood was fresh and priced well.  The bread was "ok" but the food was verty good.  A++ . A must try in Vegas

We had a lovely dinner.  My friend and I split the scallops and the NY steak and they were delicious.  A few comments:  1) the restaurant is in a high-end mall so it didn't feel very secluded or intimate; 2) we ordered creamed spinach and mashed potatoes as our sides.  These side portions could have easily fed 4-5 people each.  I wished that the waiter would have told us that how much food this is. Too much waste.  We were on vacation - so no doggy-bags possible.

This past weekend was my second time at Mastro's and this time I was in charge of planning for 16 hungry guys in a bachelor party.  The original number we 12, and I called 3 days before and had no problems getting a table.  By Saturday night, the number had ballooned to 16.  I was nervous about calling to change the reservation, but Mastro's called first and offered a private room which made it even easier to up the number to 16.  Many thanks to the Hostesses at Mastro's for being so easy to work with.  The service is here is friendly and confident, they know what they are doing.

The food continues to carry that confident theme.  Big, bold, and flavorful, the steaks here are serious...no sides to cover them up.  They are served to you "naked" with nothing else on the plate.  Sides can be ordered for the table and the sides pretty much all delicious.  Back to the steaks...Charred and flavorful on the outside, juicy and savory on the inside.  My mouth waters just thinking about it.

Awesome! Dion our server was awesome made the visit a 5 star visit on top of great food. We had the rib eye bone in with scallops potatoes and sautéed asparagus AWESOME! For dessert we had the butter cake OMG! We loved it!

If you want world class food and wine in Las Vegas, this is the place to go. The food the drinks, the ambiance and the service are unequalled. I will keep coming back to this place every time I'm in Las Vegas, In fact I will come to Las Vegas just for this place alone, IT IS THAT GOOD!!!! 

This place is absolutely the best.  and sorry to say, but maybe better than the other Mastro's locations. :)
My favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! The seafood selection is great. Def save room for the butter cake.

Stopped in to Mastro's Ocean Club recently on a work related dinner.  We got to sit under the Tree House that overlooks the Crystals Shopping Center.

After waiting about 15 minutes to be seated, we started with the Seafood Tower because nothing says over the top LV dining like a seafood tower.  On this tower were jumbo shrimp, a variety of crab legs, and some oysters.  Served on the side were a traditional cocktail sauce, their atomic horseradish, and a mustard sauce.  I was a little too liberal with the horseradish sauce and can confirm that the "atomic" description is accurate.

For my main, I went with the Ribeye steak and the table ordered a variety of sides: lobster mac and cheese, creamed spinach, gnocchi, asparagus, and au gratin potatoes.  

Unfortunately, the highlight of my meal were a few of the sides.  I really enjoyed the lobster mac and cheese, the gnocchi, and creamed spinach, all of which were excellent.  But my steak left a little to be desired.  It was flavorfull, but the piece of meat simply had too much gristle.  I appreciate a bit of fat on my steak, but this piece of meat had just a bit too much on and I had to cut around quite a bit of my meal.  Based on the other reviews, it sounds like my experience may have been out of the ordinary, but from my experience, there are better places to try in LV.

Obviously Mastro's is really expensive but it's very much worth it. This is in Vegas so my friends and I didn't have time for dinner so we decided to go to the bar and have some appetizers.

Chopped Salad
Calamari
Lobster Mashed Potatoes

The chocolate covered strawberries are ridiculously good.

We ended up back at the bar the following night to do it all again. I wish I could remember both bartender's names but I can't. They were both great.

If you don't mind paying for great food the this is the place to go.

Tim was our lead server and he was the best !  We had 9 in our group celebrating 2 birthdays and an anniversary.  Starting dinner with 2 seafood towers best ever the variety of tastes served all of our palates!  Next the  Espresso Chocolate Martini was suburb, the steak, the sole and sides were excellent.   The dessert sinfully good. Especially, the butter cake.  
  When we go back we would skip some of the sides (just too much food). Otherwise atmosphere, food, service and experience was fantastic.

As a newer Yelper, this is only my second review and beyond deserved.  On our most recent trip to Las Vegas last weekend, my boyfriend and I ended up unexpectedly at Mastro's Ocean Club in Crystals inside City Center for the first time.  We go to Vegas quite a bit (about once every 2 months or so) and have passed by this place quite a few times.  

The interestingly constructed architecture of the main dining area has been quite the source of amusement to us in the past... it resembles something like the shell of a wooden submarine that has exit chutes above and below it to spit you out into Crystals when you are done with your meal (btw, this is a joke.  You do not get ejected from your seat.  It is only my strange sense of humor that comes up with this stuff).  My imaginative uses for the architecture aside, the design/layout is nice; it makes you feel as if the restaurant is floating in the middle of Crystals with a very open and airy feel.

As we were walking through Crystals on our way back to our hotel room at Aria from a long day of shopping, we decided to make an impromptu stop at the ejection submarine and see if there was any chance they would take us as walk-ins on a busy Friday night.  With it being such an upscale spot, I was sure we would either be turned away without a reservation or asked to wait for a ridiculous amount of time.  Au contraire!  They offered us immediate seating in the bar/lounge area or a few minute wait for the main dining room.  Since we felt a bit underdressed for the location, we opted for the bar/lounge area and were glad we did.  We had the perfect seat right next to the piano player and fiery red-headed chanteuse, who was pleasantly entertaining. 

We were promptly greeted by our amazing server, Sara.  The only reason I know her name is because I made sure to ask her for it when we were leaving as I knew I wanted to review this place.  Sara was so attentive, knowledgeable about menu, friendly, and always two steps ahead of us -  really as perfect as a server can get.  All of her recommendations were great as well.

I had the swordfish (I hadnt met my mercury quota for the month yet) and my boyfriend had the bone-in Ribeye.  We shared the most delicious side dish - the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi.  My swordfish paired very well with gnocchi and it was the perfect combo of light and creamy.  However, my boyfriend's Ribeye wasnt anything stellar.  It wasnt as flavorful as a most quality Ribeyes should be.  It's on our do-not-order-again list.  This is an "Ocean Club" though so maybe that was his error for ordering one of the few non-seafood options.  Now,  for the absolute BEST part of the meal.... THE MOST HEAVENLY DESSERT EVER - Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake.  Even if the rest of the meal and service had been horrible, which it was far from, I would have given this place 5 stars just for this dessert!  I dreamt about this cake the rest of our stay in Vegas and cant wait to go back again on our next trip just to have it.  This creation alone makes Mastro's Ocean Club one of my top 5 all-time favorite restaurants.  I would happily get ejected from this sea-faring vessel any time! ;)

Sorry for the ridiculously long review, but I had so much to comment on and didnt know where to shorten it.

MY ALL TIME FAVORITE RESTAURANT ON THE STRIP!  I bring my parents every year for their birthday & I go on my birthday as well!  The food is PHENOMENAL  & the service is even better!  The dungeness Crab Cocktail is AMAZING!  Oh & their Chilean Sea Bass is literally the BEST I've EVER had....if you get it pan seared, it literally just MELTS in your mouth!  Oh & their warm butter cake....simply to DIE for!

In a place where restaurant service is generally lacking (Las Vegas), Mastro's hits the ball out of the park!  This is top notch service (white & black napkin service, hot hand towel service between courses, sides served onto your dish at the table, crumbing, etc.).  Notables not to miss: the crab cocktail - TRUST ME.  OMG...already shelled WHOLE pieces of crab - and so many!!!  The cocktails are awesome - do not be scared by the $15-20 prices each, you get about 2.5 martini glasses full, since they leave the cocktail shaker with (a lot) more in there.  

We also had the escargot, which was a little (too) salty, even for this dish but still good and they made for a unique appetizer.  We had 3 different types of oysters, which were also good, but that is not really a refection on this restaurant since a raw oyster is a raw oyster...but they were very cold and served on a platter with dry ice, and accompanied by three different sauces, which was neat.  We shared the bone-in prime ribeye as an entree.  It was good, but Flemings is better, in our opinion.  Maybe we got a weird cut?  The dessert they brought out (complimentary) for my husband's birthday was the butter cake with ice cream.  It was excellent - my husband took that home and ate it in bed, like a heathen!  He even woke up and had some more the next day!!!  For a side, we had the lobster mashed potatoes... they were good and we are both glad we got them, but they were not worth $36, nor was there 1.5 pounds of lobster, as advertised.  That was a bit of a bummer, but we are still glad we got them once - still a tasty treat!  

Nothing was bad or even just OK - it was all good and points were extremely excellent - The real stand outs were the crab cocktail, the service, and the alcoholic cocktails - these were far and above other nice restaurants!  

We are so thrilled to have found this place (via a birthday gift for my husband from a friend) and are very much looking forward to coming back and trying some of the other yummy options on the menu!

Tips: ask to sit in the bird's nest.  You can share a steak and a few appetizers and have PLENTY.  we took our whole dessert and some of our steak home and we are both big eaters.  ORDER THE CRAB COCKTAIL!

My new favorite steak and seafood house in Las Vegas. 
Went again last night and had a magnifcent experience!

The manager, Scott, is a terrific guy.
Our server, Sylvia, was charming and attentive.
And the food...
How about a 32 oz bone-in ribeye!! OMG!
(I'm just getting out of the hospital now...had my blood cleaned.)

It was worth it.
That's why Crestor was invented.

Kind of a weird location in the atrium of an upscale mall, the food was terrific and service top notch. Best swordfish I've EVER had...in the middle of the desert, no less!  You won't get out of here cheap, but don't let the location deter you.

Unfortunately this was not one of those awesome Mastro's visits that everyone raves about. We've been to both Mastro's in OC and the one in LA and this was by far the least pleasant visit. We've also been to a lot of the high-end restaurants in LV and typically skipped Mastro's because we could get it easily when we lived in SoCal. But now that we live out of state, we were craving BUTTER CAKE!

When Mastro's called to confirm our reservations, we mentioned that we would be coming in straight form the airport, and they said it wouldn't be a problem to store our luggage during dinner. Upon arrival, they didn't have any room in the clutter closet behind the hostess stand. We brought our luggage to the dinner table which was slightly awkward but there was room.

We had two different main waiters and the service was a bit off. The appetizers were cleared from the table and placed on a stand next to us...not sure why they weren't just removed. Then the entrees came - we were warned about the hot plates but they were barely warm. I ordered the steak medium rare and parts of it was rare so I didn't eat it. It took a long time to flag down someone to get our dessert order. I had previously mentioned in my OpenTable reservation that we were celebrating a friend's birthday. Mastro's was very kind in bringing out a slice of chocolate cake for her with a message written on the plate. When the butter cake finally came out, it was also not very warm. We didn't finish the cake but it was still pretty delicious.

Maybe this experience was an anomaly or off night, but we won't be back soon. Even if the butter cake is divine.

We went to Mastro's on a Sunday early evening for dinner.  There were maybe three to four other tables occupied but other than that there was plenty of good seating available.  

Speaking of seating, I found the set up a little off-putting...we were seated at a two person table that butted directly against the back of a circular seating arrangement, which just so happened to contain 3-4 lovely active young children on this day.  Somehow your ability to enjoy a nice meal is a bit inhibited with a 5 year old staring at you from 1.5 feet away.  Perhaps it was our fault for not requesting one of the 50 odd other empty tables.

As other yelpsters have stated it is also a bit weird to be enjoying a $$$$ meal with Miley Cyrus cranking in the background due to the open seating overlooking/hearing the mall like Crystal Shops.  Enough nit picking though, on to the food!

Our server was very attentive and started us out promptly with ice water and tea.  Micro demerit for including a lemon in my iced tea after asking to hold the lemon, but no big deal.  Huge stars go out to the staff for keeping the beverages brimming full, a frequent problem for such an iced tea addict as myself.  The bread service came with enough to feed a small army.  Mini-loaves of sourdough, pretzel, bruschetta, and French.  

We ordered the Calamari ($15).  There was plenty for the two of us, lightly breaded and including a lemon side and a dipping sauce very similar to the Outback sauce you get with bloomin onions.  

Taking the "go big or go home" philosophy I decided to order the twin lobster tails ($69) AND 22 oz Ribeye ($55) for my entree.  My girlfriend ordered the sea bass ($50) and we split a side of lobster mashed potatoes ($38).  

The steak was wonderfully charred, cooked medium.   The server was nice enough to "de-shell" the lobster tails.  The lobster was perfectly cooked and delicious with melted butter.  The sea bass was also excellent.  I let my date enjoy the majority of the potatoes as they were a bit soupy due to the sauce but the small portion I had did taste good.  

We got the butter cake to go, not sure on the price, it came complete with detailed instructions on how to best prepare it from our server.  Final bill with tip $325.

Need to blow off that easy money you just took from the casinos and treat yourself to a neat dinner in a unique spot which calls out for attention the moment you walk into Aria?

Enter Mastro's, the ever popular chain of steaks that knows just how to let you indulge and live it large on a nice meal.  And as for pricing, it's actually pretty fair as you get a ton of great service, and most importantly, great food.  

The steak would be the only thing I get to be a snob about.  For instance, the meat was a little tough and although they've caramelized it, I can't but imagine thinking of how similar it tastes to Ruth's Cris.  But luckily, the other sides gave it supreme justice.

I got the bone in rib eye, at medium rare, so it should have been tender, but somehow wasn't.  The flavor was just buttery and I just wish there was more.  
Just to make things interesting, I turf'd it up with combination of jumbo shrimp scampi.  The amazing garlic sweltering sauce which had a parmesean bread crisp  reside next to made all the difference in the meal as the big shrimps were engulfed with flavor from the buttery garlic sauce.  

For sides, we shared the following:
-Roasted Brussel Sprouts - pretty basic, but satisfying
-Cream of Spinach - so damn heavy and big its a good thing we only limited ourselves to 2 sides only on top of our surfs.

Overall, I enjoyed my meal, but would I come back?  Probably not, or to any of the other locations for that matter at the time being.

I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. The location is weird to me. If you're all about s calm and tranquil atmosphere when you eat.....this is not the place. Service is super fast and super efficient. The kind of service I want when I go to Denny's. Not when I'm trying to enjoy a nice dinner. Like I said efficient but very rushed but I guess that is to be expected in Las Vegas! We split a filet and two lobster tails, sautéed asparagus and mushrooms, I had a bowl of lobster bisque. Asparagus was whatever, mushrooms were tasty, steak was perfect , lobster was too salty and not really fresh. Same with the bisque, it had a slight fishy odor. Lots of lobster and the flavor was good just not FRESH. Again, it's the desert so what did I expect? This was my first Mastro's experience, and while I wasn't disappointed, I wasn't too impressed. Satisfied. I would try the Beverly Hills location, but not again in Vegas.

My lovely girlfriend took me here for my birthday. Being a non-practicing Hindu, I hold a special love for a medium-rare steak. Our reservation was for 7:30PM and once we got there we were escorted to our table and seated promptly. It's a very busy place; so do reserve a table ahead of time.

Our server was very nice and professional. We ordered soups for starters, my girlfriend ordered clam chowder and I ordered the lobster bisque, both soups were delicious, especially the lobster bisque. Lobster bisque was cream and not too sweet and as an added bonus there were big piece of delicious lobster meat. 

After we were done with both soups we both ordered filet mignon. I went with 12 OZ. medium rare cut while my girlfriend went with 8 OZ. well done cut (sacrilege!!!). We also ordered creamed spinach, baked potatoes with cheese and sautéed asparagus. After a 20-25 minute wait we were served our delicious meal. The steak was exquisite, the seasoning was perfect and the meat was like butter. It melted in our mouth. The sides were also delicious, creamed spinach in particular complimented the steak well.  The only complaint of mine was that the baked potato had too much cheese on it, but everything else was amazing. 

I think this is best steak house I've been to in Las Vegas and if you are on the strip, then this is the place to go.

Visited for lunch last year.  Food quality is fantastic.  Great cocktail menu.  Would definitely try dinner when I have the chance.  Service was great, but restaurant was not busy when I was there.  The Beef Carpaccio as a starter is wicked!!  Big wine list also!!
Amazing service!!!! The food was to die for. I highly recommend me this restaurant. Anytime your in Vegas this spot is a must.
To summarize the menu: lobster mashed potatoes and warm butter cake. Whatever else you get doesn't really matter.

Stopped by for an anniversary dinner before watching Le Reve. Since it was Monday after Easter, it was easy to make a same day reservation for 5:30 pm. The place was pretty quiet then and around 6:30, more people started to come by so we definitely beat the dinner rush. Got a nice seat in the treehouse, with a view overlooking the Dior store downstairs.

Since we didn't want to be food comatose for our show later, we ordered just the petite filet, the regular filet, and a side of scalloped potatoes. I also ordered Coke, but beware that it's by the aluminum bottle and not with unlimited refills. The scalloped potatoes were rich and delicious, but the cheese was too much halfway through the side order. The meat was very tender and cooked to perfection. The medium was medium and the medium rare was just as it should be. Since it was our anniversary, they also brought by a complimentary slice of rich chocolate cake topped with raspberries and whipped cream. Overall a fantastic meal!

Best tasting food ever!! The shrimp cocktail are gigantic and delicious! The Caesar salad is very good. The clam chowder is amazing... But the only complaint I have is that either the waiters or the kitchen staff make a lot of mistakes with the steaks... It's either kinda undercooked or overcooked. I asked for a medium rare plus and they gave me a rare. They comped the steak because it was their error but it was just a shame I couldn't enjoy my steak. The butter cake there is amazing!! It's a must try for all!

Finally made it to Mastro's Ocean Club in Vegas, as I always go the my Newport Coast location..

Consistently delicious Mastro's quality and posh interior decor. Stellar service, bomb seafood tower, A5 wagyu was LICK!!!

The chic architectural design of the spiral dome nest inside The Crystals mall makes this an uniquely edgy location. I luv that it's next to Van Cleef & Arpels, Christian Louboutin, & Fendi. Eat, then shop to the 9s to work it off...

By the time the ice cream butter cake & choclate cake circulated, I was FBR (full beyond recognition).

Our group was sooo stuffed, we shut down the restaurant and literally popped out of our dresses.

Thanks goodness I wasn't wearing one of my Herve Leger dresses, hahaha LOL.

Excellent food, great service. Our food came out piping hot and perfectly cooked. The restaurant was busy (saturday night) but the service was not lacking. What made it even better was that my friend Rick paid with his winnings from gambling. No complaints here...

Came in here for dinner and all i can say is WoW. First, the service is outstanding. Second the Petite Filet was so well prepared you did not even need a knife. The flavor was amazing, as were the sides we order. You definitely get what you pay for here..worth every penny

I had an exceptional meal here this past weekend. As always, my eyes are always greedy and I order more than I could ever eat. I ordered the following: 1) clam chowder was delicious, however, it could have used more clams. 2) crab cakes were one of the better crab cakes I've had. Plenty of crab meat! 3) Gorgonzola Mac n Cheese was outstanding 4) lobster mash potatoes was good but nothing special except the few pieces of lobster added to it 5) snap peas are in season and always worth ordering 6) rack of lamb was cooked to perfection and I really enjoyed it 7) can't leave Mastro's without ordering some butter cake:) 8) Mr Michael provided us with exceptional table service:)

Fiancé and I been here a couple of times and we absolutely loved it. staff is friendly and professional. I don't like to dress up so everytime I go to fancy places I get stereotyped service if you will. Not this place, both times I was treated nice. We had the seafood tower, ribeye, lamb chops, and buttercake. for the place they're striving to be I must say all expectations were met. Service, ambiance and food was top notch. 

If I had to say something negative...maybe the restrooms being upstairs. Lol after all the food I ate I don't wanna be going on stairs but they do have a elevator.

OH wow how could I forget to make a review for this place?! LONG overdue this review is for March.... I was celebrating my 21st birthday you know in LAS VEGAS duh! Hahaha, my boyfriend made reservation for my birthday dinner on a Sunday night this was last minute because we wanted to stay in Vegas longer hahaha , we usually go to the one in Orange County because we are from California. 

OH wow this Mastros is GORGEOUS! Make sure to ask for a seat in the bird-nest!! 

Food - BEST BEST BEST Lamb racks ever!!! Ugh I had it medium rare but it came out more rare but I didn't mind. Ever bite taste like butter. Boy friend has the New York Steak - This wasn't so bad, I couldn't stop thinking about how good my lamb racks were that I can't remember if this was super good or not hahaha. We had a side of Mac and Cheese too greasy, would not order this I think we prefer the Lobster Mash potatoes instead. 

Service was wonderful! Better service than we had in Orange County. Everyone was nice, and even the manager came to ask if everything was fine. 

In the end of the meal our server ask if we wanted any dessert but we were super full for any. But he still came out and surprise me with a birthday cake! He even wrote " Happy 21st birthday. " Which I think is very special to me!  

THANK YOU MASTRO'S LAS VEGAS!

My favorite place to dine in Las Vegas!

(1) Service - I forgot his name but awesome, awesome server! Best service ever. He was hot too! Drools! 5 stars for amazing service and seating me with a hot server.

(2) Seafood Tower - massive shrimp, king crab, lobster, three types of oysters, and massive mouth jizzy. 

(3) Bone-In Ribeye - mouth jizz... must get! 5 stars

(4) Lobster Mash Potato - one of my favorite dishes. Drenched in BUTTER... yum! 5 stars

(5) Asparagus - well cooked! 5 stars!

(6) Bone Marrow - 5 stars!

(7) Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi - 5 stars

(8) Birthday Chocolate Cake - I got this for free... so sweet of them... but it wasn't my birthday... I think they gave it to the wrong person.

(9) Coffee - a little weak... I wanted a strong one... so I can get ready for the clubbb... yeahhhhh... woots!

OVERALL** Yup! That was all for 2 people... haha! I eat a lot! Massive bill... but worth every of my penny!

I like this one better than the one in Newport. *gasp*

The one in Newport is kind of dark / crowded and while this one is technically in a mall, I like the setting better. 

The menu is identical I think. Very good. I like the scallops. I like the lemon drop. Great food. Great service. This restaurant is beautiful. I like the CityCenter overall and Mastro's is a great part of it.
THE best food I've ever had. Filet, white fish special, lobster mash, truffle gnocchi... Service was on point. Very classy. We planned a proposal in the treehouse and it was perfect

Great Spot! Been to the one in AZ and this was just as good. Great service, great food! The bar area has a great look and the light entertainment was enjoyable. Will consider going back next time in Vegas!

I'm being critical here. The Mastros in Costa Mesa, Ca, is my favorite steak house anywhere. The Mastros Ocean Club in Laguna Beach has an awesome coastal location. This Mastros is in a mall. Enough said.
Simply wonderful ! Best dinning experience ever ! Such attention to details  and needs of customers :) I will be back very soon !!!!
My husband ordered the New York steak. The steak was excellent. We really enjoyed the dinner and will be back.

Love this place - usually go to the Ocean Club in Newport Coast.

Seafood tower was received and eaten.  Fantastic.  Love the dry ice steaming down the table.

Dinner - split the wagyu tomahawk chop.  It was huge, but delicious.

Dessert - butter cake...don't bother with anything else.

With all the 5 star reviews, I was expecting to get wowed by this place.

The restaurant is pretty cool looking, and the waitstaff was excellent though the hostesses were not very hospitable.

There were 4 of us dining here and we thought the food was not very good.  Bland!!!

I had the bone-in ribeye which is the only steak I order and the flavor was just bland. Another person ordered the Chilean sea bass and we both agreed that it simply lacked flavor.  The lobster mashed potatoes did not taste good to all 4 of us.

The only thing I enjoyed there was the pretzel bread and their warm butter cake.
This restaurant is truly exquisite in every detail. The food preparation is always perfection times 10. Ask for George, the epitome of a White Tux - extemely gracious waiter!

I live in Chicago and have been to many fine dining restaurants. The Mastros in Chicago is my absolute favorite place to eat. I went to Las Vegas and noticed they also had a Mastros so I naturally made sure I go. There is no way I could actually like Mastros any more than I already do right? Wrong! Mastros Ocean Club was even better than the high bar that the Chicago location set. Aside from world class food, Tanya and Juan, who waited on me, were the absolute best servers I have ever had. They know the restaurant food very well and its almost amazing how they know almost every ingredient used in every dish. They also gave me great recommendations for the rest of my time in Vegas and were just overall great servers. Not only does Mastros have some of the best quality food around, and the ambiance is second to none, but Tanya and Juan made it such a great time that I can not wait to see them again this upcoming February! No matter what you will love Mastros but if they are working, make sure you sit with Juan and Tanya for a truly exceptional dining experience!!!

I took my boyfriend to Mastros for his birthday as a surprise and both of us thoroughly enjoyed the entire evening! He said his porterhouse was one of the best steaks he ever had and we have dined all over the world. I had the Blackened Salmon and it was delicious! The only negative I have  is the scalloped potatoes were over cooked. The service and atmosphere were excellent.  The butter cake was incredible and served with ice cream and whipped cream that was phenomenal! We will be returning!

This place was unbelievable front the time we walked into the time we left the service was great. The food was perfect  as well. I got a steak that was perfect. The lobster  mashed potatoes were great as well. They are for sure a must try.

**This review is for the bar area only**

I've heard many great things about this restaurant, and after reading other Yelp reviews I decided what better time to try this place out than my birthday? And what better way than sitting at the bar, and partaking of some artistically created adult beverages?

For starters this place is located smack in the middle of the Crystals Mall, you can't miss it. It's the big wooden orb shaped thing that seams to be floating in the center of all the action. It's pretty neat, but as other reviews mentioned, I'm not sure I'd want to spend $200+ on a dinner with a mall atmosphere. None the less it's quite a unique experience and they did a great job (at least in the bar area) of making sure their music drowned out most of the mall sounds.

I knew the drinks here would be pricey so I was prepared for it, but for others it may be a shocker. They have an extensive list of specialty drinks starting at $16, but most are $18. I was told their in-house specialty was a lemon drop which came over dry ice, I didn't actually try it though. I did try the Chocolate Martini ($18)- which won me over because of the giant chocolate covered strawberry on the side of the glass. It truly was dessert in a martini glass! Other views were correct, when you order a martini they give you the shaker along with your drink so you can refill your glass, it's almost like 2 drinks in 1. I also tried the Banana Foster ($18), it was delicious but not what I expected. It has whipped cream, I expected it on top but it was shaken inside and gave the drink a bit of a lumpy texture.

The bf tried the Mastro's Mojito (also $18) and it honestly was not very good, it  came served in a tall glass so there was no shaker on the side. I wouldn't recommend ordering this one. His mom tried the Dragon Fire ($18), which as very tasty, but yes it was hot/spicy - not something to quench your thirst. She rounded off her evening with the Flur de Blu ($18), one I was considering as well. She liked it, but after I tried it I was glad I went with the dessert-style drinks instead.

The service was good. The bar wasn't busy so we had as much attention as we wanted. We were able to watch them make our drinks and that was a fun part of the experience. We saw all kinds of great food coming out of the kitchen so we asked for a food menu, we elected not to order anything since we'd already been there a while and run up a tab of $100. However one bar tender offered to bring us a bread basket. The bread was great and the basket came with several different types of bread, and super soft butter. Note to self for next time: ask for the bread basket when you arrive, it's free.

I think I'll drop in some time again, when I'm in the mood for a dessert martini and can afford the $18 drinks.
As always, Maestros is on point. The blue cheese Martin, lobster mashed potatoes, and the 12 oz steak, medium rare.

hey this place aint too shabby.   Yea its located inside city center aka the shopping mall.  Yea the noise outside the restaurant can get loud what do you expect from a restaurant literally located in the center of the mall?

anywho heres the review----

highlight of the night has to be the awesome lounge singer.  He did a standout job as we were waiting for our table to be seated.

Kindly took our request for Rick Astley "Never Gonna Give You Up"

AKA 'Rick Roll'd'   Did a fantastic job.

For that the restaurant gets the full 5 star it deserves.

Oh the food?  it was good I had a rack of lamb that was outstanding!  Besides that the lounge singer stole the show! BOoooo yah!

Cool place to enjoy a nice dinner with friends. Upscale experience without a ton of fuss. Awesome servers who know their stuff. Very cool structure in the middle of Crystals that almost makes you forget you're in the middle of a bougie mall. Went with a group of 6 and everyone's food looked great. I got a Spicy Mambo Salad and would probably skip it next time, only because it's just a caesar salad, sans croutons with a hint of wasabi. Kinda boring, but not worth losing a star over. Sweet potato fries are bomb, as are the mac & cheese and mashed sweet potatoes. DO NOT SKIP THE BUTTER CAKE. Thank me later.

Forget about reservation, still waiting after 40 mins past my reserved time. Very rude hostess kept lying about our table will be ready soon, manager was nice enough to offer free drinks for waiting. 
Then after almost 1 hour of waiting we were finally seated, but now more waiting for our waiter to help us and after that 1 hour of waiting for food.  My friend ordered medium and the steak came out well done, again the manager offers free dessert for their mistake.  Our reservation was 7:30 and we were there until almost 11, the whole time I felt like one of my ex girlfriend (always bitching).  Horrible experience even with the free drinks and dessert.

Yummie!  This place was great. There was 9 of us for dinner for a friend's birthday, our table was ready and waiting for us when we arrived, they allowed us to decorate the table, the service was awesome, their menu includes steak & seafood so everyone could order whatever they wanted.  The restaurant was very busy I must say and every table had cocktails on it, both are good signs for me.

They have tons of steaks to choose from, lamb, vanilla fried lobster, scallops, and tons of fish. My only confusion came from how the fish was actually prepared b/c there wasn't really on the menu explaining how you can get your fish cooked. After asking the waitress, she explained the 5 fish preparations.

Here's what we ate:
1) Sashimi tower -white fish, Tuna, lobster rolls all very good [see pix]
2) Heirloom tomatoes and burrata salad-very tasty and tons to share
3) Escargot-my favorite very very good [see pix]
4) Creamed Corn-typically not a fan but I did enjoy this very much
5) Brussels Sprouts-eh they are good for you
6) Mac n blue cheese-yes for sure
7) Halibut Oreganata - almost $50, but was a huge piece of fish, definitely could share this
8) the fried lobster was another one of my favorites
9) tuna tostadas again very good [see pix]

I wanted to try the crab cake but didn't have any room left. We had more leftovers in bags then arms to carry them on.

Other notable notes: waiters were exceptional with their service of our table, my glass of Veuve was never empty and the waiter was calling me by name the whole time :).
Our bill was over a grand after everything was said and done. So it's on the pricer side.

Excellent ,  fun and friendly!. 
Nice tuna.  
Superb entertainment .  Piano and singer.
