Totally Overrated, We were looking for "the best Chilean Seabass in las vegas" since we are lovers of that delicious, buttery and tasty fish, and we decided to go fancy and chose mastros for their excellent reviews, the attention is perfect, the service is super nice, their wine list is spectacular, we ordered the ahi tuna tartar... frozen tuna, kinda tasteless, I would rate it a 6 out of 10, and after that we ordered the truffle king crab gnocchi... that is the best I've ever had! 
And we ordered the Chardonnay to make a nice pairing with the Chilean seabass... we chose the pan seared crust, which we love! But this time they actually served it as a shoe sole, completely fibrous, Tasteless, horrible... I complained and the waitress kindly changed it to us, second try was grilled... and it was raw and frozen on the inside.... AWFUL yet uncomfortable to eat that fish raw! They gave us the butter cake (awesome cake!!!!) as a gift but they charged the Chilean seabass.... that was the worse $150 and luxury night wasted for a seabass diner. 
The restaurant is amazing, but the food Is just okay, never would recommend it as the best Chilean seabass in any place.

Saturday 6pm reservation for 5 before a show. 
Neat sculpture overhead and high end shops all around us in the Crystals mall. 

People don't know what to wear. Mix of little black dresses, spandex, sport coats n jeans. 

Couple rounds of cocktails which are fast n strong. Bread was great as described on yelp.  Service was spot on. Lots of people refilling water n clearing plates. 
Start with vanilla shrimp, calamari n tuna tartar.  Nothing spectacular but not my choices. 
Ordered spinach salad n 8 oz filet medium. It's a little too rare for me but good. 3 other steaks, but wife orders some fish that flew in on our plane with us. I'm not sure why you come from the gulf to the desert n order fish.  I guess nothing is local in Vegas but snake. 
Sides were cream spinach (not as good as mine), Brussel sprouts (excellent) and gnocchi which was amazing. Add 4 wines by the glass. 
 
We were tempted with butter cake but held off. 
$633 before tip.
Amazing place to enjoy a great meal. There is NOTHING about this place that isn't top notch. Service, food, drinks,atmosphere. All 5 stars
Delicious food and great looking restaurant. Servers were extremely attentive and friendly. Overall, great restaurant. Would definitely go again for a special occasion.

This is one of the best restaurants on the strip.  The wait staff is outstanding, the food is terrific and overall they give the impression that they care about everything.  There were five of us having dinner and everyone thought the restaurant was outstanding and most of all memorable.

When in Vegas, you gotta do it right and Mastro's is well...doing it right.

Mastro's Ocean Club is owned by the same very popular chain steakhouses but focuses more on a seafood selection. It's located right in the Crystals shopping center in City Center. 

I came here with a group of 9 and we were able to be seated in the treehouse (ballin!). Food was great. I had the bone in ribeye and but also nibbled on a chilean sea bass as well. Both were delicious. The sides rocked as well with the wasabi mashed potatoes being my favorite. 

Overall a great dining experience, highly recommend!
I love the food here, especially the mac and cheese.  The service was horrible.  I will never come back here again.
Fav steakhouse chain. Lobster mash a must. Any steak with bone-in a must. Top notch service. Located inside mall. Less stuffy then other locations.

My husband and I went to Mastros after it was highly recommended by my boss, and listening to Mark & Brian from KLOS go on and on how great this place is.  Well, they were not joking.  Had an absolutely fabulous dinner,  We both ordered the Bone in Fillet, melted in my mouth, this was the most Delicious steak I have ever had.  Ordered the side of cream corn, which we shared, excellent once again.  The ending was the best, as it was our anniversary, Michael our waiter( he was awesome!) brought us Mastros signature butter cake, to die for!!  The service was suburb, from the hostess who sat us, to our awesome waiter.  We will definitely be back (soon I hope!)

The restaurant is located in a mall which doesn't usually scream fine dinning. However the food and service are excellent. I would suggest the seafood tower! You pick from a large selection of fresh seafood. Comes out smoking with dry ice.

I decided on this place for my boyfriends birthday because he loves steak and I love seafood. He tried to convince me to go somewhere cheaper but I wouldnt allow it. At first I was not a fan of our server- took about 15 minutes to get menu's and an introduction. I think he heard me bitching about it because after that he went out of his way to attend to us. He was an odd fellow but he was trying very hard. I am a sucker for expensive glasses of wine and love it when a restaurant offers such- The server gave a very on point description of the wine I ordered. For entree I had the sea bass and my boyfriend had steak- something with a bone in it- I guess the rib eye? Im not sure about that as I dont eat beef...I was loving my sea bass until my darling mentioned that his steak was extremely salty...and in that moment I noticed that mine was also extremely salty...and I LOVE salt. The sea bass was cooked to perfection and was so flaky and delicious with just the perfect amount of crust on the outside. But- it was almost too salty to eat. My boyfriend said the same thing about the steak- that it was perfectly cooked and a great piece of meat but too salty to really enjoy. 

Overall the meal cost me an arm and at least 2 legs...Service B+, Wine A+, Entree C, Bread A+, Price for what you get C+.

A snobby Canadian boy took me to the Mastro's Ocean Club. The conversation didn't go that well and he was as full of himself as he could be. Luckily, the delicious food and wine made up for the sour date.

We started with the oysters (Blue Points I think). They were fresh and delicious. We then shared the seared scallops and bone-in fillet mignon as our main dishes. The scallops were cooked perfectly. They were a bit creamy for my taste but overall a solid dish. The bone-in fillet mignon, omg, was soooo good, probably the best steak I've had in the US. The meat was tender yet full of flavor. I was in heaven and couldn't care much less about whatever Mr. Snobby was barking about. 

Oh and we shared crab gnocchi as the side dish (with a price tag of $30, a bit steep for a side dish.) I also had a glass of Pinot Noir (ZD '09) to go with the steak - the wine didn't have enough body, but it went very well with the meat. 

I knocked off one star because they served the scallops and the steak at the same time in the same plate, which I really didn't like. I would prefer having them separately. The scallops should have come first and then the steak as two individual courses. This way I could have really taken my time to taste each dish. 

Overall, I really liked this restaurant. As for my date, I found out he wasn't all that annoying anyways. He was kinda cute and was quite thoughtful when I wasn't feeling well at the end of the meal. I may come back to the Mastro's next time I am in Vegas. Will I go out with Mr. Snobby again? I think so.
Wonderful food, don't miss the pretzel rolls & not that expensive for lunch.

We live in LV, and eat all the time at the high end strip restaurants.  This is probably the easiest 5 star rating I have ever given.  Everything was fantastic, and I went in with very high expectations.  A friend recommended, and said it was one of the best steaks in LV.  I was not disappointed. Steak had terrific flavor, and melted in your mouth.  Drinks, appetizers, main courses, sides, and desserts - all were simply fantastic.  We also loved the atmosphere, and our waiter was excellent.  We will certainly return.

This is top notch dining. Located in Crystals at Aria on the 2nd level. Five of us came to celebrate a birthday last night and we requested the "tree house". This is a wooden structure which almost floats in the air, very unique for sure. 

We were seated in the center and were lucky enough to get Paul as our waiter. Paul is everything in a waiter you could ever ask for. Knowledgeable, very attentive, funny and yet professional giving us excellent service during our meal. 

He was helpful when selecting wines as well as explaining the menu. I ordered the dungeness crab cocktail and the 22 oz bone-in ribeye. I love seafood and was planning on the seabass but couldnt resist the ribeye. Our table split sides of gorgonzola mac & cheese, creamed spincach and Gnocci with alaskan king crab. 

The crab cocktail was excellent. Served in a dish with 2 sauces and dry ice it comes out smoking. It was about 10 large pieces of crab ($28). The ribeye was also very good ($58), although a tad to fatty for me. It had good marbling like a ribeye should but parts were a bit too fatty. 3 of us ordered our steaks medium rare and they all came out rare. Beware they do tend to undercook  a bit, but we all finished them as the meat was so good. 

The gorgonzola mac and creamed spinach ($14) were both really good. We were a little disappointed with the gnocci however ($33). I found very little king crab in the dish but the flavor was there. For dessert we ordered 3 of Mastro's famous butter cakes which come with vanilla ice cream. 

Paul was nice enough to personalize one of the plates with a "happy birthday" written in chocolate. The butter cakes were awesome (and quite large). They can easily be split  between two or three people. 

Mastro's provided us an excellent meal with outstanding service. The steaks could have been cooked a little longer but with that being about the only flaw the 5 stars are well deserved.

We had our New Year's Eve dinner here. I requested a seat with a view inside the treehouse/nest and they complied! I was pleasantly surprised. Our server was great and attentive, and we had to stop ourselves from eating all the fresh bread. 
We weren't overly hungry so we shared a larger filet mignon. It was decent, but it wasn't as tender as others I've had before. The stone crab was delicious and I'd want to try their sea bass on a future visit. My bf has a sweet tooth, so we ordered sorbet for dessert. We got three of the largest scoops we've ever seen in our life! I joked for that size they should've given us one of each flavor instead of making us pick one. We only finished one scoop.

To me just the architecture of the place alone is magnificent. First time I visited the City Center I was blown away by this very spectacular  structure. When I found out there is a restaurant inside I knew I have to try it.

On one of my visits to Sin City I was lucky enough to experience the remarkable dinning from above. 
We shared the Chopped salad. Yeah, you are thinking "out of the colorful selection, really?" But it was marvelous. So flavorful and fresh. 

And then Rack of lamb medium rare followed. Ahhhh,,,,, it came on super hot plate the whole rack in one piece. We cut through the meat which was on rare side and finish cooking it on the hot plate. The result  flavor of the dish was beyond extraordinary. Best rack of lamb ever.

Atmosphere great, music decent, waiters nice and well knowledge  of menu and wine.

What a wonderful evening! When I initially called to make the reservation I had a warm welcoming voice on the other end. 

Upon arriving I was a little unsure because I didn't realize it was inside the mall, I immediately didn't know what to expect. I have been to the one in Newport Beach, Scottsdale and Palm Springs, all fabulous of coarse. 

Hostess looked well groomed, acted professional and was very inviting and seemed happy to have us dine. 

Server Lionel was Amazing, Made great dinner suggestions. I had the Strawberry Mule to drink, Bone In Filet for dinner, My husband had the Lobster and we shared scallop potaoes and sauted asparagus. ( All sides are ala carte and are shareable for the table) 

Only downfall was there was a problem with the scallop potatoes, within seconds a manager by the name of Brandon was there, took it away and offered garlic mash potatoes in place , until new ones were ready. Nice recovery, and made the situation forgotten. When the new ones came it was PERFECT!

At the end of our meal our server Lionel and Manager Brandon came by again and apologized for the mishap and brought us a complimentary dessert which is there signature dessert, The Warm Butter Cake. All I can say is OMG!!! Best thing ever. 

It was a beautiful experience, Great food, service and atmosphere. Food was spaced out and timed perfectly. Excellent job chefs! I am defiantly going back next time we go to LV. 

A restaurant that runs this smoothly from back of the house to front is all from great leadership. Kudos to whoever is in charge, keep it up because your doing it right!

Visited January 2016

I have had the chance to visit Mastro's Ocean Club twice and both times were equally wonderful. Everything from the wait staff, ambiance and the food are all beyond amazing. 

Their service is probably as good as it gets. The hostesses are all very friendly in their greetings when you arrive. The wait staff is very attentive. I felt like I never had to flag someone down, there was always someone readily available. 

The energy in the restaurant is very nice. There was live music being played on a piano which helped to set the tone. The restaurant itself is set up in a modern tree house space located inside of the Crystal's shopping center. There is nice colorful lighting that helps set off the dark woods of the tree house and white table cloths of Mastro's.

The food though is the real star of the show. I had the 12oz filet and it was phenomenal. It was cooked exactly the way I like it. Perfectly seasoned. The other member of my party had the bone in rib eye which was just massive. The sides we ordered were more than enough to share. The side portions are a meal in themselves. Their mac & cheese is a must have! So are their sea salt & vinegar fries. If possible, save room for dessert. Their signature butter cake is by far one of the best desserts that I have ever had on the Las Vegas strip. I was lucky enough to receive a complimentary cake from the manager, so if I could, they would get an extra bonus star just for that.

All in all, Mastro's is a definite must visit. It's great for special occasions or even business dinners. It will become one of your new standards for what you expect in a restaurant.

My fiance, Shanyce and I  went to Mastros during our vacation around Christmas time and had a wonderful experience.  We eat at the Palm Desert  Mastros often and had to try out the Vegas location. Our server, Sam, made our experience even better. 
We had a great time.

1.) The wait staff was inattentive. 
2.) Sommelier (via waitress) brought out the wrong bottle of wine.
3.) Lamb was medium well when asked for medium rare.
4.) Swordfish was raw and under seasoned.

Front and back of the house need help.

Saving the best for last, and it does get better (hence the 5 stars!)

After booking a reservation here on OpenTable, I arrived on the date of my reservation to be UNgreeted (I'm using it, English fanatics!) by the *two* associates in the front.  Both were busy with other, more important things I suppose.

But then, finally, attention was given.  They couldn't locate my reservation, and then finally found it to let me know it was the next night, not the night I arrived.  I was noticeably upset, as I had even received an email from OpenTable to confirm my reservation.  (I guess it was an OpenTable error somehow though... and have since had other OT issues).

Fortunately, they were accommodating in squeezing me and my boyfriend in on a busy Friday night. We got a great spot even - but then I suppose not many seats at this small restaurant wouldn't have a nice "view".   You're in a bird cage overlooking all of the shoppers!

Throughout the entire meal, attention was not lacking.  You're pretty much pampered here, and every.single.associate is ON IT.  

Are you about to take a picture of your group? Not without assistance from a waiter.  

Had more than a few sips of water?  It'll be refilled practically instantaneously.

So, the service once seated was impeccable. 

Drinks - very reasonable for vegas, and they do it right. No dilution here.

Food:

Complimentary Bread:  Well, I had already known just how good their pretzel bread was from former visits in the O.C., and while the Las Vegas pretzel bread was slightly harder, it was still delicious.

Mushrooms:  Infused with something magical.  Seriously, savored every single bite of these. Hands down, the greatest mushrooms that have ever met my taste buds.

Mac & Cheese:  Ridiculously cheesy.  Cheese with pasta, with more cheese, with a blanket of cheese melted on top of it.  And surprisingly good as a left over too.  

Steak:  Filet Mignon.... no sauce needed, no seasoning needed.  The cut of meat was flawless and perfectly tender.  

Dessert:  I did say I was saving the best for last, and this was it.  Butter cake, all the way. Moist cake accompanied with vanilla ice cream... sounds traditional but they've got a recipe that will leave every bite ending with Oohs and Aaahs.  The house-made whipped cream came in a massive pile, and then some.

Nothing less than the best! Each and every time we have dined @ Mastros we have been treated impeccably! Sam is by far my favorite waitress! She took care of us with attention to detail compared to none. The steaks are perfect and the warm butter cake is a must have on each visit! Fit for a queen!

been a few times and the vanilla crusted twin lobster tails are still amazing
also some of the best seared ahi I have ever had
great location inside crystals in the city center
look for the giant wood shaped tree house hovering in the air....thats it!!!

Worst dining experience of my life. Came with the family for my son's 21st birthday. Reservation was at 10:00. Main course didn't come out until 2 1/2 hours later. Service was horrible. Food was barely mediocre. I wouldn't recommend this abomination of a restaurant to anyone. I am usually pretty easygoing. I can't even remember the last time I even complained about a meal. Our reservation was at 10:00pm.  We sat in the bar and had drinks until our table was ready at 10:30. We sat down and our server took our drink order while we looked over the menus. The drinks came in short order and then the fun began. We ordered several appetizers, salads and our main courses. The appetizers included tuna so our server told us that he would bring those first since they came out quickly and he wanted them to be fresh for us. They did come out first. About a half hour later. An hour into our meal we were still waiting for our salads. Our server was off working the cash register. I couldn't get his attention so I got up and went over and asked when our salads would arrive. He looked at me like I had two heads and said he didn't know we wanted them out so quickly after our appetizers. Mind you we were now over an hour into our meal and had long since eaten the appetizers which were so so. They finally showed up a half hour later. I got up again and asked to speak to the general manager. The server told me it was all his fault but I insisted on speaking to the person in charge. Eventually someone came up who introduced himself as the assistant manager. He apologized profusely, told us that section of the dining room was running slow and what could he do to help. I said please send out our meals. He looked at me quizically and asked if I really wanted my food to come out right away since we still seemed to be into our salads. I said yes just bring the food. He said right away. A half hour later our meals had not yet arrived. I found our server and told him that most of us had lost out appetites since we were so upset with the service. We wanted to cancel our food. All except the birthday boy who still wanted his steak dinner. It finally came out. He had ordered it medium. It was charred nicely on the outside but when he cut into it, it was so raw I swear I saw the slab of meat start to squirm. We had to send it back. It came back and was cooked to the right temperature. My son took a bite and said it was OK. Some tried a bite and agreed it was very mediocre. He finished and we left. The impression we left with was that they thought we made far too much of our service. In fact we had assumed that the reason the assistant manager came over was that the general manager was not working that night. Not true. She was the woman with the walkie talkie hovering about in the background we later found out. She never once came over and and seemed to have no interest in trying to help us out. Please people, if you have any compassion, boycott Mastros. HORRIBLE!!!

I will keep this short and simple. 
Service - awesome. Everyone, and I mean everyone, is so nice and attentive! 
Dining area- we requested to be seated in the wooden weavy basket area. Love the layout. This is a nice place if you wanted to do a business dinner! (We were just a party of two though)
Appetizer- Dungeness crab cocktail. Okay. I am spoiled by Seattle's seafood so I have high expectations. Yes. The crab is good. Cold and refreshing. However for $25 dollars I rather have tried something else as I can get much more up north. However it was good. 
Steak- bone in filet was their signature so that's the one we chose. I think they cooked it exactly the way we wanted. Medium rare. It was tender and it was good, but not melt in your mouth fantastic. It was overshadowed by (dun dun dun) the fish!!! 
Seafood- Chilean sea bass. I got it the "arreganato" way. I probably butchered the word too. Holy crap this was amazing. It melted in your mouth and left you wondering where the heck it went so you just kept going back for more. 
Sides: thanks to the yelper who gave the advice to get half the amt of gnocchi. Omg this is soooo good. The truffle oil just perfected it. Best gnocchi ever!!
Lobster mashed potatoes was a huge portion (had to take it to go!) I am not really a mashed potato or lobster fan but my bf is and he really liked it so definitely try one of these sides. 
Didnt have room for dessert but we really wanted to try the butter cake. Lame. Next time! 
Overall a good experience but expect to cough up some serious $$$. Try the fish!!!

Can't go wrong here! This is one of the hot spots in LV. It's right in the middle of an upscale mall and has a nice buzz  to their energy level. The food is really on point but know ahead of time, everything is a la carte. I ordered the filet mignon which was prepared medium-rare. It was pink in the center, tender, tasty and really filling. Our group ordered an individual plate and then we shared the sides we ordered. No quality was spared by the chefs and we indulged like kings! 

It's on the higher end of the price range but it will make your trip to Las Vegas memorable and delightful.

I brought clients here on a Thursday evening for dinner around 800 pm. I recommend reservations since  the place gets busy. My clients who arrived from Denver around a year ago and never experienced Mastro's previously so I knew they were in for a treat.

We started off with drinks at the table  once we were  seated and were brought the awesome bread basket -  I indulged in the pretzel bread yum! We ordered a few appetizers - scallops, crab cakes and ordered our starter salads. I opted for just the 1/2 salad of the iceberg wedge - it's plenty large and so yummy. For my main entree I went for he rack of lamb and we shared several twice cooked potatoes and cream spinach. Everything was spectacular and the service was stellar! My lamb was cooked to perfection and  my clients were impressed as I expected. The only con was nobody had room for buttercake!

I received a telephone call from Mastrro's the following day thanking me for my business which again is so out of the box. I'm happy to see even with the change of ownership that nothing has changed here!

In the mall at Aria lies a bird house made of wood that serves great steak. We came here with a reservation made on Open Table for a pre-show dinner for a birthday. It's pricey but the steaks are worth it. I read the sides are massive, they were decent. Enough for 2 people in my opinion. I had the bone-in filet and it was delicious. My partner had a grilled fish and it was fresh and tasty. The sauteed spinach was full of garlicky goodness and the asparagus was cooked to perfection. The big bread basket had lots of choices and the chocolate cake was great. The service was impeccable and our waiter was very knowledgable. The only downfall is the location. It's so odd to be at a high-end restaurant in a mall, even if it is a very high-end mall.

I really don't get what the hype is. My husband went here with his friends on his bachelor party and said it was sooo good so he had to take me. I don't know if when I went, I just got the wrong thing or what, but I got the ribeye steak and it was just average. It was not as good as some of the steak I've had in the past and it was very heavy. I have heard the bone in filet mignon is very good but have not been able to try it yet. The sides are okay as well. It's a very roudy restaurant and the ambience is not that great because it kind of floats atop a shopping area. It was not as good as everyone had been raving about.

What a disappointment!! Started with the escargot they came out dry and burnt.  ordered the New York steak, the ribeye, the Gorgonzola Mac & cheese and the sautéed mushrooms the steaks were comparable to Ruth Chris. The side dishes were bland the Gorgonzola Mac and cheese had no Gorgonzola it tasted like something that came out of a box! The mushrooms had no flavor I don't get the hype.

My husband & I chose this spot to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and we are still reeling from the experience!!  Absolutely one of our best dining experiences EVER!!
For starters, we requested Mike R as our server due to the many good things we read here and he didn't disappoint. Made our dinner and all round experience very memorable. 
Everyone made us feel so special from the hostess to the busboys. 
Oh, the food!!  We knew the portions were reportedly large and Mike encouraged us to order half portions. We had half Spicy Mambo Salad - Caesars salad with horseradish and wasabi - really yummy with a nice kick to it and lots of chunks of Parmesan. We loved it!
My husband had the 12 oz filet and I had the 12 oz bone-in filet. Both were done to perfection and very flavorful. 
Mike suggested ordering only one side to split. My husband can't resist fresh fries, especially with steak, so we got the salt & vinegar fries. They were so good and so addictive, we couldn't stop eating them even though we were stuffed. 
Then came dessert!  Special occasions get comp dessert here, but Mike went over and above for us as he said he had never served anyone celebrating a 40th wedding anniversary before. We not only got the warm butter cake with ice cream and a hugh side dish of fresh made whipped cream (and yes it is every bit as good as reported), he added 4 hugh chocolate covered strawberries and 2 glasses of an amazing appertif- Michele Chiarlo Nivole. 
A truly awesome evening we will never forget!  Oh, and they called us the next day to thank us for coming!
We can't wait to return.

Whenever we dine here, my tummy and my brain thank me..After a disappointing dinner at the RM Seafood last sunday../for my hubby s B-day/, we decided to visit our friend..Mastro at Crystals ...I called to make a reservation and was greeted by Sarah which was super nice and helpful.My husband and i were wearing shorts and that was not a problem for the restaurant's attire.
We started with a bottle of Pinot Noir and of course the bread basket. 
For appetizer we ordered the shrimp cocktail /all clean,deveined properly/ and the steamed mussels..let me tell ya..the shrimps are super jumbo..i took 4bites out of one shrimp..the mussels are delicious  with that tasty wine reduction ..actually just that by itself is an entree .
For entree we shared the seared scallops and a steak with a side of fries.. The portions are perfect ..but we got full after the steamed mussels so had to take the rest 'to go' ...
Also, if u have a special occasion, make sure u tell them ahead as they will get u a super nice piece of cake for u.. ON THE HOUSE.
All this deliciousness didn't cost more than $180 .. 
Thank u for another pleasant experience Mastro's ..see you soon!

Mastro's has good reviews and my honey really loves lobster bisque so we decided to give it a try. We had seen the strange bird house looking structure at Crystals many times before. We made a reservation for a table in the birdhouse although there are a lot of tables in the other sections of the restaurant. We were promptly seated and service started immediately. We ordered the vanilla battered shrimp as an appetizer. My wife ordered the lobster bisque which we shared. She ordered Parmesan crusted grouper. I ordered Blackened Chilean Sea Bass. For sides we ordered creamed spinach and sea salt and vinegar fries. My wife liked the shrimp, I was disappointed in it. It was very lightly tempura battered, very tender. I just thought it was bland. The lobster bisque was everything we had hoped for and more. It was thick and creamy with large pieces of lobster; very savory. The Parmesan crusted grouper was excellent. It was perfectly cooked and lightly spiced. The Sea Bass was perfect. It was very thick, light and flaky. The creamed spinach was excellent. The salt and vinegar fries were good. They are very thinly sliced (think potato sticks). But the best was still to come. We ordered their signature warm butter cake. OMG this may be the best cake either of us has ever eaten. It is served with a garnish of fresh fruit, a huge scoop of ice cream and fresh whipped cream. Regardless of what else you order here, you MUST try this warm butter cake. Service was excellent and she the price is fair. 

Minuses- the noise level is very high. Very hard to hold a conversation. They have a large staff of servers, but service was slow. One of our sides was delivered as we finished our entre's. 

We will definitely be back.

This was a very unpleasant experience. We made reservation for the treehouse, when we got there, they said the treehouse was not available. So they tried to put us at a table, that was so close to the other table, that the people eating would have to get up so would be able to sit. I had taken the day off from work, this was my birthday dinner, that I never got to have. We left do to the fact we didn't want to interrupt the other people from eating. The bottom line is that if you want a great meal and great service, go to the Wynn. I usually go there, but I thought I would try something new, big mistake.

Went to Maestros as part of a regional get together with colleagues.  The ambiance was great, and the food was excellent.  By far my favorite part was the sea food tower, build it anyway you like, everything on there was so fresh I could hear waves crashing.  My steak was cooked exactly how I like it, and the wine flight pairing made for a nice compliment.  Only down side was because our party was somewhat large, and there was at least one other large party service was a little sparse and at one point we waited 15 min for someone to come around.  This is the only reason Maestros gets a 4 out of 5 in my book, however I will return as the food was just that good.

Staying at the Aria and a small group of us went to Mastros for dinner. No reservation so sat at high top in bar area. I had the griller red snapper which was well prepared. A couple split a filet and other had chop salad and all said great. The cocktails were friendly and plentiful with quick service. I split Mac and cheese with a buddy but we only ate half despite great flavor. A little expensive but would definately do again.

Great atmosphere and great service. Their basket of assorted breads are wonderful. The steam mussels were great and flavorful. The escargots didn't have enough flavor in them. The lobster & gnocchi was great and was one of my favorite dish. If you are planning to eat here please call for RSVP because you don't want to wait in a long line.

We did not eat this time around.  We just stopped in for some late night drinks.  The setting is great.  The bar is a cool place.  Our bartender was knowledgable, friendly and attentive.  She also did a great job mixing our drinks.  I ordered a caipirinha.  There are many places that somehow manage to screw them up, but she nailed it.  We will have to return to eat at some point.
Really Nice View and great food. nice break from the strip when it's 9:30 at night and the temperature finally gets down to 99 degrees. lol

Have you ever been called a day later from a restaurant you ate at the night before? Yeah, me neither- until I ate at Maestro's Ocean Room.  It was like a one night stand you want to call you again. Real classy joint. The whole family went to Vegas for Christmas. Since we are Jews, we decided to forego the stereotypical Chinese food and step it up a bit.  We were looking for a nice steakhouse and we were torn between Craft Steak or Maestros- Since we were staying at Vdara, Maestro's was closer.  Thank goodness- hands down best steak I've ever had. Even my picky eater girls loved it. I had the filet- melted in my mouth like butter.  We ordered the mussels, crab claws, bone marrow, salmon, broccoli, sweet potato fries, spinach- I don't normally eat seafood but I was so stuffed and satisfied when I left- I'll let you make the one night stand joke this time. EAT HERE.

My husband brought me here for an early valentine's dinner.  Reservations were at 7:30 pm and we were seated immediately. We were seated in the half booth half tables that are right next to the bar. You know, the ones that are right on top of each other. I was annoyed, because I would think they would save these seats for walk-ins. I was determined to not let that upset me and I'm so happy I didn't. Our waiter was awesome as was our food. They bring this beautiful bread basket with a variety of wonderful fresh bread, served with butter of course. 
We started with the colossal Dungeness crab which came out with dry ice so it was smoking. It was pretty neat. The crab was very fresh.  I drank water, but my ordered a double shot crown and coke. There was so much crown when the waiter brought the drink that he couldn't put but a splash of coke in it (sodas come in little aluminum bottles). I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and my husband ordered the 12oz filet. We shared the garlic mashed potatoes and mushrooms. My sea bass was cooked to perfection and it was huge, I couldn't even finish it.  My husband's filet was cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.  The mashed potatoes had a soft garlic flavor. They were my husband's favorite. The mushrooms were sautéed with rosemary. I've never had mushrooms with rosemary. It was a new flavor for me and I liked it. Our waiter brought us the butter cake for dessert complimentary for dining with them. This was my favorite. It came with a ginormous side of homemade whipped cream. It was the greatest, most delicious thing I've had. I've been dreaming about it ever since! I love this restaurant and have told all my friends and family about it. Definitely going back!

Steak....great!  Seared Ahi Tuna.....great!  Ahi tosatas......great!  Brussels Sprouts....meh!  Butter Cake.....had to change my pants!!!!  Service was phenomenal!!!!!!!!!

Pants.....ruined.

Food is good, but ambiance is terrible. Literally eating dinner in the middle of a mall, which would be fine if I were at home but for Vegas it's lame. Service was excellent. But definitely think there are better places to go!

Came here for a friend's Birthday. 

The service was superb, a big thank you to Peter our waiter for dealing with such an unruly large party!

I had the Kansas City Strip Steak...was amazing. They use a great rub or some other seasoning. 

We started with a couple dozen Oysters which were fantastic, and not too expensive. All the sides were great, including the potatoes and spinach. 

Great wine selection, and its only 2X for certain bottles of wine. We had 3 bottles each around $100 but top vintages of some great wineries in Napa. 

I believe the birthday boy got a free desert of some kind, but at that point in the meal I was having to much fun to notice. 

This is a clean, fun, and delicious higher-end place to eat with friends. I will definitely be back

I really wish I could give this place 5 stars because the food was very good and it is in a convenient location.  I would definitely recommend coming here, but our party made reservations well in advance and we still had to wait over an hour for our table to open up.  We weren't apologized to and everything seemed a bit frantic. Our party had an eventful day in Vegas, so we had a lot to talk about in our extended wait, but it still shouldn't happen to people that made reservations. Upside: BUTTER CAKE

For what you pay, I expected much more on all fronts. First off, we had to get our entrees to go because we were going to be late for a show (not the fastest restaurant) and they forgot to include mine...so so sad :(  Too late to return to get it though. Otherwise I was just generally unimpressed. We were put in the darkest corner with no lights so the ambience was a little off to me. All the food was just blah, not bad, but not what you expect for the price. Fried calamari had too little seasoning for me. Seared ahi tuna was pretty tasty I will say, but there was like 4 thin pieces not much to eat. Spicy mambo salad was basically like ceasar salad. Seafood tower was decent and included raw oysters, lobster, crab...the basics. I was going to take pictures, actually I tried, but as I said place was nightime dark in there. Anyways, I'd take my money elsewhere personally. But again, I didn't have my dinner so...

WOW is all I can say.  We have a Mastros Steakhouse in Chicago and I have not been able to get in as it's always so hoppin. So since we were in Vegas, we decided to give Mastros Ocean Club a try.  We were not disappointed.  The restaurant is located in the City Center shopping area and fits in well with the high end shopping and the swanky décor of the city center and surrounding hotels.  The décor is simple contemporary.  It would be too simple if it wasn't for their amazing bar set up but more their "tree house" structure.  If you visit Mastros, request that you sit in the tree house section.  They also have a lounge singer and piano player.  The volume was fine (as I've read other review that it was extremely loud) - but we were sitting in the tree house area so I can imagine if you had one of the tables next to the singer or in the booths behind them, it would be pretty loud.  Regardless, the singer was very good and sang songs from all genres.  Now to the important part - the food.  Everything we ordered was amazing.  As all higher end restaurants, all sides are ala cart but big enough to share.  Our entrees were delishous - ahi tuna, sea bass, and scallops.  I have no complaints, all were cooked PERFECTLY and extremely flavorful.  The portions were quite large.  The sides were equally amazing and big enough to share between 3-4 people.  One of the sides - the mac and cheese was AH. MAZ. ING.  If we're ever back I'd be happy to dive into the Lobster mashed potatoes.  The wedge salad was enourmous, enough to share between 2 people.  I had the lobster bisque which was very tasty.  I've had it before at other places and it sometimes has had a "fishy" taste but not this. And there were big chunks of lobster.  Service, supurb as expected.  The menu is pricey, but worth it.  I'll definitely be checking out Mastros in Chicago.

Come here for the seafood!! We got the shrimp cocktail and the oysters to share and I cannot stop thinking about the gigantic shrimp! Fresh, juicy, and the size of a mini lobster! The Kumato oysters were fresh, but sandy. I wish we would have tried the crab or lobster instead. 
The steak was good, but had parts that were more heavily seasoned than others. It was still tasty, but I felt Ruth's Chris does a better steak. The mac and cheese was mediocre and could be skipped next time. The asparagus was fresh, but the tips weren't cooked. I did like that they serve the sides for you.
The berry dream cocktail was to die for! It was strong, but didn't have the strong alcohol taste and the server shakes it up table side and leaves you the remains in the shaker. Definite plus!
For dessert, they brought out the chocolate cake for our anniversary celebration. It was overly sweet and a bit dry. I really wanted to try the butter cake so we ordered one of those too. Very decadent and delicious. I enjoyed the slightly crisp edges and soft, warm center with the ice cream. 
Overall, this was a good experience. We would come back the next time and try more of the seafood.

This was actually my first time at mastros, and the food was delicious, although a bit on the salty side.

First of all.. The bread was to die for.. My friends and I had to restrain ourselves from devouring two baskets of bread so we won't be too full for our meal.

We ordered a Caesars salad split between three people, but it didn't come out until AFTER our meal and sides came. I didn't think that was very professional, but everyone makes mistakes. 

We got the cream corn and lobster mashed potatoes for our sides. They were both to die for! I ordered the sautéed scallops which were delicious but a little too salty for my taste. My two friends ordered the filet mignon and the bone-in ribeye, which they loved. 

We also ordered two bottles of the Argyle Pinot noir, which our server recommended for us. It was wonderful.. Not too sweet, not too dry. 

We also informed our waiter that it was our friend's birthday, so at the end of our meal, they brought out an amaaaazing butter cake with a candle! 

Overall, the experience was great, especially sitting in the nest! Lol

This place is first class.  The server was awesome.  Second time eating here, got the black truffle crab gnocchi both times.  Out of the park good.

The service is top notch And the steaks are excellent.  Good place for a group.

My first thought when seated was, "It's a good thing all of these world class stores aren't doing any business because it sure takes the edge off a high-dining experience along the mall food court railing". Our table felt like a satellite location for a sparkling contemporary version of daddy's classic steak house. And we weren't even seated in the satellite (you'll get it if you visit). It just seemed surreal for a "room" with such distinguishing attributes. I won't hold that against them, much.

It was just my son and I that visited to celebrate his 21st. Matt was our dining guide and he was fun. Not like, "let's have a Vegas night!", fun. Just that he carried his demeanor well and kept his smile on. He was very, very consistent in that his presentation to each of the three tables nearby was identical, and specific. He was meticulous to ensure accuracy and satisfaction.

We were completely impressed by the young lady and gentleman entertaining the room. We later learned that it was their first night at Mastro's. Their acoustics in that challenging environment are absolute perfection and their talents are superior.  

We went light on the openers which were supplemented by an abundant variety of stellar bread choices. My son is All-American in his need for a Calamari appetizer. It was the best we'd ever had, and maybe will. I had the Ocean Club Salad and, again, maybe the best complete salad I've ever enjoyed. My son ordered the Bone-In KC Strip a little less than medium and he dubbed it The Crown Jewel of his steak experiences. He couldn't finish it and he finishes everything. I asked for the Bone-In Ribeye. Matt helped me herd descriptives into a perfectly cooked finish. I'm still thinking it's the fact that I live in Colorado, where even onions and garlic sometimes have difficulty offering flavor, but if it's possible to have too much natural flavor in a steak, it happened. I'm taking accountability on that one, because it's not Mastro's fault I live at high altitude. This was a huge steak and I hardly dented it. We sided up a strong contender for best garlic mashed, which we carried out more of than we ate. So we get this this lovely shopping bag, consistent with the elevated neighborhood, to carry our midnight snack down the strip with. 

I have so many reasons to go 5 star all over this place and fractions of thoughts about why I wouldn't. Those fractions, the bulk of which are carried by the food court railing ambiance, add up to one. And I won't insult Matt because I liked him.

When I return in May, I might just take the other half of the family because I can't go wrong on this one.
One of the best meals that I have had in a long time.  Looking forward to repeating.  $300 for 2 for dinner.

A very classy restaurant, expensive but worth every single penny... The service is one of the highest First night my waiter was Nick and second was Tim very nice and attentive... Highly recommended this restaurant The food the drinks the dessert the service I don't have anything negative to say my birthday dinner was totally successful.... The cocktail DREAM BERRY is the best and sweet the creme brûlée.. Thank you Mastro's keep up the good work!!!!

What can I say, I'm a baller...

I LOVE Mastro's.  They do it right.  Top quality service, top quality drinks, top quality food.  For the first time I had the oysters here, and they were ... AWESOME.

We walked in, no-reservation, found a table in the bar area, watched the Lakers lose to OKC (yes!) and had another swank experience.  The huge wooden design thing-thing dining area that opens up/sits over the mall provides for a great atmosphere also.. (ref pic)

The place is all that.

Went to celebrate our anniversary.  Although pricey, the terrific food and service are worth the extra bucks.  Shared a large filet, 2 orders of lobster tails, and sides among four people.  Everything was delicious.  Portions are large, so it's easy to do something like this (which also cut the cost a bit).  When in Vegas, this is definitely a must-go for a great eating experience.  Joe, our server, was great fun and very attentive.  Everyone at the restaurant has a friendly NOT snooty attitude that is delightful to find in such an outstanding restaurant.

Located in the Crystals Shopping center next to Aria. Park at Crystals Valet if you aren't staying at the hotel. They have electric car charging. Consistently delicious food every time we come. 5 stars for service, food, everything. Try to get a table inside the treehouse. Few of the items we ordered:

Petite filet: absolutely melt in your mouth delicious. 
Heirloom tomato and burrata cheese: very good but pricey at $20.
Sea salt and vinegar fries: addicting!
Alaskan halibut: hubby says was very good.
Creamed corn side: delish.
Signature butter cake: so yummy!
Sugar snap peas side: cooked perfect...super crunchy.
Table bread and butter: even that was awesome!

Would highly recommend and def be back, Mastros!

Let me start from the beginning here. I was searching for a good date spot for me and my gf. I have dined at most of the finer restaurants in Vegas. But I wanted to try something new and by far, this was the best reviewed spot. Only thing that turned me off was that it was in the middle of a mall. NOT AN ISSUE. I requested the 'Tree House' and that is where we were sat. Once in there I completely forgot I was in a mall...it was romantic and beautiful. Our server greeted us and asked if we've ever diner here before....we both responded "NO". We were then treated to a 5 minute explanation of their entire menu. Based on other reviews...we started with the shrimp cocktail and I suggest you do the same. Very unique and brilliant presentation. My gf had the Fillet of Arctic Char "Oreganata"..we both LOVED it. I had the Bone In Rib-Eye. Cooked perfectly. Delicious. For sides we chose the mac-n-cheese(not bad, but kinda bland to what I've had at comparable restaurants) and the brussel sprouts...fantastic. We had no room for dessert. Cocktails were good....coming from a guy in that business. As we left, EVERYONE thanked us for coming...from busser to manager. That was impressive. I even woke up the next morning to a voicemail from them thanking me for me business and hoping that me and my 'beautiful' gf had a great time; and that they hope to see us again. ONLY complaint..and this is being picky: when our bread was dropped off(with multiple choices), it was just thrown down with no explanation as to what was what. But this is a must go!

Mastro's Ocean Club is one of the high end dining places that has opened up in the last year or so at Crystals which is part of City Place.

Technically speaking Mastro's is a chain, though it doesn't carry the chain vibe.  The locations of the handful of Mastro's that exist live in high end cities like Scottsdale, AZ, Beverly Hills, CA and Chicago, IL.  This location in Las Vegas was tagged with the words "Ocean Club" to show off the fact that not only do they have steak but a large selection of seafood too.

Steak is what Mastro's have built themselves up as and if you are thinking about dining here I would suggest the steak.  They are famous for firing their meats in an oven that burns hotter than 1100 degrees F.  I ordered the bone in ribeye that I split with my friend.  We did the usual recommendation of medium rare and in my opinion it came out perfect, though it was too bloody for her and she sent hers back to be cooked more.  

Of course Mastro's is a la carte and buyer beware the sides are HUGE.  One side order can be spit by 3 people.  We ordered the grilled brussel sprouts and they brought them out piping hot still in the skillet and put the skillet on the table.  

Wine selection is wonderful.  Though the food is pricey the wine prices are affordable with decent bottles for only $27 though they go way up in price.

Dessert was a chef's creation at this Mastro's in Vegas (executive chef Wayne Schumaker) which is the signature warm butter cake.  This is a large piece of butter cake that has a sugar crust that is baked hot along with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a pile of homemade whipped cream.  OMG ridiculous good but again could be shared with like, 5 people.  

The only major downside to Mastro's is the music.  They have a live piano bar that you think would play soft, classy music like jazz or piano but instead you get very loud, karaoke type performances by an older man and woman (ages 60+) who use an iPad connected to the piano to sing modern and past day pop music such as Pink, Katy Perry, and even Foster the People's "Pumped Up Kicks".  If Mastro's would lose the cheesy, loud, awful music they would go to 5 stars.  

Bring headphones and enjoy a nice dinner.

Plenty of reviews already so I am going to jump right into it. For sure make reservations if you want to sit in the tree house. We did and we loved it! Waiter was really nice and explained the menu to us while suggesting very popular items. 

For appetizers we started off with the "Oyster Rockefeller" and "Sauteed Shrimp".
The oysters were not bad but let's just say we won't order them again. The shrimp on the other hand were very delicious. Had great seasoning and the creamy butter sauce was pretty amazing.

Main course le boyfriend and I each both had the "22oz Bone in Ribeye". And for sides we did the "Lobster mashed, Cream corn & Sauted mushrooms". Both steaks were cooked and seasoned to perfection. "Seriously best steak I've ever had in my life"... those were the boyfriends words since this was my first time in over a year eating red meat. But I have to agree with him. The lobster mashed potatoes were so creamy and buttery. Cream of corn was very tasty, almost reminded me of the mexican corn with out all the cheese. The sautéed mushrooms were also very delicious. Very happy with the entrees and sides we got. I fell in love with all of them.

Las but not least, DESSERT!. 
Waiter brought us out a chocolate piece of cake with fresh whipped cream. I did not care so much for this cake as it was a little on the dry side for me but eh it was complimentary for our Anniversary. I knew I had to order the famous Butter Cake so I did. The butter cake came out super warm with a big scoop of ice cream on top. Okay so this cake was good but I feel like I've had better dessert. I hate salt on any dessert so this was a huge downfall for me. Cake tasted like a very sweet, buttery corn bread. I don't know how to make out of this cake but if I go back I probably won't order it again. Yes I know very sad as everyone literally worships this cake. Over all I had a great experience and I cannot wait to go back again. I think this is my new favorite steak house.

This is my current pick for the #1 best place for a business dinner in town (assuming cost is no object). There's a nice variety of steaks and seafood, and the ambiance is quiet and fantastic. It's not too trendy or loud, and the food is classic and well prepared. The tree house area is especially nice. 

We tried a bit of everything, and all of it was fantastic. The cold seafood tower appetizer was fantastic (the stone crab claws were the stand out!). For our entrees most of us got seafood and were all pleased! I loved my arctic char, although it was HUGE - stupid HUGE. Honestly it seemed like 16-20 ounces of freaking fish on my plate. With all the other yummy food floating around I could barely polish off a quarter of my fish. If I was dining with my husband, this is definitely a dish we could share. The best side with the crab and black truffle gnocchi... OMG.. best gnocchi of my life ! The lobster mashed potatoes were pretty incredible as well. 

So the butter cake did live up to the hype! Moist, rich, delicious. Four of us split this and felt like there was more than enough to go around. Even if you don't think you have room for dessert - this cake is good enough to warrant making yourself sick !

I can't say I tried any meat, but for seafood I really loved this place. Great service, and great food.

I came here for a nice dinner with a special person, and I absolutely loved it. 

First of all, the xmas decorations in the mall were amazing. Set the mood very well for our dinner. We checked in with the hostess, and the hostess who walked us to our seats was very friendly. 

We sat next to the live band, a lady singer and a guy pianist/singer. They played really good music ranging from older American pop songs to older R&B songs with their own twist. I couldn't help but to quietly sing along during dinner. 

We ordered the following:

1. lobster mashed potatoes - this was the best mashed potatoes I've had in my life. They really don't skimp on the lobster meat either you would find huge chunks, and it was like digging for treasure! The meat was also cooked just right, and it was really fresh. If you go to this restaurant, this side dish is a must get if you like lobster. 

2. Sauteed Asparagus - pretty standard just got this dish to get some veggies. 

3. Petite Filet Mignon - usually I like more flavorful cuts like ribeyes, and I don't really like filet mignons because they are lean. However this steak was so tender and cooked just right. I enjoyed it a lot. It was just the right portion, 8 oz, since I wasn't too hungry.

3. Sea Scallops - I had a small bite, the scallop was cooked just right, medium rare, and the meat was so sweet!!

Definitely recommend to come here on a special occasion, or if you won from gambling!

I have to say the best dinner we had in the week we stayed in Vegas.
THe food and service were the best
Have to get a cosmo they service with dry ice, it is an experience.
Waiter Paul was the best could not do enough for us

have to try the Lobster mash potatoes

I was back to Vegas with my work team. First time at Mastro's Ocean Club, a restaurant in the middle of Crystal Mall. We booked dinner reservation for 9:45 pm for 6 on Sunday May/18/14 after the Show. I arrived 7 mins early, but our table was not ready and we were seated 10:10 pm (empty table needs to set up for 6). Our waiter was very tentative and recommend us the seafood platter.
The Alaskan Red King Crab Claws & the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktails were awesome. 
My Rack of Lamb was cooked medium rare as I requested on a super Hot Plate. Perfect!. The rest of the food and side dishes were great. The only less desirable thing was by the time we got our main course it was 11:40 pm at night. 
For sure it was a bit pricey, our bill came to $1200 USD for 6 of us.
Overall, it was a good experience.
Maybe we will try again an earlier dinner time when we have a chance again.

Food is awesome but very pricey. This time I had the ribeye, so good and we all shared sides but what one this that was memorable is the Butter Cake, I'm not much into sweets but this is orgasmic...lol, if you have room, it's a must have. The comb of the salty, sweet, cold and hot...

The steak here was really good. Cooked perfectly to my liking. I would definitely come back for some steak. 

The only reason I took 1 star off is because the sides were ok. We ordered the mushrooms, fries and green beans. Again, ok.

If you're in Vegas and looking for some good steak, Mastro's.

My girlfriend and I took a whole week vacation off to visit the West coast. It was our first time trip to visit Las Vegas, and the entire experience was amazing and unforgettable. Amid the many alluring performing shows, the endless eyes-dazing slot machines, and the gigantic resorts were some of the most fantastic restaurants that Vegas could offer. 

We first passed by OC while exploring the riches on the famed Strip. It was located within the beautiful Crystal. Upon seeing it, both of us were intrigued by the outstanding artistry presented by the original designer. The structure's frames were made out of steel and covered with fine, deep red wood. Between the frames were giant crystal clear glasses that allowed a perfect view from both within and out. However, the most salient and attracting feature was that the entire structure was slanted. My words would be lacking and limited for the description, but just imagine an hourglass tilted like a forward-slash sign. Bemused by its charm, we booked a table on a Monday night and dressed in proper attires, girlfriend in a beautiful orange-red dress.

We arrived around 10pm after seeing the fantastic Le Reve at Wynn. Being Monday night, the restaurant had only a few tables occupied. We were given a table near the crystal glasses, which allowed an excellent view for the outside. Our waitress of the night was very friendly and polite. As she went slowly on explaining the menu she also told us that the structure was called "The Tree", its name inspired by the tiny leaves spurting out of the joints of the steel frames. From the menu, we picked "Dungeness Crab Cocktail" and "Vanilla Batter Shrimp" for appetizers, a "Fillet of Arctic Char Oreganate" with "Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi" as entree and side dish. The crab cocktail came in a special tall glass container filled with mist giving dry ice. Each large lumps of crab meat was tender and fresh with the saltiness and sweetness of the ocean. The vanilla fried shrimps were gigantic in size, each crispy on the outside and tender within, a must try for shrimp lovers. The arctic char was perfect, cooked to medium-rare the way I loved. It was a huge fillet more than enough for the two of us to share. The Oreganate style was foreign to me, but the combination of butter, spices, and bread crumbs had made a wonderful sauce suited well with the fish. The gnocchi was huge in portion, baked in large hot skillet and filled with delicious cheese and crab meat. The mix of crab meat, cheese, and truffle gave the dish an unique and saliva dripping aroma. However, due to the large portion, over-stuffing this huge amount of cheese, crab meat and gnocchi is not recommended. You would need to trust me on this, as the first 5 bites would have you mouthwatering for more, but double that you would start having the too-much-cream-stuck-in-your-stomach feeling, and beyond that would be just too much to handle.  Alas, at the end, gf and I had to pick out the delicious crab meat along with the truffle to eat and wasted a large amount of the gnocchi.

Regrettably, since we were on a tight schedule for a night club to visit, we skipped the desserts - What a shame! Dinning at Ocean Club was such a wonderful experience. My gf and I enjoyed every minute from beginning to end. Yes, it was a very expensive place, but so was everything else in Vegas and every penny spend was well worth it. So by chance if you ever stop by Vegas, be sure to checkout this amazing restaurant.

Excellent service from start to finish!  Wife's crab cocktail and filet were perfect.  I was a little disappointed in my bone in New York.  Meat had a large vein of gristle  running through the  middle into the bone.  Martini was larger than average!!

Mastro's Ocean Club is a fine dining establishment located in the Aria Hotel and Casino. The ambiance is set well, the architecture is particularly astounding, and the service is exquisite. Our server, Joe, was on his game. My water glass and wine glass never reached half empty (or half full). Ordered the Bone Marrow, Lobster Bisque, Ocean Club Crab Cakes, Sauteed Broccoli, Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese, 22 oz. Bone-in Ribeye, and Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake. 

Bone Marrow - Holy Donkey Punching Jesus this is astounding. I have never had Bone Marrow before but its alluring presence on the menu was enough for me to sample it. The Bone Marrow comes half charred on a split bone with a serving of toasted baguette to spread on. The flavor, the texture, the taste and everything about it was amazing. I will order this every time and you should as well.

Ocean Club Crab Cakes - Hearty crab cakes with more crab than cake. In fact the cakes fall apart to the softest touch, the chunks of crab meat separating with ease as only a minimal amount of filler has been used. Flavor and spice is more than enough to accent the cakes.

Lobster Bisque - Oftentimes Lobster Bisque comes heavily buttered, even in the most finest of dining establishment. Butter is an easy thing to add to a dish to increase its flavor without actually improving on its originality and substance. However, Mastro's Lobster Bisque does not perpetuate this and, rather, has a full-bodied bisque with a generous portion of lobster inside. The thickness is akin to how a bisque should be.

Sauteed Broccoli - Opting to go a slightly healthier route with one of the dishes I was still impressed but of course, it's sauteed broccoli, and only so much can be done while keeping it true.

Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese - a perfect compliment to my Bone-in Ribeye and a hearty side at that. It's a shame our hotel fridge has a monitored scale with a restocking fee otherwise I would have had no issue taking the remainder of this with me.

22 oz. Bone-in Ribeye - One of the finer Ribeyes I have had. A generous amount of fat and it was seared and salted well enough to make it exceedingly juicy. Cooked to perfection (rare) with a cool red center while the black crust of searing on iron was still present. 

Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake - Fuck. That's Amazing.

The servings sizes of sides are plentiful and the prices are what you'd expect at such an establishment. Be wary of those giving Mastro's a bad review due to price or service, such an establishment would be careful to hire only proven servers and I would wager that the reviewers themselves to be the standoffish party.

This is our 2nd time dining at Mastro's Ocean Club.  Lanford was our waiter for the evening.  He was extremely personable and very knowledgeable about the menu.  We dined on Oysters Rockefeller,  Sea Bass, Scallops, Lobster/black truffle gnocchi and the Brussel sprouts.  Everything was wonderful.  We spoke to 3 of the on duty managers in passing: Nicholas, Brandon and Dan(?).  We have nothing but praise for this restaurant and all who work there.  We will be back!

I've been fascinated by this "tree house" for the longest. This was my first time visiting Mastro's and I had long heard of the famous warm butter cake, so I was excited to come for a pharm. rep dinner, get to learn and try a new place. 

We made our selections from a pre-set menu.

My first course I went with the Caeser Salad, this was pretty standard except for the bits of anchovie throughout, which is my favorite kind of Caeser. 

For my entree I chose the 8oz filet. I asked for it to be prepared medium. What came out was between rare and tartare. Since we were in a small private dining room for the lecture, I didn't feel comfortable sending my steak back, it would be disruptive, and I didn't want to interupt the lecturer. I ended up giving it to my friend to take home to her dogs.

The family style shared sides weren't impressive either. Mashed potatoes had no flavor, and the sugar snap peas as well. Only one I liked was the creamed spinach. 

Dessert we had a choice between chocolate sin cake and cheesecake. I went with the chocolate cake, it came with a side of homemade whipped cream which I thought was better than the cake itself. 

Pretty disappointing meal all together. I would come back for a second try, just not in a hurry to do so. I definitely enjoyed the lecture more than dinner.

Party of 8 on a Tuesday night.
Interesting set up - there is a part of the restaurant that looks like a large wooden hornet's nest.  Not sure what that's all about.  

Service was impeccable from the hostess to the main server to his assistants.  Everything was prompt, polite and timed well.  We were not rushed out even though we were one of the last parties to leave. 

Food:
I ordered the Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese $12 and the Rack of Lamb $48.  The mac and cheese was a little disappointing - very little flavor and it was dry,  very dry.  I had read that this was a great side dish so I was sad when it wasn't very palatable.  The portion is huge - consider sharing it if you do.  It easily fed our entire table.  I asked for the Rack of Lamb medium rare and it came out closer to medium.  Regardless, the flavor was very smooth, not gamey.  The outside was a little too charred, but the rest of it was quite good.  It came with mint jelly, which was very tasty.  We also had a Heirloom Tomato and Burrata salad $12 which was a very generous portion - the tomatoes were sweet and juicy.  The table got the Seafood Tower (have no idea how much that was but it was worth it).  This was friggin amazing.  Honestly.  There were Kumamoto oysters, fresh dungeness crab, snow crab legs, humongous shrimp, great big lobster claws.  All fresh and tender meat.  It didn't require sauce.  None of it was briny or sandy.  So delicious and whatever we paid, I don't care.  It was unbelievable. Other people in our party got the Arctic Char "oreganato" style, bone-in filet, seared scallops and halibut.  Every dish was served with mushrooms, asparagus, green beans and creamed corn (this had to have crack in it b/c creamed corn never tasted so good.)  NO ONE had a single complaint and EVERYONE finished what they ordered.  By this time, we're all about to pass out from food coma, but we insisted on the BUTTER CAKE.  If you come here, no matter what you order, you MUST save room for this signature dessert.  I can't even describe it but it is amazing.  It comes out warm, w/ freshly made whipped cream and vanilla ice cream.   MUST.  MUST.  MUST have.  

Overall, great experience.  Cost us a total of $1400 for 7 people.  You do the math.

the service of course is great. We had the 12 oz bone-in filet (in the $50's range) and the 10oz filet ($48). if you like your steak tasting soft like butter it's best to order it medium rare. It comes in a 200 degree plate so it'll continue to cook the steak. 

for sides, we had the lobster mashed potato ($39)-it was delicious, it was a bit salty for me  but my party liked it. 

cream spinach-bland- i think i had better at Lawry's 

Gorgonzola mac and cheese-best eat it while it's hot, once it's cold it's really bland.
 
the sides are generous, we order one of each  and it was more than enough for my party of 6.  We did have some appetizers prior. 
  the basket of bread of abundant- prezel bread, garlic Parmesan bread, olive bread and some other stuff.

Mastro's in OC is one of my most favorite steak places ever. The Vegas one was good but I prefer the ambiance at the OC one more. The steaks were cooked well as I expected from Mastros. Lobster mashed potatoes...always yummy! Great martinis and great service here.

Loses a star because there were 15 empty tables when we walked in at 9:25 for our 9:15 reservation, and they made us wait at the bar for 15 minutes. 

Otherwise, basically a great meal. Slightly poor ambiance because it's in a mall, albeit an ultra fancy mall. The piano guy was pretty good. 

The food was fantastic. Had really good oysters, ask for the grassy ones if they have them. Some sort of california oyster that had a really strong flavor that the waitress recommended. 

The crab cakes and ahi tuna apps were also very good.

For main we got the seabass and the swordfish. The seabass was very good, but not in that cliched and too common sweet glazed seabass/ black cod. 

Swordfish I foolishly ordered a little underdone but was still good. They allow you to choose how to cook the meat, if you don't know much about cooking and different fish, ask the server, he/she seems very likely to know the best way to order each fish. 

For dessert, we got their signature "butter cake" which was obviously ridiculously rich and good. Served with an ENORMOUS tray of whipped cream. Everything at this restaurant appears to be made from scratch, and it tastes that way too. Every dish is enormously portioned as well.
Incredible food and even more amazing service! Number one experience this trip to Vegas!

I liked this place, but I think it's more for the atmosphere than the food.  Don't get me wrong, the food was good - it just didn't quite live up to what I was expecting.  We ordered the seafood tower and everything was delicious.  For my entree, I ordered the petite filet.  While good, it definitely could have been seasoned more and was a bit overcooked.  Honestly, I think Kevin Rathbun Steak has ruined  every other steak restaurant for me - nothing will ever to compare to the steak I had there.  As a side, we ordered the gorgonzola mac and cheese, which had far more mac than cheese unfortunately.  I could barely taste the gorgonzola at all, and given it's strong flavor, there had to be practically none in there.

Drinks were top notch and the service was excellent.  We sat in the treehouse, which was very cool, but the food just didn't do it for me.  Unfortunately, it just didn't live up to my lofty expectations.

A mediocre experience. Awesome, awesome service (probably best of the weekend) let down by seriously overlooked fish and an 1hr15 wait for food. After being met by the friendliest server in a city of friendly servers, we were about to eat our own arms as food arrived. The sides were great - but the halibut was so rubbery and dry. We sent it back and by the time 2x new ones arrived - we had eaten enough sides we were full and didn't really get to enjoy it.
  
I was going to give 3* then remembered the worst part. When the bill arrived, the server smiled and said I hope that's ok - I thought great, she'll have taken off the overcooked entrees. Opened it up and last item was -$xx for 2x entrees. Perfect. But then the total felt too big still - so checking back up the menu, they had ADDED the 2nd lot of recooked fish then removed it again at the bottom so it looked just removed - most people after a couple of drinks no way would've noticed that. SUPER sneaky. Kinda took the edge off the whole experience really - doubt we'll be back

Went with my brother for this Birthday. It's rather odd to be eating in this kind of restaurant in a mall, but the faint mall music didn't affect the food. 

We started with the Ahi Tuna Tartare then moved on to (rare) bone in rib-eye and Kansas City stip. My brother went surf and turf and added the prawn, which was basically the largest shrimp I've ever seen. We rounded out with sides of lobster mash potatoes and creamed spinach. 

My only complaint was my moscow mule, which didn't appear to have any ginger beer and was essentially vodka and lemon juice. Overall, the food was cooked perfectly and the service was attentive without being annoying (this is a fine line). It was a great experience and I'm sure it made my brother's day.

Great food, great service. awesome execution, and a wonderful wine list - This was the best meal I had in Las Vegas this year. I went back twice this week! Gnocchi with Alaskan crab ,truffle oil then topped with shaved black truffle and crisped panko bread crumbs is decadent and delish! It is served sizzling and definitely  enough to share between two people. I ordered a half portion the second visit and it still was enough between the two of  us! One of the best things i have ever eaten. I am picky about gnocchi and they do it light and pillowy here with a white sauce. On to the steaks, PRIME CUT EVERYTHING! all steaks are served on 400 degree plates with clarified butter and ur choice of salt/pepper or u can request cajun blackened. Phenomonal steaks and yes I am from Texas and still say this, My favorite winery is Michael David from Lodi  ..they make the good ol 7Deadlyzins, petite petit sirah and Mastros serves their Earthquake Cab for only two times markup (51 bucks)! this is a GREAT value for Vegas . SW steakhouse in the Wynn charges an obnoxious 5x markup! - This is important if you love wine with ur steaks. I had filet mignon, tomahawk ribeye,  truffle crab gnocchi, chocolate pudding cake, gorgonzola mac and cheese, lobster roll, and oysters rockefeller this week at mastros. The gnocchi , steaks and lobster roll were NOT TO BE MISSED here. I wasnt crazy about the mac and cheese but that may be because I was totally spoiled by the gnocchi(priced at 32 full portion, 16 for half portion) . If you are budgeting however the mac is only 13 and 6.50 for a half portion. try it you will love it ! Our waiter was excellent and attentive , this place is worth the money in the big pool of steakhouses in Vegas

I have been coming here for years and this has been my favorite place in lv.  Wheels came off last night, bad food, poor service, so dissapointing.  Ordered bone in filet, medium.  Cut into it and it was purple, np big deal sent it back.  Steak came out later, now red, waiter sort of argued with me about it which was unusual as mastros usually has great service, sent it back again.  Now of course it comes out well done.  Manager comes by, listens to me takes it off bill and comps dessert.  Nice but still poor dinner at a place i have always considered bullet proof.  People i ate with liked their food, but it was not a good experience for me.

Great Filet Mignon. Asked medium rare but received it medium but still very juicy and tender.  Double baked loaded baked potato was huge and amazing.  Great for dates but was actually there with a bachelor party of 10 men and worked out great.  Very pricey but when in Rome..
Lobster mashed potatoes, seafood tower, bone-in filet, 5 star service, presentation, be sure to get a spot in the "treehouse" section. Take a good look at menu prices beforehand though;)

We enjoyed our first visit to Mastro's on New Year's Eve....and had the most fabulous fine dining experience! The food and drinks were fantastic, the atmosphere wonderful and our server Sam (Samantha) was absolutely made our dining experience one to remember....in fact, we went back just this past weekend for my husband's birthday....and Sam greeted us, welcomed us back although she wasn't our server, she was checking that our dining experience was good. Nice touch, for a server to remember a couple in the midst of the hundreds that she assists (that's attention to detail if you ask me). 

Our first visit we enjoyed their delicious bread basket (pretzel bread my fav), Lobster Bisque (dare I say, the best ever tasted...and that's coming from someone that grew up in Monterey with some of the best seafood anywhere), lamb (again, the best ever tasted), filet, sautéed green beans....and topped off with their signature warm butter cake! And can't forget the smoothest and delicious Lemon Drop cocktail....love the dry ice effect! 

We had another fabulous dining experience that evening for my husband's birthday just this past weekend with Craig as our server. This time we started we took it lighter and slower to enjoy.....starting with their spinach salad and decided to split the 22oz Ribeye that I had read about and recommended...they kindly split it up on 2 separate plates for us (without us asking), sautéed asparagus.....and was topped off with a birthday crème brulee (my hubby's fav dessert)....I wasn't much of a brulee fan....until I tried theirs....smooth, creamy, delicious vanilla bean custard!

We won't miss a visit on our future Vegas visits...even if just to sit at the bar for appetizers, bisque, drinks and dessert!

This place is amazing!! It offers a wonderful dining atmosphere and the service was professional and polite. I ordered the lobster mashed potatoes, sauteed asparagus, raw oysters, and sea bass, and will definitely be returning.

Food was amazing. The discount on this review is based on the hostess service upon check in. 

I wanted to have dinner with my dad for his 73rd birthday. I made a reservation for 5pm for a party of two. I showed up early at 4:20pm and hostess said she could not seat us however we can sit by the bar and have drinks and appetizers. The two hostesses asked for my name multiple times for the reservation. We sat by the bar and the bartender says only non cooked items are available for appetizers. I wish the hostess mentioned this before offering the bar side option. 5pm passes by and I see the hostess seating other parties to the tables. I went back to the reception and the same hostess asked for my name twice. She points at another host and I assume to follow her. She doesn't acknowledge or provide a greeting. I realize she is the one supposed to seat is. Maybe the host station wasn't organized or wasn't ready for the evening but I didn't appreciate the confusion and cold reception upon check in. I understand names are complicated but I must have said my generic name seven times to two different people, "Cheryl Garcia". To add additional confusion, I received an email saying I did a 'no show' for my reservation on Open Table. I'm not certain how that happened even when I checked in on Yelp as well. 

The server provided better service and made excellent recommendations. I have an issue with over ordering but that's because I want to taste everything. For a party of two, I ended up ordering the chowder, calamari, sides of roasted brussels sprouts, sauted asparagus, twice baked potato, sea salt & vinegar fries, and twelve oz bone in filet.
