The bread service was warm with an assorted selection. I enjoyed all the sides except the twice baked potato- I thought it was too salty & the chowder was slightly watered down and boring. The calamari was flavorful and crispy. The bone in filet was served sizzling on a ceramic platter and was super tender cooked to perfection. 

The server brought out a complimentary butter cake for my Dad's birthday. The cake was warm and rich topped with a vanilla bean ice cream and strawberries. This was very special and made the overall experience much better.
You will over order. It's all just too good. Great service - wonderful food. Enjoyed my hubbies 50th birthday here!

I really like Mastro's.  

The service is excellent! They are attentive without being snobby and cold.  And you don't get pressured to order more food and bottle of wine.  (I personally think that Cut has the cold, snobby vibe that I'm referring to)

Highly recommend the whole dining experience, but I also love going to grab a glass of wine at the bar.  The bar has an open feeling that is very comfortable, but with an intimate vibe.

Food is good.  Nicely prepared and cooked to perfection.  Nothing crazy on the menu or super unique so its an easy crowd pleaser.  

Price is on target as well for their quality of food. They don't push you to buy bottles of wine or spend a ton of money.  The servers are just there to give you what you ask for.  I never felt pressured to get more food and spend a ton. 

By the way, if you're local they have a free dessert!  They're so generous with the portion size and its so delicious.  This definitely helps when I'm deciding where to go.

We love our restaurants that support their locals!

This restaurant is superb! I've been wanting to check this place out for a while now and it just so happened one of my long time friends was planning on having her birthday dinner here. The ambiance of the restaurant is high class and lavish. Making a reservation is highly recommened, especially if you want to sit at a table in the tree house. In case you were wondering, the tree house is that giant structure across from Louis Vuitton. We had a 7pm reservation, but the birthday girl was running 10 min late. The hostesses and staff were more than accommodating and held our table. Once everyone was there we were seated right away. The waiter went over the menu and highlighted his favorites as well as what they are known for. I was torn between surf or turf, but luckily my date wanted the Chilean Sea Bass which I had my eye on, so I opted for the 18oz bone-in filet. I ordered mine rare of course because I feel anything above medium rare ruins the true flavor of the meat. The cool thing about how they serve their steak is they actually under cook it and serve it on a 400 degree plate which allows the steak to cook more to exactly how you ordered so it's absolutely perfect when you take your first bite. They age all their steaks for 3 weeks, and omg they are perfect. Juicy, full of flavor, and melt in you mouth like butter. Now for the fish, the sea bass was buttery, flakey, not too dry, not too wet, and just the right amount of oiliness. For sides, you order them seperately and they feed up to 5 which was perfect since there was so many of us. We all ordered different sides and got to share. We had brussel sprouts, mashed potatoes, scalloped potatoes, sautéed mushrooms, and truffle fries. Oh my oh my, we were all beyond stuffed. Every element of the meal was perfect, but dessert was what sealed the deal. Two words, BUTTER CAKE. If you don't think it is one of the most amazing desserts to ever exist, you need to reevaluate your life choices. They also make their own whipped cream which is euphoric. If you're looking to have a memorable dinner you need to check out Mastro's, it's totally worth the money.

The food here is sooooooooo GOOD! All I have to say is go here! I had the sea bass and my boyfriend has the halibut and the were both amazing. We also had the tower with crab, lobster oysters and shrimp and everything was great! Highly recommended!
Second time there. Service very good. The steaks are amazing and lobster mash. My fish came didn't come out hot but it was fine. It left more room in my stomach for the BUTTER CAKE which insane!!!!

What is not to like about this fine dining establishment located in Crystals found at the heart of the City Center.

Supurb steaks......
Lobster mashed potatoes........
Super sushi rolls...
Excellent seafod.....
An extensive wine list 
Buttercake with real whipped cream for dessert ...... oh yeahhhhhh

The location is very unique, in that you can sit out on a terrace in an art deco treehouse and under some beautiful chandeliers.
The service is very good, the wait staff is very knowledgeable and friendly.
We had an enjoyable evening topped off by a table visit from Lucianna, the manager.

We were recommended to enjoy "Earthquake" an excellent Cabernet Sauvignon
from the Lodi vineyards, California.
I would pass that recommendation on to you - if you are enjoying the fine steaks....... 
It is an absolutely supurb wine selection.

At first I was sceptical of the Lobster mashed potatoes, but the 
dish is a real treat.... 
and the portion is so huge that it can be shared by all at the table.
A totally unique sidedish... containing an amazing amount of lobster
 
Don't miss dining here....
I think this is one of the finest dining experiences you can enjoy while in Las Vegas.

I can not wait to return.

Went to Ocean club for dinner on our last nite in Las Vegas-had been there before and loved it. Well, this time it was even better than we remembered!  Almost as soon as you sit down, the waiter brings an amazing bread basket with the prize being the hot pretzel bread.  We split the bacon wedge blue cheese salad and my wife had the big eye tuna rare. It was a huge portion of incredible, slightly seared sashimi. I ordered the New York medium and it was perfect medium with no grizzle or fat.  It comes on a plate that is 400 degrees with clarified butter on the bottom. I can honestly say it was one of the best steaks I've ever eaten. Sure its $50 bucks, but I've had lots of crappy 50 dollar steaks in my life and this was worth every penny.  We ordered the side dish that the waiter suggested.-home made gnocchi with either lobster or crap meat and gorgonzola cheese. Maybe the best 29 dollars I've ever spent!  We had a great bottle of merlot and unfortunately, couldn't finish all of  the food so we passed on the amazing selection of desserts but will leave room for one next time. And no, I'm not related to the owners!  Just had a fabulous meal and want to share our experience!!

No surprise here.  MASTRO'S always does a great job.  The martinis,  the food and the service were all superb. We had to split the check for 4 of us 8 ways due to no alcohol is allowed to be on an expensable reciept. This was NO PROBLEM which is not usually the answer. The dungeness crab app was to die for. Everything was perfect .
Mastro's is always fantasitc, highly recommend their seafood salad that they have under appetizers, it's beyond excellent. The dining experience never ceases to amaze...

Mastro's, you never cease to wow me!  I first fell in love with you in Newport Beach at both the Ocean Club and Costa Mesa locations. I think this is the best steak I've ever had.  Everything is cooked to perfection. We had the spicy mambo salad which was a twist on a traditional caesar with wasabi and sriracha dressing (order with croutons added back on).  We also had the shrimp cocktail which was coincidentally one of the best shrimp cocktails I've ever had too.  The dry ice makes it that much more fun.  I think Mastro's has one of the best bread baskets in town as well, particularly the pretzel bread.  It makes it so you almost don't even need sides -- however, if you are getting sides, you must try the lobster mashed potatoes at least once in your life!  Thanks Mastro's for a fantastic evening!

We went there for a birthday party.  Lemon drop Martini to die for , 12 oz bone in filet was great 
Brandon was very professional and great service he gave us is going to be remember for long time
This is my favorite restaurant in las vegas..the staff is perfect and managers are the best

I found Mastro's on Yelp and didn't realize that it was the cool restaurant that looked like it was encased in a cocoon (now known as The Treehouse) when I shopped at the city center a couple of trips back.  I made reservations that day via Yelp and although we waited for about 15 minutes for our 9pm reservations, we were lucky enough to be seated in the Treehouse.  Very cool!  

I had the lobster bisque for a starter and the bowl was HUGE!  It filled me up quite a bit and from the mid point on, I wished I had it to share but managed to drink it all.  It was a bit rich so I was kind of done with it before I finished it off but didn't want to waste any of it so I was a trooper and drank it to the last drop.  Chilean sea bass seemed to be the popular recommendation so that's what I ordered for my entree and that was definitely delicious.  It's a good thing I didn't order any sides because those two dishes totally filled me up!

Great place to try and would recommend at least going there once.  It is a bit pricey but I think worth the experience. Next time I go back, I'd like to go back with a whole bunch of people to get their seafood tower.  The table next to us ordered that and it looked really cool.  If not for the food, just to take a picture to post online.  Haha!

Appetizers: Truffle Lobster Gnocchi, Ocean Club Crab Cakes, & Escargot are ALL very flavorful and DELICIOUS! Also had the Alaskan Crab Mashed Potatoes (don't remember the name) equally delicious!

Entree: I would recommend the Bone-In Ribeye. The portion is good. I would like recommend the Sea Bass. I tried two of their Sea Basses and were not impressed at all. 

Sides: Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese and Steamed Asparagus. Asparagus was just steamed. Mac & Cheese was the best I've ever tasted besides the one from Capital Grille.

Dessert: We had chocolate cake. Nothing special

Had an excellent evening out with friends at mastro's.   This is my second time here and both times it's been above my expectations.  It's got a somewhat more casual feel than a lot of the fancier places, which I like.  One of the better steaks I've had in Vegas for sure.

We celebrated our anniversary here and hands down from the time we arrived until we left everything was phenomenal the server Jonathan is very knowledgeable he told us about the menu items in detail and his suggestions were great we enjoyed every minute of our time the dessert was the bomb must have the butter cake with  vanilla ice cream!

This is the epitome of fine dining! The restaurant is located inside what looks like a mall on the strip, and is in what looks like a cage. I came here for my girlfriends birthday. The service was excellent. We arrived at 5:30 pm, on a Saturday because we knew it would fill up for dinner time. They also only opened half hour before that. They provided us with delicious bread, one tasted like a pretzel. We each had a mixed drink. Mine was good, but my girls drink was excellent. It was a strawberry mixed drink. It tasted perfect! I ordered the largest steak; a 22oz. ribeye. It may have been the best steak I have ever tried in my life. Even the fat parts disintegrated in my mouth. My girl had the filet mignon. It was also delicious. 

For her birthday they brought her out a slice of cake that said 'Happy Birthday!' along with a fresh batch of whipped cream. All in all it was a memorable and splendid experience.
Sea bass is a must! The fillet mignon is superb too. Unfortunately, my warm butter cake was way too hard and dry. Even the ice cream didn't help the dryness.

I love this place!  The wife and I have been here several times. The food is great. The atmosphere is unique.  Always ask to be seated in the treehouse!

Today we are here for dinner and we had the rack of lamb, the Hawaiian Big Eye Tuna and several sides.  

They start with a bread basket of several types.  I personally love the pretzel bread

The lamb was medium and perfect.  A nice char on the outside and moist and tender in the inside.  Standard presentation of a lamb "drum stick"

The tuna was barely seared and sashimi grade; served over a bed of carrots, onions, and celery with a beer and soy sauce. Served with wasabi and ginger. Great presentation.

Sides...mac and cheese, sweet sugar peas, and the garlic mashed potatoes.  Helpful hint - they actually offer a smaller serving size on a hr sides (not on the menu).  

No room for dessert today.

5 stars as always.

Surprised my wife with a trip to Vegas for our anniversary.  Stayed at Palazzo and have eaten at Craftsteak, Cut, Delmonico, and being from Chicago, we know our way around our Beef (Nine, Gene and Georgetti's, Gibsons, Chicago Chop House, Keefers, Kinzie...).  Considered return to Cut, booked and unbooked Carnevino and Prime before settling on Mastro's because of our evening plans (Mandarin Oriental for drinks) and because we've wanted to try the newbie here in Chicago.  

Request, and wait for if necessary, the tree house dining.  

Mike R (ASK FOR HIM, HE'S THAT GOOD) did an excellent job with the pacing of our meal.  He knew it was our anniversary and he made sure to congratulate us several times, chat us up without being intrusive, and sincerely took an interest in making our experience pleasurable.

Wife had the bone in Filet (12 oz) and I had the bone in Rib eye...plate, ordered the au gratin potatos to share (our server Mike R recommended one side to share due to the size) and the meal was worth every single of the five stars we are giving this place.    

For our anniversary, they treated us to their signature butter cake.  We were stuffed but did our due dilligence....very tasty, very good, and if you actually save room for it, worth ordering. 

Upon reflection, this was a perfect destination to celebrate an anniversary.  Live music was noticable, but not intrusive, the tree house, particularly when the sun went down, created a very romantic atmosphere.  Have read complaints about the setting (basically in the middle of the mall) but I don't share those complaints.  Yes, you are in a mall, albeit a mall the average person can walk through but not afford to shop in, but you hardly notice the people honestly.  Saw many people enjoying either bottles of wine (like us...oh, and yes the list has some mark up and bottles you would have to mortgage your home to afford, but also some very reasonably priced, well worth the mark up bottles to be enjoyed ... ) or their signature cocktails which were generous pours and will be on "the list" next time we visit.  

But I have to come back to Mkie R, he was a throwback, a restaurant professional who knows the food, knows the wine list, knows the importance of making your feel as though he is there only to make your experience memorable.  I am not kidding, REQUEST him when you visit, you will write me and thank me profusely if you do.  

We return to Vegas in September...will definitely drop by for drinks and desert at minimum.

I've debated about how many stars I should rate Mastro's Ocean Club, technically it deserves one less due to what happened during my dinning experience here but the customer service made up for a lot of the mistakes.

I was in Vegas with my girlfriend who had been there for a company conference, it so happened to also be my birthday weekend and I wanted an amazing meal on my Birthday before we headed back to LA. Mastro's had always been well recommended by friends and family so i was excited to have a birthday meal there. We have a few locations in the Los Angeles area but never had a opportunity to dine at one. 

We arrived a few minutes after opening and were seated promptly, our server (I forget his name :( so sorry) was amazing! Was very informative and accommodating. My girlfriend ordered the chilean sea bass and one prawn. I had the bone in rib eye steak and we shared a side of green beans and asparagus. My girlfriend ordered a delicious drink and while I couldn't decide on what to have myself our waiter brought out a amazing whiskey drink for me. 

Once the food arrived it all looked so yummy, and here is when the problems began. I had ordered my steak medium rare, when I cut into the steak it was more medium / medium well. I thought maybe it was just the surrounding edges that were overcooked because that tends to happen with rib eye steaks. Once I cut closer to the bone it was evident it was overcooked. I called over the waiter and quickly had my steak sent back and a new one was on its way out. My girlfriends sea bass was amazing but the prawn she ordered was overcooked. While I waited for my replacement steak to arrive the manager came to our table to offer their apologies which was much appreciated. My replacement steak took quite some time enough time for my girlfriend to finish her meal while I sat there waiting for my food. 

Once my new steak arrived I was eager to eat, the manager had them bring out fresh new sides which was unexpected but very appreciated. Manager had me cut into the steak to see if it was cooked properly and sadly it was also overcooked. I was disappointed and as I cut further in to check the center of the steak it was evident this steak was overcooked as well as chewy. The manager acknowledged it was overcooked and offered a replacement but at this point I just wanted to eat! I told him it was ok and that I would finish my steak and be on our way, needless to say my steak was comped. A few minutes into my second steak the manager let me know that they had another steak for me and I should slow down on finishing this one. I advised him I had no desire for a third steak and that there was no way I could finish it but he insisted.

My third steak was brought out and my second was taken away, again the manager asked me to check the cook on this third steak. Upon cutting into the steak it was raw, very raw...almost a blue steak. I was really disappointed at this point and the manager just walked away. Our server came to our table and asked me "Do you like your steak like that?" acknowledging how undercooked it was. At this point I was so upset that I just wanted to eat but could only finish a few extra bites. The manager brought out a free dessert with Happy Birthday written on the dish which was freaking delicious. The customer service is is really fantastic I can't stress that enough. Drinks are fantastic and the wait staff is top notch! And the steak was fantastic the next day when I had to for lunch and was reheated to a proper temp ;) 

I'll definitely return here for a second meal regardless of all the problems I experienced as I truly believe they deserve a second chance and I'll update my review accordingly. Thanks again to the staff at Mastro's Ocean Club for great service and attention. Special thanks to our waiter who was fantastic and to the manager who went above and beyond.

I heard so many good things about this restaurant. I finally treid it, expecting too much.. I was a bit dissapointed. Service was horrible.. You would think for a nice place it would be pristine. They served my mash potatoes on my plate like it was PRISON FOOD and served the rest of my party the same way. The food was ok not that amazing. I had the Salmon with mash and maccaroni, kinda pricey for the service you get. The food quantity was alot i must admit but it did not WOW me as much. I woudlnt reccomend this place, but if you like to try new restaurants like myself i would check it off my list.

I'm sure the entrees were delicious, but in this outing I was in a fast so all I had was vegges and water.  Now on the other hand everyone I was with at the table which was about 20 people loved their entree.  Next time I will indulge.

I came here with a part of 7 this evening. The service is excellent the food is great lots if attention to detail how everything is delivered in a timely manner. Our waiter was excellent and took good care of my table. Keep on going guys. I sure to come back soon. Cheers
One of the best steakhouses in Vegas if not the best! Had the wagyu Australian rib eye med rare. Great steak. Always great service also. Definitely check out mastros at aria if you have not. A++

My wife and I visited mastro's and was very impressed. I got the ribeye and it was one of the best steaks I've ever had. My wife got the brussel sprouts. She said they were great. The bathroom was like none that I've ever been to before. This was one of the best steakhouse experiences I've ever had. The only let down was it was very loud and the tables were very close to each other.

Oh My Goodness!  I had one of the best meals of my life.  The Calamari was delicious!  The Scallops were divine!  I ordered the Pacific Swordfish (my first time having it) and it did not disappoint.  Add to that the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and you've got a perfect meal!!   So wonderful!  If you get a chance to eat here, take it!

Had a 4.5 star meal, but not quite 5 star, at Mastro's on a Friday night.  It was very crowded, as in full, but we were seated promptly at our reservation time of 8:00.  We were seated in a high top kind of half-booth type table.  I'd not sat in something like this before, but it was comfortable.  The place was humming, but since it's open to the mall, it wasn't so loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation.  

Our server immediately approached us to take our water and drink orders.  She also provided a wine list, which was above average but pricey, which was expected given that Mastro's is located in Crystals on the Strip.  I didn't think it was out of line with other lists at similar places on the Strip.  

To start, I went with the lobster bisque.  This was one of the best versions of this dish I've had.  It was velveety smooth with a lot of chunks of lobster.  The sherry came through, and it was seasoned very well.  Just a creamy lobstery soup.  You may get some sticker shock given that it's soup, but I think it was worth it (I can't recall the exact price, I believe it was either $16 or $18).  Additionally, a friend and I shared the ahi tuna tostada.  These come 3 to an order, but I could have easily eaten another dozen.  The tuna serving is substantial, and all of the accompaniments (avocado, onion salsa, and chili sauce) are fantastic.  Crispy, flavorful, but not too heavy.  Loved it.

We split steaks among the table, opting for the traditional bone in ribeye and the wagyu bone in ribeye from Australia.  It was $110, but well worth it.  It was noticeably better than the other steak.  Not that the "regular" ribeye wasn't good.  It was.  But, the depth of flavor with the wagyu was significantly better.  Absolutely re-order if they have it available.  Plus, since we were sharing they offered to cut it for us in the back of the house, which we appreciated.

On the side, we had the peppercorn steak sauce.  It's good, but I don't know that it's worthy of its reputation.  I didn't think the steaks needed it, so I only had a couple of bites with it.  The lobster mashed potatoes are incredibly decadent, nearly swimming in lobster and butter.  The twice baked potato is good, but it's typical for this type of dish.

For dessert, we went with the famous butter cake.  It easily lives up to its reputation.  Warm, a little crispy on the outside, but impossibly moist and buttery.  Served with berries, ice cream, and plenty of whipped cream, it was an excellent end to a great meal.  

Service was fantastic the entire time.  Our server was there when we needed her but not overbearing.  Our food came out quickly, but we never felt rushed, despite knowing how busy they were that evening.  All in all, a great experience.  I can see why Mastro's has its reputation, I would absolutely return.

We've been coming to Mastro's since they opened in Vegas and have been to a few different locations in S. Cal and it one of my favorite places in Vegas.  We went the other night for my birthday and everything was excellent.  The seafood platter was fresh and come with great sauces.  All the steaks, chops and fish were really good as well.  The Butter cake is also a must!  Make sure to make a reservation, especially on a weekend and bring your wallet!!

Had a great anniversary dinner here over the weekend. The service was top notch, thank you Alan and all staff. The food was amazing. We had a 8oz filet, bone in filet, lobster mash, and mac-n-cheese sides. The meal was amazing. The food was delicious and rich, I was hungry but there was no way I could even put a dent in the sides. We ordered two specialty cocktails. The strawberry mule was one of the best drinks I've had in a long time. Thank you Mastro's for making our anniversary extra special. I hope to be back soon.

Comfy bar tables, and almost every entree was excellent...The Filet was perfect, one of the best pieces of meat I have ever had, 5*+ but the NY Strip was average at best. All the sides were excellent and service was great too. Overall a great experience and I will be back for sure.

Wonderful! Ultimate 5 star experience in Vegas! We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here. We loved the appetizer tower that can be mixed and matched. Oysters were fantastic. The cocktail shrimp vanilla  We sat inside the 'space ship' or 'UFO'... Be sure to request this seating during your reservation.

To begin... Cocktails: Paloma was fantastic for the tart drink lovers. Elderflower martini was better for the sweet tooth! 

Appetizer: Cocktail jumbo shrimp, vanilla battered shrimp & oysters... Delish! 


Salad: We split the iceberg Wedge, please note that in photo... It's only half. The bacon used was a sweet hickory smoked Wisconsin bacon. Amazing. 

Soup: Lobster Bisque. Phenomenal. Rich & Creamy. 


Entree: Filet. Ordered med well but the cut was too thick and it ended up well done on outside and almost rare in the middle, but it was still fantastic.

Side: King Crab & Black Truffle Gnocchi- TO DIE FOR. An absolute must. Yes, I actually chose this over my standard potatoes au gratin with steak and was do glad I did.

Creamed spinach was fantastic. 

We ended our meal with Cappuccinos.

Thank you for well educated wait staff and quality service.

Amazing restaurant! We had oysters Rockefeller and bone marrow for appetizer. Both were superb! Ribeye and rack of lamb for main course were absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was very inviting. The only draw back was the location in the mall. Will come back here every time  were in Vegas.

22oz Ribeye is outstanding!
Warm butter cake is the perfect desert!

My husband and I had a wonderful time at Mastro's. The food was excellent, nice ambiance, drinks were great, and the warm butter cake is ridiculous. We came back the next day to have the warm butter cake one more time before our flight home. The medium well petite filet was moist because our waiter offered to butterfly it, the bake potato was delicious, as well as the asparagus. The Blufeld Riesling was so smooth. It was a nice compliment to our meal. 

I saw people complaining about this Mastro's being in a mall. It is located in a mall but it is a high end shopping mall connected to Aria where other nice restaurants are located. I found the shape of the restaurant to be cool and it has a nice ambiance.

I had the following items:

Petit Filet
Scalopped Potatoes
Butter Cake

Everything was very good - all items were perfectly seasoned and I really felt satisfied with such a flavorful meal.  Ending the meal with the Butter Cake is the best choice you can make - it is so decadent and satisfying!

Great service and attention to detail here...it's a pricey spot, but worth the splurge.

Been to this restaurant many times and it NEVER disappoints me 

The steak is always cooked to perfection I always get medium rare and it's always on point  

I ALWAYS get oysters I'm a huge oyster fan have been for years 

Also ordered the shrimp cocktail seems weird when they bring them out it's only 3 but they r really big :) 

Also order the Alaskan king claws very big and lots of meat 

Also ordered the salmon which was cooked blacked very good as well

This place is always on point never been disappointed if you go here and u don't like it there's just something wrong with u

Way long overdue review of this fine establishment. Fine dining at its best. Hubby and I had our honeymoon last year from here. We enjoyed every moment of our visit.

The food and service is amaze balls. If you are a steak lover like I'am. Then this place is for you. It's super ultra expensive. I had my New York Strip steak for $57.00 alone. Yes alone meaning you have to order sides for extra cost. But mind you! You are getting the very best in high quality meat. So expect to pay that much. 

The sides comes out in family style in small platters. So you can take out what amount you want. 

The wait staff pays attention to detail about you're visit. The waiters aren't overbearing. Always ask to be seated in the birds nest for an amazing experience. The architecture of the birds nest is truly magical. 

Five stars all around. 

Go get you're steak now.

I've been here a couple of times now. I can't say I love and I wont say it sucks. There is just a lack of something that takes me from 4 to 3 stars. Service was outstanding both times. Very attentive waiters, but not annoying. The food is good, it's just not great. I haven't been wow'd either time. I enjoyed my meal, yes, but wasn't super crazy. Maybe its' the price point and I dont feel I'm truly getting my moneys worth. I had the ribeye the first time and the sole the second time. I've had the calamari appetizer (PASS on this, not good), the mussels (pretty good both times), I also had the wedge salad which I always enjoy. Again, food is good, I'm not complaining, it's just not great. Drinks are good but like the food, on the priceyer end.

Located in the Crystals at City Center, you can't miss this place as part of it sits in something that's supposed to be a sculpture called "the tree".  The sculpture itself is lost on most.  At any rate, my girl and I were in to celebrate a special occasion and Mastro's just happened to fit the bill for what we were looking for.

We started with Oysters on the half shell along with a Lobster Bisque.  The oysters were a good size, not too briny and of the east coast variety.  The Lobster Bisque was excellent.  Chunks of lobster and the soup itself was neither watery nor too thick but with proper consistency and the temperature just perfect.  Main courses consisted of Chilean Sea Bass for her and the Scottish Salmon Filet.  I put my trust in the chef and opted to be surprised in the preparation of my salmon, and I was not disappointed as everything was prepared exactly as requested.  Sides to accompany the entrees were the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and some sauteed Asparagus.  Drinks to accompany the meal was a nice Sauvignon Blanc (the name escapes me) which went with everything as per recommended by our server.

Service-wise:  very attentive.  Our server ran through all of the specials for the night and answered any questions we may have had including selecting the wine to go with our entire meal start to finish on top of being entertaining.  If a course was complete, someone was present to take the item away.  Our glasses were never empty and staff (including the manager) made it a point to be sure that our needs were met and that everything was fine.  Bonus points for giving us a table right along the edge inside of the "tree" sculpture.  

Word of warning:  portions are quite generous so either be prepared to share or come hungry.  

In short:  Top-notch service, good food, quality that pairs equally with the price.  You will not be disappointed.

Awesome Restaurant. Order the special dry ice Lemon Drop and Cosmopolitan Martini's. They are definitely not for the unobtrusive. The iceberg wedge salad, crab cake and Lobster Mashed Potatoes are great and my husband enjoyed his swordfish but the piece de resistance is the Butter Cake with fresh whipped cream. The service was impeccable and friendly. This was such a pleasant experience that we want to try the Mastro's in Beverly Hills, Chicago and AZ as well.

I've always said that you can judge a restaurant by it's bread as an indication of it's food. The bread basket at this particular Mastro's was a bad omen in itself. 

I've better had better escargot's at a Vietnamese restaurant in Little Saigon. My Chilean Seabass was a tragedy, usually my favorite fish. It had to be the oil or butter that they pan seared it in that tastes like gasoline and left me nauseated. It was the fist time I left Chilean Seabass half eaten.
The shoe string fries was mostly fried in the same horrific lard. Even ketchup couldn't salvage the flavor.

The mushrooms were good but my nausea keep me for enjoying them. 

The 18 oz bone in filet was had no character what so ever. Such a disappointment compared to other Mastro's that we dined at.

I've had good steaks at good restaurants. This place isn't it.

My wife and I celebrated her recent birthday here on Monday evening 10/25/10 and enjoyed and amazing dinner that far exceeded our highest expectations. This new outpost of Mastros is romantic and elegant with all of the true hallmarks of five star dining. 
We have previously been to Mastros in Beverly Hills and I much preferred this location as food and service were flawless as we've come to expect with the added touch of refinement and class that Mastro Beverly Hills seems to lack with the Nightclub atmosphere and Hollywood infused scene. 

The Food:

Appetizer:

Seared Sea Scallops -  Perfectly seared and prepared in a Garlic cream sauce. Accompanied by 2 Garlic Toasted Bread Crisps. Delicous.

Entrees:

Petite Filet (Medium) - Hers - Simple but perfect. Mastro's signature entree and they do it to perfection

Rack Of Lamb (Medium Rare) - Mine -  I love Lamb above all other meats and this is one of the best I can ever remember having. Bold but not gamey it flavor.
(Jiraffe in Santa Monica is a close 2nd.)

Sides:

Sauteed Mushrooms w/ Onions  - Sweet & earthy. The perfect compliment to tender Filet & Lamb when combined with Mastro's Fries. 

Sea Salt Shoestring Fries (No Vinegar) - Crisp and salty which just the right amount of texture.

Dessert - 

Chocolate Birthday Cake - Brought out complimetary. Nothing special but a nice birthday gesture. 

Warm Butter Cake Ala Mode - You simply HAVE to get this! 
No meal at Mastro's would be complete without it. My wife talked about this for days before our meal and reminisced about it for days after. It's simply the best enormous warm, buttery sugar cookie you've ever had paired with the smoothest vanilla bean ice cream you can imagine.

 I have to say we left very impressed with our Mastro's Las Vegas experience. It definitely raises Mastro's to our favorite special occasion restaurant from now on (Just not the Beverly Hills location.)With food, service and atmosphere this wonderful you just can't go wrong. 

Next up for us is Mastros in Thousand Oaks.

Worth every penny! Everything bite was beyond delicious. Best lobster bisque I've ever had. The filet with truffle butter was perfectly cooked and tender. We added creamed spinach, lobster mashed potatoes, and asparagus all were very good, especially the lobster mash potatoes. Nothing but good things with the warm butter cake. Even if you don't have room for dessert, you have to have the warm butter cake!!!

Decided to have a nice dinner with my husband and everyone recommended to come here.  We were both really excited and wanted to a enjoy a nice dinner even knowing that it would be pricey.  The server was very nice and a great salesman.  He knew exactly to recommend the most expensive items on the menu.

The bread basket is amazing!!!
I think the drinks are WAY too expensive especially with the Vodka that they offer, $18 for a martini with SKY vodka is ridiculous!

Ordered:
18 oz Bone in Filet Mignon - Medium
Lobster mashed potatoes
Mushrooms
and Truffle Fries
Note - side orders are really big and are family style.

Results:
Our steak even with the bone did not look 18 oz (not even close) our steak came rare, we sent parts of it back to cook just for a couple of more seconds and got it back totally well done and gross.  The Lobster mashed potatoes were ok and NOT worth $39 as you barely tasted the lobster and all you tasted were massive amounts of butter.  I would have been happy with garlic mash.  The mushrooms were amazing and probably the tastiest item we ordered.  The really expensive fries were soggy and didn't have much flavor at all.

The manager was nice enough to not charge us for the overly cooked steak but it was quite disappointing to go to specialty restaurant where they don't know how to cook their meat the right way.   Even after they took off the meat the bill came out to $140 and it was totally not worth it.  Very disappointed in our experience here.

I realize I am an outlier with my review. The staff was very friendly and we were escorted to our table at our exact reservation time. However, the lobster in the bisque was tough and chewy. The scalloped potatoes had an imitation cheese taste. My filet was terribly salty and undercooked. I ordered medium well and it was absolutely medium rare. Near purple center. I have never complained in a restaurant and would have if our waitress had ever come back. She stopped by when food was served and I was about to cut into my steak and never returned. After a long wait I finally had the bus boy clear it and asked him to find our waitress with the check. Total bill was $250 with a bottle of wine.

I'm so disappointed to write this review.  We had such high expectations of Mastro's having been to their other locations.  Celebrating our wedding anniversary and completely giddy, we sat down, ordered cocktails and dove into the incredible bread basket.  Our waiter seemed annoyed with us from the start, but no big deal, we ignored it.  I ordered chicken (please spare me the "you don't order chicken at a seafood place" lecture...I ordered it because it was on the menu, so let's get through that, k? Lol).  Our waiter was non-existent all evening, so he wasn't around at all for me to tell him that the chicken was glaringly under-cooked.  The manager happened to see us looking around and took it back to the kitchen.  He brought the same re-cooked piece back, but one spot (it was a really thick piece) still didn't look ok.  We had the flash light out and kinda debated if it was cooked enough, but the chance of eating slightly under-cooked chicken and getting sick was not an appealing option to me.  (And should I be having this debate at such a fine restaurant?).  I decided not to chance it, but not say anything.  The manager saw me not eating (our waiter was still in abandonment mode), took it away and insisted on replacing it with a filet.  The filet came out and was delicious and we were happy, albeit the mood had changed.  We felt like we had done something wrong.  Honestly, our least favorite meal of the whole weekend.  No butter cake, no second drinks--happy anniversary to us.  :(

Thank you to the manager for not charging us for my chicken or filet and really trying to fix it, but I'm so sad we spent our anniversary there.

Food was delicious. I ordered a kansas city steak (bone in) rib eye. Ordered lobster mac &cheese, scallop mash potatoes, creamed spinach for sides.  For a group of 6, one side dish only feeds a lot of people.

The service is superb, server always checked on us, got dessert complimentary since it was all of our first time there. We got lucky that night.

I would definitely return. I've visited the Mastros in Beverly hills, California location and it is also good food, service in vegas was even better though.

EXCELLENT service. OUTSTANDING FOOD. We try to come every time we are in town.

My favorite restaurant in Vegas. Even beats the Ocean Club in Newport Beach CA. They give you the right amount of service at the table, checking on you timely but without interrupting or being overbearing. When the set up the table, I saw the manager readjusting to make sure the setting was perfect, they even put a light on the wine and water glasses to make sure they are perfectly clean! Everyone is super polite, you are rushed but not left unattended either. They have nailed it! We really appreciated it.

Food is delicious. From the bread, to the crab cocktail, to the steak, lobster mashed potatoes and last but not least the butter cake. All to die for. 

You really get what you pay for here! And it's worth it! Thank you!

Went here with my wife and two adult kids on recommendation from our Concierge at the Green Valley resort. The ceasar salad and warm spinach salad were perfect and they let you split portions. We had the salmon and three boneless filets with garlic mashed potatoes. Again they let us split the potatoes 4 ways. Steak and Salmon was some of the best that I ever had. Service was impeccable. Prices are very fair especially because they let you split the salads and sides.
Tried this place for dinner and was not impressed.  Had lamb chops and scalloped potatoes. The potatoes were half cooked and the lamb was bland

Went in expecting a decent experience in vegas......came out with wonderful reviews and I could not have asked for more. So let's not be generic and give detailed reviews. To start. I can not give a better, more glowing review for our server, Valerie Bynan. Notice please that I listed her name because she made a great meal amazing. Wonderful advice without being pushy, delightful enthusiasm and just in general a wonderful person. I had the scallops and the ahi tarte...both delish and cooked to perfection. The scallops were cooked to perfection and seasoned perfectly. My complements to the chef. We heard the butter cake was great and let me say.....try it. Simple. Amazing. Savory. I loved every bite! I give five stars and I am very picky, detail oriented and do not give five stars easily!

The food and service was on point here at Mastro's. 

I always heard great things about it and I am so glad I finally tried it. 

To start, I had the steamed mussels. Although the mussels were small the sauce and cheeses croutons were incredible. I took advantage of all the various breads they had in the basket just to dip in the sauce and
Indulge more. 

For dinner I had the Hawaiian tuna served sashimi style. It was seared with Asian inspired flavors and didn't make you feel so heavy. I will say that it is a quite a portion and initially seeing it can be overwhelming. 
They warn about the size of the side portions so please think it through or else you will have way too much. I had a table of 4 and we battled to eat everything cause it was yummy but man I came out of there a fatty wack. I LOVED the Cream corn and Alaskan Crab truffle gnocchi. Done deal with those two! I had the lobster mash and yes it had big chunks of lobsters and it was good but not as great as it's hype was. We also had sautéed broccoli and honestly it looked steamed. They serve you the sides which I thought was a great service. 

They gave us their signature butter cake. Topped with ice cream and fresh fruit with a side of whipped cream. If you even last this long to have dessert then order it. Warning-the portion is again good for 3-4 person so think it through before you order. 

I would highly recommended this place. It's ambiance is okay because it still does feel like you are still in the shopping area even though you can't see it too much. Great service and great food. You really can't go wrong.

The bad - made reservations at 9, didn't get seated until 10, paying $15 for a drink, it better be a damn good drink. Far from it. We are in Vegas there are plenty of options at here, so for not being in a club, i didn't want to pay $15 for a bad drink

I split the special - waygu steak bone in, it was a huge piece of meat, but for a $100 i truly didn't see why this was such an expensive piece of meat 

The good - the manger did come over due to us waiting an hour before we got seated and she brought over some Beef Carpaccio which was some of the best i have ever had.

The Ok - Lobster Mashed Potatoes, sounded better then they tasted.

I wouldn't recommend this place and i will not be coming back.
Another great dinner there last night.  Filet great as usual.  My wife had the Tuna which was delicious.  Maybe our favorite place in town.

And we can't stop
And we won't stop
Can't you see it's we who own the night?
Can't you see it's we who 'bout that life at...MASTRO'S OCEAN CLUB! - Miley Cyrus (we can't stop)

I made reservations here the day of as I wanted to watch a cirque show but didn't know if we wanted to watch the earlier or the later showing. No problems here, as Mastro's was very accommodating. When I came to check in, they were already aware that I had a two hour window before the show and made sure I'd be good to go. Off to a great start!

Seeing as I didn't eat any steak earlier in the trip, I had to get one here. It was super tasty and although a little closer to medium than medium rare, turned out to be just as fantastic. The chilean sea bass, which many yelpers have gotten, is excellent pan seared and a good sized portion as well. We also ordered sides of the lobster mashed potatoes and a half order of the Alaskan crab black truffle gnocchi. Both were served table side and both had huge chunks of lobster and king crab, respectively.

With about half an hour to go, our waitress knew about our showtime as well and brought us out the signature butter cake, which is a must order here. You're in Vegas; this thing is crazy buttery but oh man, you have to try it. If I'm staying at the Aria again next time, I would order this dessert to go to take back to the room.

Huge thumbs up for excellent service and the live music was fun and we got on our way on time. With a very cool atmosphere and location, I want to thank Mastro's for a memorable meal, I approve!

I had made reservations to celebrate my mother-in-laws birthday. We wanted it to be special and seeing 4.5 stars in Yelp, I figured I was sure to impress. 

They did accommodate my request to sit in the tree house section of the restaurant, which I appreciated. Unfortunately, that's about all that went right for the evening. Our server was very aloof and completely inattentive. It felt as though we were bothering her by our existance.

We brought our drinks from the bar and were met by our server fairly promptly. After the perfunctory "welcome to Mastros" which seemed a strain for her to do, we didn't see our server for at least 20 Min's before she came back to check on us & take our order. She was very indifferent to our even being there, so much so, that I made the comment to my wife, that she was probably having a bad day. 

Here's where the fun begins. After receiving our salads which were very good, the fire alarm in the entire mall and restaurant started going off. So here we are with bright lights flashing all around us and the blaring wooooop......wooooop of the alarm is drowning out the piano player while everyone of the staff is walking around as if nothing is going on. We are all looking at ourselves and asking each other, is this for real? should we be evacuating? What if there is a fire? Finally after a FULL 10 minutes of this, I ask another server passing by what was going on. She politely said "ohhh it's probably just a door someone opened" and went on her merry way". 

When our dinner arrived, our server never said a word about the incessant fire alarm blaring for the last 30 Min's. Not an "I'm sorry about this" or "don't worry there is no emergency", or we are working on shutting it off. No....Nothing at all. She just dropped off our food not to be seen again until I asked for the check. It was very bizarre 

Now about the food. We all had some type of fish. Which was mostly good. I thought my dusted halibut was very bland. I only ate half of my serving even though I was rather Hungary. The Gorgonzola mac & cheese was very good. The asparagus was decent. 

All told we finished up and even canceled the birthday desert  I reserved, because we couldn't stand the fire alarm any longer. The only thing our server said was, " ohh your leaving,? yeah I guess the fire alarm is a bit annoying. Which is kind of like saying, " yeah Vegas a bit warm in the summer". 

All told, the food was 3.5 stars and the service was 1 star. At least I impressed my mother-in-law with the Jersey Boys show right before dinner. Now that was 5 Stars!

I love Mastro's!  We went for our first anniversary dinner after having gone on our honeymoon last year. The food was so amazing we had to come back.  We were greeted at our table with 2 glasses of champagne to celebrate. We spilt the most delicious wedge salad and it was good. Last year we had apps and the lobster mashed potatoes as a side. Those were so good they'll make you wanna slap your momma!  We were so full I am embarrassed to say we didn't even finish our steaks. This year we switched to Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese...epic!  I had the bone-in ribeye and my wife ordered the 12oz filet mignon.  Both were the finest steaks we've ever had. You will never appreciate any other steak after that. Mastros ruined steak for me, talk about melt in your mouth. Our server Mark was phenomenal and super attentive. A really nice guy. For desert they brought out the warm butter cake...wonderful!  Mastros is the only place I would eat in my life if I had the choice. Thank you  for a wonderful first anniversary dinner. GO THERE!!!!

This steakhouse is heaven on earth. The ribeye and filet are excellent, even the sides were amazing asparagus - yum, lobster mashed potatoes were so worth the extra lbs. Our server was charming and helpful in every way. Definitely worth the splurge. Love you Mastro's!!

LOVE, love, love this restaurant!  What a treat and a perfect way to end an already awesome Vegas trip.  This restaurant is located within the new City Center mall and was ultra convenient to get to from the Aria Hotel.  We started the night by sitting at the live Piano Bar in the lounge and ordering Pomegranate Martini's on dry ice.  The Martini's bubbled from the dry ice.  It was very cool and they were oh so good.

As far as the food goes... the meat is so tender and cooked to perfection.  My husband and I split an 18 oz. Bone-In Steak and it was more than we could possibly eat.  The steak was gigantic.  It was also really nice that they cut it for us and brought it out on two plates.  With 4 people we ordered 3 separate side dishes and it was way too much food.  One side will feed 3 - 4 people easily, but they are all so good you have to try more than one. 

By the time the chocolate birthday cake was served we were all so full that we had one bite and that was all but it was really good too.

The servers were really good and the atmosphere was perfect.  The tree house was really neat.

This is a definite must try.  Oh and I almost forgot... We shared the Lobster Bisque to start and it was the best ever.  We also really enjoyed the different breads in the basket.  I think the waitress said that the Pretzels come from Germany.  If you want an amazing dinner you have to try this place.

Absolutely recommend Mastro's Ocean Club.  We had a wonderful experience in the tree house.  We started with an apple martini and a berry martini.  The apple martini comes out smoking, we also saw a Cosmo come out the same way.  A really cool touch!  We order an appetizer of shrimp cocktail, it come with three but since there were two of us Lionel ( our server) suggested we get four, so we did.  They were huge and very tastie.  The cocktail sauce was delicious along with some very hot horseradish, perfect balance.  We also ordered ahi tuna as an appetizer, this was amazing too.  Ordered salmon prepared blackened style and my husband order tuna Asian style with a side of asparagus.  We ordered way to much food as the portions are very generous.  We then had raspberries sorbet, which was to die for.   So, I mentioned large portions..we took home tuna, salmon and asparagus to our hotel room and ate a wonderful lunch in the room the next day.  They also boxed up the bread, which is a variety of sourdough, pretzel roll and something like a baguette.  Our lunch was just as good as our dinner.  I mentioned Lionel earlier in my post.  Well, you must request him as your server, he is personable and very professional at the same time.  Be sure to sit in the tree house.  It is expensive, but well worth the splurge!

Mastros over delivers every time! There are plenty of solid restaurants in Vegas, but no one provides the level of service Mastros does. The hamachi appetizer was amazing! Colossal size stone crab claws were lights out! Steaks are always cooked spot on and seasoned perfectly! Worth every penny you spend.

***UPDATE***
After posting the following review, I was contacted via Yelp by a person calling herself "Kate G.". Kate stated, "I would like to get your phone number so that our corporate side can look into this and discuss." I asked Kate G. who she was & she stated she was Landry's Social Media Coordinator. Why didn't you tell me that in your first e-mail? Ummm, I don't hand out my phone number to random internet contacts!
Why on earth would I give my phone number to Kate? Does she think I want to be bothered my her or Corporate? I can't be bought off with a gift certificate from Landry's. I will never eat there again. I filed a complaint with the Southern Nevada Health District!!! So, listen up Kate G., you can NOT have any of my personal information. May I suggest you introduce yourself before asking for someone's phone number. BTW, I still have nightmares over what happened to me! 

I got so ill after eating here I thought I would die. Never again! I had a steak, loaded potato, green beans & one glass of wine. I'll have PTSD whenever I think of that night.

Beautiful restaurant that catches your eye. The staff was really nice and knowledgeable. The food is pricey but it's located inside of Crystals so that's to be expected. The beef carpaccio was delicious, the oysters were fresh and my mom ordered the sea bass which was perfectly cooked and tasty. I told them that it was my mother's birthday and they brought out a cake with a candle for her on the house. Great surprise. Great staff, great food and overall great experience! A must to check out.

Best restaurant in the entire world! Its a hidden gem because its in a mall and less crowded than restaurants in casinos but dont let the crowd size fool you. Ive been there probably 20 times and ive never had a bad anything. Ive had everything on the menu because we often go to dinner with about 20 people so we order everything. Great wines, really fresh seafood, but the side dishes and desserts is what really sets them apart from others. My fav sides are brussels sprouts, scalloped potatoes, creamed corn, gorgonzola mac n cheese and mushrooms. For desserts nothing is better than the butter cake and pecan pie. If youre not a fan of raspberry sauce like myself you can order the butter cake without the raspberry and its heavenly! Its romantic enough for a date and trendy enough for dinner before going out with friends- like i said best restaurant in the entire world!

The ambiance was pretty rad. It's not you're usual dimly lit steakhouse. It's right in the middle of Crystal and very bright. I liked the modern decor and the live music was a nice touch. The service was great. The bathroom attendant made me feel like I was a a club. 

My bone-in filet (12ox) was tasty, but I personally miss the crisp edges and extra butter on the Ruth Chris' steak. The Mastro side dishes though, definitely beat Ruth Chris'. I loved the Truffled Gnocchi, Lobster Mash Potatoes, Sweet Potato Fries, and Oysters Rockefeller. 

My highlight of the night was the butter cake! Yummy!

We splurged (again) to enjoy mastro's great food and service.  This last visit was our second visit and we weren't disappointed at all.  TIP: to guarantee your spot, always make a reservation.  Las Vegas ocean club has the beautiful tree house and I even asked to sit in there.  They brought us to the bar while we waited for our table.  

I was pleasantly surprised that the drinks we ordered were actually strong; usually other restaurants are stingy with their alcohol.  Maybe it was due to being in Las Vegas, but those drinks were tasty and strong.  A few minutes later we were seated inside the tree house.  The staff were very attentive to us.  We ordered ahi tuna and a filet to share. A couple of side orders of veggies, salad, crab cakes and some bread completed our meal.  I really thought that we would not have enough food but I couldn't finish it all!

We promised ourselves that we would come back just for dessert- and we did return the next day! - just for the chocolate pudding cake and their cheesecake.  I LOVE their pudding cake and I am not a chocolate person!  Again, their service was outstanding. Crazy busy on a Friday or Saturday night or slow like a Sunday dinner, the staff never forgot about you.

If you ever want to experience great service and food - consistently, mastro's ocean club in Las Vegas is a sure bet.

GREAT steak!
Had the bone-in ribeye... delicious. 
Minimal sides as the Vegas "eating tour" had me full, but definitely couldn't miss the dessert (chocolate cake, crumb cake and whipped cream). 
A must-do next time you are in Las Vegas!

Keep in mind this is the first steakhouse I've ever been to that was more than $50 per person so I'm easily impressed.
Off the bat I felt out of place in my "los pollos hermanos" graphic t-shirt, basketball shorts, and flip flops, but they made me feel welcome anyways.
The service was nuts, by the time I entered and had my plate of food, I was probably introduced to like 8 different people, all of them friendly and accomodating. They work super fast and efficient too, the lady swooped around behind me and refilled my water without me even noticing. When they brought out our food, they had a person for each plate, and put it all on our table within a few seconds. I was like daaaayuuummm sooonnnn. food was great too.
Mediocre steak (for this level place). Great lobster. Unimpressive decor overlooking mall. Very good Mac & Cheese (though not best). Extra large dessert, with great whipped cream.

Several friends were in town and they booked dinner at a different restaurant, after the entrees were consumed I suggested we walk a few blocks to Mastro's Ocean Club in the Crystals at CityCenter for desert and nightcap beverages. It's one of my favorite steakhouses in Vegas and #1 choice for outstanding deserts and port wines or a glass of late harvest liquid gold (Far Niente Dolce). Made a quick reservation on Yelp and we showed up around 9:30pm. The bar was lively. I ordered one Chocolate Pudding Cake and one Cherry Crisp, plus the "100 years flight of Port flight" and a glass of Dolce. The dark chocolate pudding cake was warm, fresh, and delicious. The liquid cream and fresh whipped cream, serving of blackberries and mint were exceptional and we all enjoyed. The Cherry Crisp was scrumptious. Highly recommend this venue as the architecture is remarkable, service attentive and friendly (Kaitlyn was wonderful) and it's convenient to The Strip action.

There were 7 of us for dinner.. What we all loved was the personal recommendations from the servers.. From the drinks to the apps to the entrees.. It was pricy, but it was worth it! We got the seafood tower, lots of steaks and recommended sides.. And a free birthday cake/ice cream.. That was amazing... 

We all enjoyed ourselves, everything was great!

Got to freeload a meal at Mastro's last week. Been to all the Mastro's restaurants except the thousand oaks location so i'm very familiar with their food. 

a little surprised by the bar area - kinda small felt a little claustrophobic . Asked for a michelob ultra - sorry , we ran out ...on a tuesday ?!?!? 

the restaurant is cool looking but i don't need our waiter to babble on about who designed it, how much was spent, blah blah blah 

Let's focus on the food. 

Started with the seafood tower - solid . Of course, the pretzel bread - still my fav pretzel bread though CUT gives Mastro's a run for the $$$. 

I went for the meat - Bone in rib eye, some creamed spinach and asparagus. Of course, my fav, the blue cheese/oil oil and garlic sauce for the steak ( pic ) ...decent but not to the level of the mastro's in B. Hills and Costa Mesa . The rib eye was also average - the talk about the plate being 400 degrees when it's brought to you - i think they needed to add the 400 degrees to the broiler - i ordered medium but it was rare. more bothersome, it didn't have that nice outer sear bordering on crunch - it was too soft ! flavor was decent. 

Some nice pinot noir wines - even though the host gave me the wine list to order, i showed restraint - a Laetitia from Paso Robles and a forgotten Oregon - both under $90 each
Went with a group of friends and the food was just ok. The service was ok and the price was high. I must say I thought the decor was nice and cozy, considering its in the center of the busy mall.

Fab!

Make a reservation and sit in the 'treehouse.'

I was a bit concerned when I read reviews because I am a HUGE fan of the LA location but everything was GREAT! 

Who knew items from the Seafood Tower can be served warm?!?! Pre-cracked Crab Legs? 2lbs heated up please!

The 12oz Petit Filet was devine.

Gnocci with Truffle and Crab, Shrimp Scampi, Sweet Potato Fries... Oh boy!

The staff was also very aware of show times and kept asking to ensure we did not miss our show.

If you are a seafood lover, be sure to make a pit stop here.  Absolutely gorgeous design, impeccably-trained staff, delicious food and excellent booze selection make this establishment a winner.  Only issues are the mall location. Also, I made a reservation yet I was made to wait in the bar for 30 minutes, yet I noticed tourists in shorts with their Forever 21 bags sitting there eating dinner, they were obvious walk-ins so I wasn't pleased about waiting.  Bathroom is a hassle, requiring an elevator or flight of stairs.  But one of the best restaurants in Vegas.  Oh if you are expecting to eat cheap here, forget about it, you're looking at about 75 per person, without drinks.

Everything from the bread basket to my appetizer to my steak to dessert to service was outstanding at Mastro's!!  I have nothing bad to say about this place.  Okay, if I had to pick one thing... I would say if you're looking for a "romantic" dinner date setting, I would probably say this is NOT the place.  It's in the middle of a mall.  But, romance is what you create so to me, if the food is good and service is great, that's really what counts!  Our server was awesome.  He made great recommendations, was attentive, was kind, was not annoying in the sense that he was trying to recommend only the most expensive things.  He was honest about what was good and not just based on price.  The steaks were cooked to perfection and they are huge!!!  You can seriously share a steak.  Like really.  The sides were amazing and also huge.  I mean seriously... Truffle Gnocchi!?!?  Holy hell!  And Lobster Mash?!!!  Yes please!  And you need to save room for the butter cake. You just have to.  It was so good.  I mean like really good.  I don't know what else to say, it really was that good!

I felt like we were eating in a spaceship with the extrordinary architectural design of this restaurant. Once the food started to come, you completely forgot about everything else except the STEAK.  The tomahawk steak is a gigantic rib eye with the RIB still attached and it is HUGE!  I split it with someone and still only could eat half of my half.  But that half...oh my! Tender, tasty and cooked perfectly.  The sides were decadent with the lobster mashed potatoes and the ever yummy mac and cheese.  My favorite side?  brussel sprouts! Amazing, just try them.  And for dessert, even though we couldn't eat anymore, the butter cake. Unbelievable.

Great food, great service just a little pricey for a date night. I would suggest this as a great place for a customer dinner. Plenty of food options that would satisfy anyone's needs. The sides were great too and large enough to share. I recommend the sea bass with sautéed mushrooms and the creamed corn.

Went here to the bar the other weekend.  Order the Sauteed Shrimp and the Clam Chowder to munch on while we ordered some drinks.  Both apps were great.  Went with the Classic Long Island and saw the bartender use top shelf booze so I was happy with that.  Overall, we had a gift card to the place and came away happy and satisfied even though I wouldn't normally spend $20 per drink or app but everything was delicious none the less.

Note: Dress code says business casual but since it's located in a mall and it's Vegas, they're pretty lenient on it.

Quite pricey but you honestly get what you pay for and more here. One of my favorite places to eat on special occasions. I went here first with my girlfriend for an anniversary and also with my family for New Years. I recommend their fish since they are known for their seafood here. The service is top notch and be sure to tell them if you came for an anniversary since they usually hook you up with some sort of dessert! If you like alcohol with your meal I definitely recommend their lemon drops. It was so amazing I asked the waiter how they make it and they told me they soak their vodka with lemons for a long period of time to get the flavor. It tastes so delicious I could barely tell there was any alcohol in it but I felt it hit me after a glass. One of the best drinks I have ever tried. Be sure to make a reservation as well. I never had too much trouble making one and they did seat me earlier since we got there 20 minutes early but it always seems quite packed. This restaurant would definitely make my top 5 of the best restaurants I have gone to in terms of service and food quality.

Good, straight forward fish house / steakhouse.  Best of all, you get to dine in a contemporary "pod" in the middle of Crystals (they call it a tree house, either way its cool).  Unfortunately, because of it's mall location, it doesn't feel like a special occasion, destination restaurant rather  "I'm hungry after all YOUR shopping, oh look, a restaurant, let's eat".

With the exception of a few starters and a hand full of mains, you get exactly what the menu says, unadorned. No special sauces, no veg.  Just fish or beef on a plate.  

Portions are large.  Unless you're hungry, pass on the starters.  They are traditional (raw bar, seafood cocktails).  You can get them anywhere.  

Fish is expertly cooked to order.  The thick cut fillet of pan roasted Chilean sea bass and salmon are excellent.  Cooked medium with no sign of albumin (white substance that comes out of fish if the cooking temperature is too high).  Both were moist and naturally oily, exuding their naked fish flavors.  

Good quality prime steaks.  Decent aging.  Good selection of bone in cuts.   Sadly, nothing sets them apart from other quality steakhouses in Vegas.  The bone in fillet is tender, mildly flavored.  No complaints.  

For sides, its gotta be the rich and incredibly flavorful, king crab and truffle dressed gnocchi or the lobster mashed potatoes.  Chunks of lobster enveloped in a buttery mash that explodes with lobster flavor.  I could eat either an a main and be happy!  

Solid wine list.  Vegas resort pricing.

Sometimes "a kiss is just a kiss..."  and that's fine by me.

First time here. We had a private dining room for large group. Dinner overall was great. Seafood towers ordered & very fresh. Ordered swordfish but it was a bit salty and was not able to eat it all (didn't care to send it back, it was very tender though) Lobster mash & other vegetable side dishes were good, didn't care for the lobster mac n cheese.  My husbands steak was good, others ordered the salmon which looked delicious, will order the salmon or steak next time around. I've never had ahi tuna which was also ordered by some in the group & they were very happy with their choice (it did look good). . The waiters hustled, but at the end of our meal I requested a coffee & never got it while others did. We managed to get dessert the warm butter cake. Yum!!!  It just felt like they were overwhelmed.  I'd rather come to visit just the hubby & I for our 2nd visit.
Delicious food, a special occasion restaurant for sure!

We decided to go to Vegas for a nice three-day weekend and we went and had dinner at Mastro's it was amazing the king crab legs were to die for! My cheesecake for dessert was so big I actually had to take a to go bag and I hate to go bags!  But I couldn't leave it behind it had chocolate covered strawberry's around it !:-) The customer service was perfect as well.

My boyfriend and I came here with his parents and the first point I'll make to get your attention is that our bill came out $450. Now that i've got your attention.

Service: One word excellent. I'd like to start off by saying that I came here for my 21st birthday and you know how usually you'll mention it to restaurants in hopes of getting something free and they'll come out with some weak bite sized dessert. My boyfriend's parents were the one who mentioned it and I quickly got a happy birthday and I expected nothing of it after. But for dessert I actually got a full on, very generous portion of a piece of chocolate cake (with raspberries!). It had come while I was in the bathroom so I wasn't expecting the waiter to relight it again but he actually did! The waiters were very nice, they made jokes and conversation (not just about food but where we were from, etc) They really knew their stuff, like not just knew what the specials were but they were very knowledgeable about their menu.

Food: For starters we ordered escargot, chilled seafood, and crabcakes. The escargot was probably the disappointment of the evening. I've had much better elsewhere. There was just no taste or not a great taste. It wasn't gross or anything but I've just basically tasted better marinated or sauced escargot. For the chilled seafood, you're allowed to pick however many pieces you want and what seafood you want on it. It came in this platter that had dry ice in it. The shrimp were so plump and juicy. The crab was the best part though. I don't even know how to describe it but my boyfriend and I were fighting for the last pieces, just popping them into our mouths one by one. 
-Rack of Lamb: So juicy! It was probably the best lamb I've ever had. The taste was there, it was perfectly cooked. 

Dessert: We ordered their signature cake and it was very unique. I don't think I"ve ever tasted anything like it but I wasn't raving about it as much as the rest of my table were. It tasted like butterscotch or toffee angel/sponge cake. I couldn't really put my foot on what it was, it was just so different. 

Bathroom: This is actually the first bathroom I've been to where it had a bathroom attendant who handed you towels. They had tampons and other amenities on the counter. She opened and closed the door for me. It's too bad I didn't have my wallet to tip her but she was very nice. 

View: Where we were seated, you could basically look out into the mall and people watch. 

My boyfriend and I will definitely be back to this chain, maybe for an anniversary.

I will preface this review with the fact that family was in town and this dinner was free!

We had reservations for Saturday Night  at 8:30 pm for a group of 7. I am always leery of a restaurant that is in the middle of a mall. I don't care how fancy the mall is, I think mall food every time I dine at one. Mastro's my friends is no Mall Food Place.

The Service was top notch, we had a waiter and 2 bussers, while I'm sure they had different tables, they were always there when we needed them. It was like they were our dedicated staff.

The meal was top notch, starting with the amazing bread basket, continuing through the entrees, the family style sides, and ending up with an amazing dessert (which they comped to the table).

The Bread basket was a good start, it had Pretzel Bread, olive bread, a Parmesan crisp, and few other breads. The sides were amazing, they are served family style in surprisingly large portions. We had Creamed Corn (some of the best I've ever had), Creamed Spinach, Lobster Mashed Potatoes, King Crab Gnocchi, and Mushrooms. We also had a few salads to pass around the table, 2 Caesars (one regular and one spicy), Tomato and Onion, and Tomato and Mozzarella. A seafood tower and crab cakes were also ordered, I'm not much of a seafood guy but everyone else loved it. 

They entrees were pretty stellar as well, I was splitting the 33oz Wagyu Tomahawk cut with my uncle, but since he was too full from the salads and sides, I had to man up and eat the whole thing myself (the things I have to do). This was one of the best pieces of Cow I've had in my life (and I've had A LOT of cow). It was cooked just a touch under medium rare (perfect IMO), the marbling in the meat was insane, and it came out on a scorching hot plate. I don't know how they cooked it but it was perfect. 

Table mates also got the Seabass, A Filet, and a few other meats, I was very impressed with the size of their portions, most places would serve about 4oz of fish, but their filets were about 12oz servings.

After dinner, they brought out a Warm Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream for the table, it was a great end to the meal, and comping it was a nice touch!

I have no clue what the meal ran, but it was amazing. My only complaint is that their bar area isn't the best, if they're going to make you wait 10-20 mins for your table they need more room in the bar. They did however have a great piano player and singer who played a variety from christmas carols to current hits which only added to the amazing meal.

Will I be back, hopefully, especially if someone else is picking up the tab!

Completely disappointed by Maestro's restaurant in Las Vegas.  I read such wonderful reviews on yelp and was really looking forward to it. My husband and I went there for our 1 year wedding anniversary dinner. I made reservations a month before the big day and requested to have a bottle of champagne upon our arrival.  

We ordered the beef Carpaccio to start.  It took about 20 minutes for them to take that initial order and another 20-30 minutes for them to bring it out.  The beef Carpaccio was SO salty and came with a weird Caesar salad combination on top as aside. The dressing of the salad ruined the flavor of the meat if the salt didn't already to it. 

As our main entrees we ordered a petite filet and lamp chops. DRY, DRY, DRY! I'm sorry but if we are paying over +$50 a plate we expect mouth watering tender meat.  That wasn't the case at all. So disappointed. 

To end the evening we were so disappointed by the slow service, the bad appetizer and unsatisfactory entrée we didn't even want dessert. As the waiter brings the +$200 check he just says Happy Anniversary and walks away.  No complimentary dessert or glass of champagne as most places would have done. Oh well...I will go back to SAGE inside Aria which is the BEST steak house I have ever been too.

We had our first company dinner here and it was absolutely amazing!!!! We got a private room for a party of about 25-30 people. The food the service the ambiance was incredible!! I wish we got the room in the funky looking boat thingy but eh i ain't complaining. 

We had selected menus from the choices we voted on as a company. The food came out promptly and it looked like something out of a magazine. The food was amazing. The side dishes were incredible as well (: They catered to our every needs no matter how silly it was hahah ^^

First off, location, location, location.  While it has the name, with this spot inside a shopping mall, you know something else make up for it.  Unfortunately with the rather loud "Billy Joel wannabe" pianist playing all night, and the shoppers strolling by looking at your dining selection, this place does not rate as well as it should.  

While the service was outstanding, the quality was mediocre when comparing it to other similar, better located, places in Vegas.  Price hurts a little too...guess the uberMall rents are high so the costs need to be passed along to the diners.

Since service is one half of a successful dining experience, this is what saved it from garnering a single star.

If you are looking for convenience and staying at Aria or Vdara, you could try this place....or you could walk a little further to other higher end dining experiences.

Celebrated my birthday here. Delicious food all night long. Ordered the Sauteed Sea Scallops as an appetizer, Bone-In Ribeye, Lobster Mashed Potatoes (a MUST!), Creamed corn (delicious and not too sweet), and Sauteed Asparagus. And they threw in a slice of delicious chocolate cake. Very happy with the excellent service and dining experience.

I have been to this restaurant 3 times, and each time gets worse and worse. 


1: Was seated, and unattended to for 5 minutes. No menus, water, nothing. This would be understandable if the restaurant was busy, but 7-8 servers were just standing around talking on the opposite side. 

2: I ordered a glass of wine and the proper way to serve it would be to have me try it first before pouring the glass. It was brought out like a coctail. 

3: I was given 2 choices for water- flat and sparkling. I said flat and was charged $17 for 3 glasses of water filled twice. 

On to the food....

I have long given up on the entrees at Mastros. I have never received an entree that lived up to standards. 

We ordered the following:

Clam chowder- pretty good 
Lobster bisque- delicious
Crab coctail- amazing
Crab cakes- way too fishy
Lobster mashed potatoes- amazing
Gorgonzola Mac n cheese- too rich for my taste. Could only have one bite 
Brussel sprouts- perfect
Bone marrow- burnt to a crisp and could not scrape any marrow out 
Butter cake- the one thing that saved the entire meal 

In the future , I will have dinner elsewhere and come to Mastro's for coffee and dessert only.

The food and service were both excellent. We tasted each other's main courses and I liked the fish better than the steak (I ordered the boned fillet). The lobster mashed potatoes and their signature desert (butter cake) is an absolute must.

Highly recommend Mastro's...
Service: 5+ stars 
Exceptional service from Katie. Katie did an amazing job recommending the food, specialty drinks, and wine. She was very knowledgable on the entire menu. Katie's  attention to detail was on point! 

Food: 
Halibut/blackened: amazing. Very tasty and nice texture
Bone In Filet: amazing: thickness and quality was great
Sides: Very large portions.... Loaded baked potato: very tasty. Creamed Spinach: best ever had
Dessert: cheesecake. Comped for birthday...very good homemade new york style cheesecake. 

Drinks: great value for drink. Oversized portions pf wine and double liquor on martinis, plus an amazing selection of both. 

Overall: best dinner/drinks/service in Vegas. Will definitely be going back....especially to try the butter cake Katie recommended!

We searched so many fine steak houses. Most were four stars and just a few were 4.5.
