We talked about it at the restaurant, as we were leaving the restaurant, while we were next door at the Aria casino, on our flight home, and ever since we've been back home.  They are out of this world.  We were so sad that we weren't able to take home the leftovers.

Dessert: what hasn't been said about the Warm Butter Cake already?  Just get it already.

This place is spendy--and totally worth every penny.

I think it is actually called the "tree house", but I kept calling it the birds nest. Whatever it was, it was cool!! Now, keep in mind, this was a business dinner that I was at, so anything goes when it comes to ordering!! 

As far as what I had, I started with the chopped salad. Delish! For dinner I got the petite filet special. This was different than the regular petite filet, because it came with the most delicious king crab leg meat as well in a yummy butter sauce. I honestly could only eat half of the steak, this was just too much food all around. 

For sides, we got the mushrooms, creamed corn, creamed spinach, sweet potato fries, and scalloped potatoes. holy bananas these were all so good.

Then we finished with the butter cake!! Which is gigantic, way to big for two people. We all got some of it (there were six of us), but keep in mind we were stuffed at this point! The noise level was reasonable in this restaurant, so it was perfect for a dinner with colleagues.

Mastro's was the capstone in a hedonistic tour-de-force of eating and drinking, and oh what an excellent climax it was! We set up dinner reservations for 6:30 prior to a 9:45 flight that would get us the hell out of Vegas; while it wasn't the best idea in terms of timing, we were just super eager to eat at Mastro's and couldn't cram it in earlier in the trip.

We were seated in the middle of the big floating wooden structure, which was excellent for the view and being in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of the restaurant (something I really like). Our waiter was excellent; he made us feel at ease and happily answered all our questions about ordering.

The first order of business? A nice bottle of wine. Fortunately, they had several wines in the $60 range that I like and pair nicely with both fish and meat (keeping our options open :-) ). We chose the 2009 Grgich Hills Merlot, and sat around merrily sipping until our starters came.

The Seared Albacore with Truffle (see the picture) was really damn good. I could have eaten two plates of that and been happy. The Tuna Tartare was good, but not amazing. Yep, I've dinged it for "not being amazing". We went in all different directions for main course: one bone-in steak, one cooked fish dish, one sashimi tuna dish. All were excellent. The sides were excellent. Everything was excellent. See a pattern?

Somewhere in the middle of the main course we ran out of wine and unconsciously ordered another! Why not go out with a bang.

The hour was winding down, our stomachs at near capacity, and fears of the implications of missing our flight creeping in, yet we got dessert. The Warm Butter cake. Dude. Best part of the meal. Might have been the best part of the weekend. Don't go without it.

Thanks Mastro's for an awesome dinner. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

this was my first time trying mastro's and I'm glad it was in vegas.  and let me tell you, everything here was expensive.  I probably won't be coming back but I'm glad I finally got to try it.

lobster mashed potatoes - it was actually pretty good!  the lobster taste and the mashed potatoes really mixed in well together.  I've heard that this dish wasn't as good in the costa mesa one

bone-in-filet - very tender and very good!

bone-in-kc strip - i loved it

i loved everything that was bone in.  I didn't get to try the bone-in-ribeye because it was too big

we also got a side of asparagus which is like $10 (not worth it).  although it was good, it tasted like I can cook this at home for so much cheaper, and it would taste the same.  nothing special at all

The bomb- awesome- just like the Beverly Hills place.
Not only is the food amazing- but they actually used alcohol
in there drinks  (unlike many places in Vegas)
We went on a Thursday night- and the eye candy of "available"
women waiting for clients was mind boggling.  
All the senses my senses were tickled at dinner.

Tried Mastro's for the first time on Saturday while staying in Vegas. Made a reservation on Yelp (super convenient and easy) for 5:15pm. Ended up coming 15 mins late because of traffic but was still seated right away after we arrived. If you do plan on coming here, leave about 30-40 mins (depends on traffic also) early since you do have to park/valet then walk into Crystals Mall located at Aria.

Appetizer - Tried the calamari and I would have to say I have had better. The calamari was reallllllly chewy. Some might prefer that but I don't believe calamari should be chewy. The only reason why it was enjoyable was the creamy sauce that came with it. I could eat the sauce by itself. It was THAT delicious. As a high-end restaurant, I was expecting better calamari, but Flemings and Ruth Chris both win on that dish.

Entree - Bone-in Filet and Bone-in Ribeye. The Filet was amazing! It was tender, juicy, and perfectly cooked. I usually get filet without the bone but decided to try something different and it did not do me wrong. The bone-in ribeye was good but not as good as the filet. It was soft in the center but the outside was too blacken for my taste. It was over-charred and slightly burnt in corners. Probably wouldn't get that again.

Sides- Lobster mashed potatoes.... WOW! Such a genius idea. $39 side... so you will expect something amazing and it was! So flavorful with lobster pieces in each bite. I will definitely get this again. Cream corn - nothing that stands out from other cream corn I have tried before. Though, I could tell the corn was cut from fresh corn, rather than using canned corn - which was a plus. 

Complimentary bread - variety... probably 4-5 different types.

Service - from a 1-10, I'd give about 7.5. Server wasn't as personable or attentive.

1 appetizer, 2 sides and 2 steaks came out to be $188.

The service at Mastros was phenomenal. The food was amazing as well, the Sea Bass was some of the best fish I have ever had in my life, the filet was great and the sides were delicious as well. 

Food and service was definitely 5 stars, the reason I gave it 4 is because of the Mojito that I ordered. It was on the cocktail menu, and they have a full bar so I expected it to be good. It was really watery and frankly not very tasty. Expected more from the bar, but would definitely go back.

I had the crabcakes, ahi tuna, seared scallops, gnocci with truffles, spinach, chilean sea bass (I like this fish for future reference), and creme brulee with homemade whipped cream (best whipped cream ever).  WOW.  It sounds like so much food now - no wonder i was hurting!!!!  Don't worry though - the pain is gone.

I really wanted to enjoy my experience but despite very good service, Mastro's disappointed. Outrageously overpriced for subpar quality chilled shellfish. Embellished preparations took away from the quality of the fish dishes. Many better expense account options in Vegas.

I would rate this more of a 3.5.  For starters, the decor and architecture of this restaurant is absolutely breathtaking.  Based in the center of a classy mall, the treehouse area has a unique and interesting view of everything around you.  We went around 9, so no one was really shopping and the mall was pretty bare. I felt like I was in a different world!  For a Monday night the restaurant was hardly crowded and we were seated immediately at a table of our choice.  The complimentary bread was interesting, although there were several pieces that were extremely hard to bite into, I enjoyed the soft pretzel-like bread the most.  For drinks we tried the lemon drop and the cantaloupe martini.  Both very awesome, and the cool thing is that they come with the martini shaker, so you end up getting two drinks really.  I enjoyed both drinks, the cantaloupe one tasted like sweet cantaloupe but strong enough to get you buzzed.  As for the lemon drop, it was soooo cool - they put some kinda sizzling dry ice or something in it so it looked like a volcano when it came out.  I sat there in awe for like 2 minutes just staring at the smoke come out of my drink! Then sipped on it and got buzzed 10 min after hahahhaha.  

As for the entree, we ordered the rib eye medium rare, macaroni and cheese, and creamed corn.  I'm sad to say but I wasn't too impressed with the rib eye.  I felt like it was cooked in fire too high - the bone was completely charred.  Even though the inside was medium rare, the outside had bad burnt areas all around it.  And since we shared a plate, they brought out another plate for me, but it was soooo hot that when we put food on it, the oil kept splattering on me!!!  I mean granted it was a nice gesture, but I did not like how bits of oil kept splattering on my nice dress!  So anyhow, despite the slight disappointment in the steak, the macaroni and creamed corn TOTALLY made up for it.  The macaroni came out in a sizzling pan where the cheese would not stop ooozing when you tried to take a spoon full of it off....just the way I like it!!! I couldn't stop eating the side items that I probably would have rather eaten those as my meal rather than the steak itself!

Anyhowl, I dont know if I'd come back for the steak, but I definitely appreciated the view, side items, and drinks.  Our bill came out to be $110 for 2 drinks, 2 side items, and 1 rib eye.  It was what we were expecting for a steakhouse at this caliber so not surprised.  I rounded up on the rating only because between the two of us, we shared the leftover mac and cheese and creamed corn the next day and still were satisfied :)

Mastro's to me is just another steak house. Just like Fleming's or Morton's and Ruth's Chris, Morton's offers a very classic steak restaurant. Visiting Vegas, I made a decision I shouldn't have made. Not to say that going to Matro's Ocean Club inside the Shops At Crystals was a mistake or a bad experience. I just have a dining out rule when I'm in Vegas. "If there's one in LA or OC, don't go there." Well, I broke my rule, but it was all for a birthday celebration. I figured, I probably won't be going to Mastro's anytime soon, so might as well. And the bird's nest really attracted me. I was really happy with my decision for the most part.

We started things of with bread service. They offered pretzel, crouton, baguette, dinner roll, and wheat bread. The breadbasket had variety all were quite good. My favorite was the pretzel -- it was soft and airy.

I had some of the Caesar salad to start. I needed some kind of greens to soak up all that meat juice. Their Caesar salad was near perfect. The dressing was nice and creamy. The addition of parmesan cheese and cracked pepper made everything better.

I was ready for the main event, the 22oz bone in rib eye. The rib eye is one of my favorite cuts because of the even fat marbling and soft texture. Mine was cooked perfectly medium rare, though a bit more on the rare side. This actually caused the meat to be a bit tough. This cut did have some nice fat running through the steak. This helped with the tenderness and mouth feel of the meat. Even though this wasn't the best steak I have had, the help of the amazing sides made it all better.

The real reason I came here wasn't the steak. Well it is, and it isn't. The real reason I came here was for the lobster mashed potatoes. I mean. It is Mastro's Ocean Club -- Ocean, meaning seafood is in order. This side dish was rich as can be -- full of butter. I believe the potato to butter ratio is near 1 to 1. With a whole lobster tail carefully chopped up and placed in a pool of butter, the potatoes were creamy and flavorful. The pure essence of the sea was encased in butter, and mixed with potatoes. Eating this with steak was pure bliss. The kid in me wanted to order the mac and cheese. made with gorgonzola, the flavor was very rich. Another cream heavy and dairy heavy dish, the mac and cheese was delicious. My favorite was the layer of melted cheese on top.

My favorite was dessert. We were celebrating a birthday, so they gave us a chocolate birthday cake. The cake was rich in chocolate and eating just a few bites was enough for me. The best thing about this dessert was their home made whipped cream. Served on the side in a bowl, the homemade whipped cream was so dense and fluffy. The cold cream and the chocolate cake was a perfect mixture. Honestly though, the whipped cream was the best thing ever. I wanted to take it all home.

Eating at Mastro's Ocean Club was a great experience. The location is a bit awkward. As you are enjoying your expensive meal inside an amazingly architectured "bird's nest," you look out and you see people shopping. That is cool and all, but you can't help but think you are inside of a mall -- Well, you are inside of a mall, and this Mastro's makes sure you know that. I couldn't help but think I was at a very glorified food court at a mall. When I eat at a nice establishment, I want to feel secluded from the world. I just didn't get the at from here. The food is great, though as far as steakhouses go in Las Vegas, you can do a lot better. I guess I can only break my rule once. Never eat at Las Vegas where you can at home.

This place has the potential to be something awesome, but the staff really held us back from enjoying what could have been a wonderful experience. Service started out good but before we even got around to placing our order they were already falling flat. No drink menu or wine list for starters and to go along with that no wine recommendations. I guess if you don't want us to order wine, 1) don't give us a menu, 2) don't mention what pairs well. Service got obnoxiously slow after we ordered our food, so bad that one of our party went and lodged a complaint with the manager. The only saving grace on this visit was the food. Everyone seemed to enjoy their plates. I ordered the filet, which came out wonderful and cooked perfectly. For what they charge here, everything should have been dialed in, it's unfortunate that we didn't have the same experience so many others were able to enjoy.

This is a ridiculously late review as my fiance took me here for Valentine's Day 2016.

We can not say enough about this place, we totally loved every part of it.

The server we had was so friendly, the service was amazing, the food was incredible and we were like two giddy teenagers, it was such an incredible experience.

Of course this place is pricey but it was worth it. My fiance had the rack of lamb and it was cooked perfectly. I had the chilean sea bass and it was also amazing.  We had the infamous buttercream cake and it was everything everyone said it would be, and I'm a chocolate person.

I would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting a nice, romantic dinner with their significant other. We definitely will visit again.

I'm kind of surprised right now. So if you read my other reviews you pretty much know that it's hard to get 5 stars, but pretty easy to get 4 stars. If you get 3 stars then there must've been something wrong. 
First of all I was really into going to eat here. I thought it was really nice on the inside. I had a very positive attitude without super high expectations. That's the ideal right? 
Well, I was here for my wife's birthday, and my sister in laws belated birthday dinner. I ordered bone in rib eye. My wife ordered bone in filet w lobster tail on the side and my sister in law ordered lamb chops. I ordered mine medium rare. It came out just under well done. My wife ordered hers medium and it came out well done. My sister ordered hers medium and it came out rare. The manager happened to come by and ask how everything was. I really want to avoid complaining at a restaurant, but my wife said his is too done, and my sisters is not done enough. I said hey it's alright we can handle it, but the manager said oh no please let me take care of this. Ok I said no problem thank you so much. So they started another steak for me and started to cook my sisters more. Ok so they brought mine back. It looked right on the outside...nice looking. Alright so it was practically raw. My sisters comes back and it looks like they threw it in the microwave. All the while it's my wife's birthday and her steak is brown. Wtf. 
So I cook a little around the house. Some say my steak is better than most restaurants. I usually say it's ok. Well, in this case I can say I can get the temp on the money 90% of the time without timing it. I really was kind of shocked. I won't go into the meat anymore because it really was a train wreck. 
The appetizers were good. Dungeness crab cocktail, and oysters on a half shell. Drinks were great. We all enjoyed. But the dinner was really one of the worst I have ever had. I am really bummed about that. I can't really rate it a 1 star because the manager was good, appetizers were good, drinks were good, but the dinner...well, never again. I almost want to bump up the 2 stars that I have given on other reviews because this review is really 1 and a half.
OverAll food was pretty good I felt the ribeye should had more flavor but everything else was awesome I wouldn't mind going back

Decent seafood in an odd location. You are in the middle of a mall. Most of the times I've eaten in a mall has been at a food court. This isn't a food court, its a high end seafood place that costs a good chunk. 

The seafood tower was excellent except for the peanut sized oysters. My salad was very good. My tuna entree was on a par with Outback Steakhouse. 

Not enough going on here to make me want to go back. Even if you got to sit in the alien mothership, it wouldn't calm the odd feeling you get here.

Flat to slightly upturned face.

Ordered the australian ragu, lobster mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, creamy spinach, brussel sprouts, and vanilla baked lobster. All extremely delicious and great service. The australian ragout is 33 oz, I shared with a friend and it was more than enough. Another friend got the new york ragout which is also delicious but very, and i mean VERY fatty but just as tender and juicy. Depending on your taste, I preferred the australian ragout.

I love Mastro's. My groomsmen took me here for a part of my bachelors party. Had the New York Strip steak medium rare. It was cooked for perfection. No need for A1 steaksauce because you only put that on a crappy steak. This place does not have a crappy steak at all. The steak cut real nice, it was juicy, tender and flavorful. The sides were awesome too. The cream corn was very delicious. It was creamy and the corn did not taste like something out of a can. Also had the shoe string onion strips and they went well with the steak and sides. If you have to splurge on a steak, this is a place to do it at!!!

If you're a fan of beef or as I like to call it "MEAF" (meat + beef) then you need to go to Mastro's.  This is the second time I've eaten at Mastro's; the other was in Orange County, CA.

This is a place where you want to burn your money and empty your wallet.  Why not waste it on fine food instead of strippers and gambling.  This venue in the new Crystals City Center is a little small, but the atmosphere and location is excellent as it sits over the ledge with a great view.  A sexy live singer and a pianist playing the tunes of some 60's through 90's music.  

I ordered a medium rare 22 oz Bone in Ribeye for dinner and a side of Sauteed Asparagus.  The main entrée does not come with any free side orders.  Side orders are priced separately.  I didn't have to wait too long for my Ribeye as the service was excellent.  The beef was perfectly prepared and no need to add any additional seasoning.  However, I always like my food spicy so I asked for some Tabascco.  The Asparagus was ok as it complimented with my meal.

The food is exceptional for the price.  But don't buy too many drinks there as it does get expensive.  Great place to hang out and enjoy the atmosphere.

Fancy.  The 18 oz. steak and lobster mashed potatoes were very good.  The steak was juicy, and lobster pieces were with every bite.  Yes, this place is pricey and it was busy.  Split the dishes if you can.  Also, the bread served before the dishes were very very soft, and warm.  I think reservations are a must here, but you can also sit at the bar area if seats are available.

This Mastro's is better than the one in LA. All 3 of us couldn't believe how good it was. The sauteed mushrooms are out of this world. 

I had the 12oz filet (not the on the bone filet) and it was amazing. I don't like bone-on filets personally. I know i'm the only one. It was great. 

Its in the mall at the aria/crystals/whatever the fuck its called place, but its a pretty upscale mall with lots of swanky shit goin on - so don't stress, its not mall food-ish at all.

Dined here for my boyfriend's birthday on 7/9 and I have to say, this was the best experience ever! I was able to make a last minute reservation for the night of, as we were vacationing in Vegas for the weekend. We were escorted to our table right upon our arrival. The wait staff was awesome! For drinks, I ordered the Lemon Drop Martini which is served over dried ice; he ordered a Strawberry Pina Colada (which isnt on the menu but they made something to match his desire) For dinner, My baby ordered the 22oz rib eye, I ordered the swordfish with a side of lobster mashed potatoes. We cleaned our plates, and couldn't take anymore. However, we did! The birthday dessert was better than anything we have ever tasted... We would definitely dine her again! A beyond amazing experience...

It has taken me a while to find the time to finally add a couple of posts. I decided to treat my girlfriend to a good dinner for her birthday and I remembered how she was saying that she wanted to try Mastro's Ocean Club. I took her there on February 19th as a surprise dinner. For the amount I paid, the service could have definitely been better. Started off great. Had a 9:00 reservation and was seated as soon as we arrived an hour early. Unfortunately the wait for drinks and food took a lot longer to come. The server was very pleasant, but whether she had too many tables, it just took way too long. The food was good. We absolutely loved the Lobster mashed potatoes, the steak was great, and the Swordfish ( usually one of my favorites ) was a decent entrée. The dessert was pretty good too. It was the butter cake which they are known for. I may go back in the future, but there are many other places in town I think I would try first if I plan on spending over $250 on dinner again.

the  appetizer, salad and desert were great but I had the worst halibut and my wife had tasteless steak which was over cooked ( she asked for medium well )  , will not dine in Mastro's Ocean Club ,  over priced and not worth the time

While in Vegas for a friend's birthday, we decided to have a nice dinner and settled on steak. After reading about Mastro's, I made a reservation, and we were seated in the large wooden structure thing. Screw it, I'm just gonna go straight to the steak.

When our waiter mentioned that their special was an A5 grade 33oz. wagyu tomahawk, I was sold. It's basically a thick cut, bone-in ribeye, and I knew I was in for something special just by looking at it. The first thing that immediately caught my attention was the rim - it was HUMUNGADUNGA. Normally, the rim just encircles the outer edge of about half the eye, but this rim was almost the same size as the eye! Why is this such a big deal? Of all the steak cuts, the rim of the ribeye is the absolute BEST tasting piece in the entire beef carcass. I always separate it from the rest of the ribeye so I can save it for last. The muscle fibers in the rim are very loosely bound, and marbling of ribeyes is second to none. What this means is that you have a piece of meat that's super tender (just as tender as a filet), super juicy, and super flavorful, which perfectly describes the wagyu tomahawk. Each bite was a blast of rich and savory goodness. The juices coat your mouth in a sheen of happiness. There truly is nothing to criticize. The only thing I could wish for is that they serve just the rim as its own cut of steak.

The next time you're in Vegas, forget the crappy frozen king crab legs at the buffets, and treat yourself to something really worth the trip and big bucks.

Delicious! Best steak I've had compared to: del frisco's, papa's, Perry's, Ruth Chris, Flemings, the strip house, Vic and Anthony's, Morton's .... All of them and more. 

I don't remember what my cocktail was but it was a strawberry drink with a sugar rim. The shaker had an endless amount. I ended up with at least 3 full refills for $18.

The calamari was crispy and deceptively flavorful. They appeared to be plain, but the seasoning was just right. I did not care for the horseradish/mustard type sauce though, but I think that was just my dislike for those types of condiments. 

I ordered the 12oz filet medium rare. It had a beautiful seared crust that was crispy and not burned. The inside was so perfectly tender juicy red and melted in my mouth. The texture of the two was perfect. 

For sides we had the baked potatoe which was huge! But was the least appetizing item all night. The Gorgonzola Mac and cheese was delicious! I don't tend to like blue cheeses or very much cheese, but this cheese goodness was Devine. I enjoyed it so much I'm going to try to remake this this week for dinner! It was served in it's own skillet and was more than enough for myself and my two othe dinner companions. 

Warm butter cake. What can I say but order this! I usually love tiramisu and cream brûlée but mmmm this cake was so moist and had a crunch sugar top under the vanilla ice cream. The cream brûlée was actually disappointing. I didn't care for the crust or Vanilla flavored cream... Or perhaps the butter cake just stole my heart.

The live small band sounded great with dinner. They werent too loud and the music was a good mix, classy good sounding modern and hit music, not clubby like stk. you wo t leave with a headach and sore throat.The atmosphere of the restaurant was light and elegant. I didn't mind that it was located in the crystals. Honestly I liked being able to walk around while we waited for our reservation we made through aria, our hotel. If you do have a bit of a wait go down stairs to the little water tornadoes. They are touch sensitive and you can control how they spin!

The service was excellent and the food delicious. However, the location wasn't my favorite since the restaurant is located inside the Crystal's LV shopping center and it has an open view which you can see all the shops. Otherwise, it would be 5 stars.

This is now my 4th trip there and I wouldn't be doing the place justice If I didn't write a review. Steaks: huge, cooked right, and delicious. Seafood- fresh fresh fresh.  On the late fall the stone crab claws are the largest I've ever seen.   Prices: on par w the rest of SIN CITY for a high end place 
The real difference is the service. We literally had 7 people taking care of a table of 4. They are on top of everything. 
If you want a high end meal or want to impress business clients, this is a no brainer.
Excellent service, food was delicious. We were in a hurry to get to a concert and they were very accommodating.

Delicious from beginning to end. The appetizers, the steak, the fish, the sides - all made to perfection. And the dessert, the warm butter cake, absolutely incredible. Too bad we were too full to finish it all. It's enough for 4 to 6 people, so leave some room for dessert. But don't leave without trying it. The service was wonderful too. Oh, I forgot to mention the bread! Fabulous. Just incredible all around.
Coming to Vegas? You have to try this place, from great mixed drinks, entree's you will not forget, to butter cake for dessert...you will not be disappointed!

Love the ambience here! The lobster mashed potatoes are amazing! The filet was cooked and seasoned to perfection! I always get the butter cake and I am never disappointed! My favorite dessert ever! Always happy with the food and service at all Mastro's I've dined at.

This was just an amazing meal.  Wish we could have been seated in the large wood sculpture portion, but a great meal none the less.  

Thanks!

Oh and thanks for the call the next day.  That was a 4 star to 5 star conversion

Such a great experience! The wait staff were so attentive, and the food was fantastic. The restaurant itself looks very nice and upscale. There's not much else to say because it was such a perfect dinner. I wish I knew the name of my waiter, so I could mention him. He was wonderful though. I'm sure they all are:)

Over rated and over priced....mash potatoes taste like they are out of a box. Ahi tuna is great but again very over priced. Don't understand why people rave about it.  Restaurants should be based on quality of food versus "trendy".

Little late on this review, but didn't want to miss out on saying how wonderful this beautiful new restaurant is. Service was impeccable. Seafood tower was delicious and our steaks were perfectly prepared. Not a sea bass eater, but was told it was one of the tastiest. A don't miss Vegas experience.

Was here for a private party and am very grateful to the hosts for treating us all to the experience. In a luxury mall on the strip. Be sure to window shop on ur way to the restaurant. Amazing service. Excellent wines. A filet cooked to med rare perfection & so generous in its proportions i couldn't believe my eyes. Very interesting architectural statement in the main dining room. And at least two sculpture groupings in the mall worth a look.

My dessert and drink experience was definitely worth five stars, but I can't give five stars without tasting the dinner menu. The butter cake dessert filled with cream cheese is out of this world. Three of us shared it.

The Fountain of Youth is the drink to get--if you're considering that or the Raspberry Flirtini. 

Service was amazing. Prices are high. Drinks are around $17 each.

I was so disappointed. I am a huge fan of Mastros and have been to multiple locations over the country. This was the most disappointing experience I've had at a mastros. I got the 8 oz filet, garlic mashed potatoes, and Brussels sprouts. The steak and potatoes were good. The steak was not as tender as normal, which was disappointing. I also found that the Brussels sprouts were not as crispy as they should have been. They could have used a bit more time in the oven. We ended our meal with the warm butter cake, which came out cold. Disappointing....I love when the butter cake is perfectly warm with the cold ice cream. It just wasn't as amazing as it normally is! It was my first time at this location and I'm not sure I will come back. I also just didn't love the atmosphere. Mastros is normally very sultry and romantic. This location seemed to abstract and strangely, too bright. Service was great though!

vanilla batter shrimp appetizer - good but i was expecting more than 3 shrimp for $20
bone in ribeye - good, i thought Barrymore ribeye was clearly better (and cheaper)
lobster tail - best lobster I've had, really good
broccoli side dish - this is just steamed broccoli, nothing special.  Unless you are obsessed with broccoli I suggest spending your $10 and a different side.  

Looking at other reviews it looks like I should have ordered the lobster mashed potatoes and warm butter cake  instead of the shrimp and broccoli.

Also while this is clearly a classy place, its also an open view restaurant where you are exposed to people walking by in the surrounding mall and there is not much space between you and other diners.  This gives off a somewhat casual flair to this place for guests expecting a more intimate and special occasion.

My first time dining at this particular Mastro's and they did not disappoint. It was restaurant week but our group went and ordered our own stuff anyways. Yeah, this's place is that good hahha


Food Tried: 
Pretzel Bread - like a soft, warm, perfectly salted pretzel. 
Lobster Mash - delish
Mushrooms - I love these tasty mushrooms
Spinach - not a big fan of spinach but Mastro's does it right 
12 oz bone in filet - cooked just right. Med rare and awesome

Service: Great. Attentive and courteous. My friend couldn't finish his 22oz rib eye and asked to take the rest to go. They accidentally tossed it but went out of their way to make up for it. Our group was dressed casually and I can imagine some lesser establishments not giving us this type of great service based just on this alone.

Mastro's is the best steakhouse I've ever been to. I've been to a lot of locations (Newport Beach, Malibu, Beverly Hills, Palm Desert, Las Vegas, All 3 AZ locations) and it's NEVER been anything but the best. The service, the food, the entire experience from start to finish puts all other restaurants to shame. In fact, I find myself often saying in regards to other restaurants "It was good, but it wasn't Mastro's"   :)

The service and food were incredible.  This meal was worth every penny. We started with the wedge salad. My husband and I split the salad,  which I'm glad we did because it was large.  For the entree I had the big eye tuna served sushi style and it was fantastic.  We ordered the sweet potato side dish and it was heaven in a bowl.  I will eat here again the next time we are in Vegas.

Excellent anniversary dinner experience!  Dinner drinks and staff were all excellent. The manager cam out and greeted us which was a real treat. Although we're reserving this restaurant for our special occasions, we can't wait to go back.

The Las Vegas-Mastro's ranks among our top dining experiences anywhere in the world.  On this Labor Day Weekend visit, our initial disappointment, of not being seated in the unique & always fascinating "tree-house", was quickly extinguished by Shauna, our Culinary Captain Extraordinaire, menu "tour guide" and libation/wine aficionado.  Turns out... our "Terrace" seating near the piano bar was as enjoyable as it was entertaining, resulting in yet another "positively outrageous" fine dining adventure.

Shauna introduced us to Mastro's participation in "Las Vegas Restaurant Week", a worthy nationwide charity drive to raise money for & donate meals to 3-Square Food Bank in Southern Nevada.  She offered a special 4-course dinner deliciously flanked by Beefsteak Tomato & Onion Salad, an 8 oz. Petite Filet, Creamed Spinach & Garlic Mashed Potatoes, and Key Lime Pie all for a reasonable price, part of which was ultimately donated for a worthy cause.  

As there were 5 of us on this visit, the aforementioned special meal was joined by collection of our menu favs and Shauna's recommendations. She perfectly paired our appetizers & meals with wonderful Riesling, Cabernet, and Sauvignon Blanc.

Sooo, included in the culinary delight were: The Legendary Seafood Tower (Ohhh YES!!), Lobster Bisque (best in class!), Herb Roasted Chicken (delightful), New York Strip (absolute perfection), Chilean Sea Bass (sweet & outa this world), Sautéed Sea Scallops (Oh Yeah!), Creamed Corn (buttered and seasoned to perfection), Sautéed Mushrooms ( a fav of favs), Roasted Brussels Sprouts (these aren't yo mama's sprouts, believe it!), 1 lb. Baked Potato (huge), Triple Chocolate Layer Cake (nothing but delish), AND...(drum roll)... the Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake!!...once again to die for!!!

Without fail, and to paraphrase the writings of T. Scott Gross,... Mastro's was again a "positively outrageous" dining experience where the culinary expectations were always far exceeded.  Shauna's unsurpassed service & superior guidance was unexpected, delivered-at-random, fun, entertaining, and so very memorable!  It doesn't get any better!
Have to say one of the top 5 meals I have every had. The service was great, sides were great, the Wagyu beef special was incredible. I would go back and highly recommend this restaurant!

Dinner in a treehouse! 

It was my first time visiting Mastro's located in the shops at Crystals.  This beautiful and elegant dining can be seen while walking through.  The 'treehouse' as they call it sits directly in the center so it's very hard to miss.  The wooden structure will catch your eye in a heartbeat.  

We made reservations for our group and were seated early.  I would like to give a tremendous thank you to Paul our waiter.  I don't think I've ever been so entertained while receiving the best service anyone could ask for.  He went above and beyond to make our evening memorable. 

The table is brought a bread basket which has 3 options. I will say their pretzel bread called my name.  I asked for more in which Paul graciously brought an entire basket of just those.  Fantastic! 

I started with the wedge salad.  Perfect and delicious.  The crumbled bacon had a great flavor combined with the creamy blue cheese.  For my entree I chose the Chilean Sea Bass accompanied by creamed spinach, Gorgonzola mac and cheese and Alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi.  Of course all of the sides are huge and were shared between all of our group.  The sea bass was so light, fresh and baked perfectly.  The gnocchi was a disappointment.  I don't think there were any crab pieces in this. But the other two sides definitely made up for it.  They were so creamy.  Anything with Gorgonzola will make me happy. Simply delicious!

If the appetizer, bread basket or main meal didn't fill you up, they have a great dessert list.  On top of that list is their signature butter cake.  It's topped with vanilla bean ice cream with strawberry drizzled around the cake.  It's calorie free and fat free... In my dreams! It's moist and delectable.  After the huge meal, I would suggest splitting this huge cake.  

Mastro's delivered an impeccable meal with first class service.  It was surely a memorable evening!

Let's begin with, this location is in the middle of a mall.. which alot of other reviewers have brought up i know - but it's the main reason for 4 stars instead of 5. It does get a bit loud and the view is of a shopping mall.. a high-end shopping mall, but still. Not my ideal view for a such an awesome spot. It is what it is though!

The room itself is very nice, lots of seating, lively atmosphere, great looking staff. I have been a couple of times now and the service is always great when I have gone and the food spectacular. 

I have ben to Ocean Club a couple of times, but this most recent visit was a dinner of 'Dungeoness Crab Cocktail', 'Ribeye' and '10 oz Ahi Sashimi' . We shared everything with a side of sauteed spinach .. and a few martinis. :) I loved was the personal style serving from the individual pans that the food items were seemingly prepared in. The service staff has always been very pleasant and makes the experience very comfortable. 

The Ahi was fantastic with a really beautiful presentation laid out on a long plate with a finish of a really tasty sauce. The ribeye was prepared expertly, perfect medium rare with still  a beautiful grill flavor. The spinach was .. spinach, sauteed.. but was excellent nonetheless! haha.. I was having such a great time and enjoying the vibe of the place overall. 

There was a piano player in the corner of the room playing standards and old-school vegas tunes.. Sinatra and the like. It gave a beautiful feel to an elegant style dinner. My friends and I aren't the most refined diners, but we know how to have a good time, and Maestro's made us feel welcome within that setting.

Now don't get me wrong... this ain't your downtown steakhouse with a $4.99 steak special.. you WILL drop a pretty penny to have some seriously tasty grub.. but I do believe it's worth it.  At over $150 a head when we dined there last, it was worth the money but definitely be ready for a big bill. It's nearly unavoidable. 

Have a great time, and happy eating!

Food is awesome.  We split a shrimp cocktail (4) and two Alaskan claws to start and they were served over dry ice, excellent!  Bone in ribeyes with spinach was excellent but maybe too much.  Could have split the steak leaving room for the butter cake dessert.  Also the bread is incredible.   For wine add the Stags petite syrah.  And they were generous with the wine.  Only downside was tables for two are limited and we were a twosome.  The guys big head in the both next to us was the center piece for us.  Good place for 4 to 6.  Great food and service.

This restaurant in a tree house was an all around great experience. The service from start to finish was top notch, our food was so good, table side prep and presentation was perfect. A true fine dining experience. Most important thing was the home made whipped cream! If it's winter time have a hot chocolate with this whip cream on it if it's summer put it on anything and everything. We ate it by itself!!!!

As a party planner, I do not gratuitously provide 5-Star Ratings. However, I believe Mastro's Ocean Club to be the perfect location for an intimate dinner party in Las Vegas. We booked the private rooms upstairs for a reception and sit-down dinner for a party of 40 on Saturday, September 15, 2012 and our discerning guests who came from all around the country could not have been more pleased with the entire experience.  We were expertly guided from start to finish by Carly Smith, Director of Events. Carly was assessable, professional, flexible and an essential resource regarding local vendors to compliment the comprehensive services offered by Mastro's.  The ambiance was charming and elegant... photos of the gorgeous chandeliers, golden leather seats and flat screens which are viewable on their website, do not do this venue any justice.  We were in full view of the delightfully lit Tree House and even the restrooms which came with very courteous attendants, were a pleasant surprise. Their technology is also top of the line. All we needed to do was bring our slide show on a flash drive and our iPad playlist and our music soared through the rooms and our slideshow displayed brilliantly on two flat screens. Mastro's provided all of the equipment and cords and made it easy for us to make our party truly surround sound fun!  No event is a success without delicious food and this is where Mastro's clearly shines brightly. We started with an extraordinary Seafood Tower and Brochetta during the reception. Guests could not get enough of the Colossal Shrimp and Split/Chilled Alaskan King Crab Legs and the wait staff kept everyone's wine glass full which added to the fun and excitement during the reception. As we moved into dinner, the asparagus tempura seemed to disappear from the tables as guests ordered their choice of salads and entrees. And, talk about entrees...the generous portions of prepared-to-order salmon, chicken, steak or sword fish provided additional shock and awe. Even the side dishes, sautéed mushrooms, sautéed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes were absolutely delicious. In addition to Carly Smith, we also have the highest praise Sherie Ritzler, General Manager, Brandon S., Banquet Captain, as well as, L.R, Alex and all of the wait staff and hostesses.

This is one of the most interesting (fancy) places I have ever dined at. The restaurant itself sits in the middle of the Crystals City Center retail area. We were seated in the treehouse-esque area so had a nice view of retail shops and passersby. Service was prompt without being stuffy. Some menu items are $$$$ so be prepared. Sides are rather large so maybe share with your group. This is a great special occasion type of place.

I went to Mastro's for a business dinner for the first time earlier this month, and definitely plan on going back again if the opportunity arises.

The staff, from the hostess to our waiter, were very friendly, and our waiter was very knowledgable on the menu, chef preparation recommendations and specials. He also didn't hover too much, which is appreciated. 

Our table started with calamari and an order of one of the day's selected oysters. The calamari was incredibly tender, the oysters were excellent too - the delicate cucumber flavor was exactly as described by our waiter.

For our main course, I had the arctic char oreganata (prepared with seasoned breadcrumbs) and my companions had the special wagyu and Chilean sea bass. For sides, we split the gorgonzola mac & cheese, sauteed asparagus and creamed corn. 

I'm deducted one star for the slightly underseasoned sides and for the ridiculously large portion sizes. My arctic char, while delicious, was enough for three meals (no, seriously, it was a pound of fish), and the sides were also much larger than you would expect at a restaurant in this price range, which can significantly limit the variety of sides you can try if you're dining in a party of 5 or less.

WOW. Best meal of my life.  

For being located in a mall this place very nice.  We had a very good bottle of red wine that paired well with the bone-in ribeye and lamb of rack.  Speaking of the ribeye was humongous and melted like butter.  The rack of lamb is actually 2 racks which the waiter kindly had the chef slice for me so I didn't have to feel like I was performing surgery in the middle of my date. This had to be the best lamb I've ever had.

The food was soo good that we made a special trip back to the aria before seeing Ka at the MGM.  (PS my feet paid the price)

This place is the best for fish.

Get the tuna, and get it raw, or close to it.

Lobster mashed potatoes are superb, probably has a whole lobster in an order. At almost $40, it's not a cheap side, but worth it and more than enough to share with a few people.

Service is always great.

Mastro's is obviously not cheap, but if I'm going to spend that much for dinner, this is the only place I know that still consistently over-delivers at that price.

We read the reviews and thought would be a great place for dinner. The live music was so LOUD we could barely talk to each other and we were jammed into a table that had to be moved so we could sit there and still felt like we were bumping into our neighbors. The first waiter that showed was excellent but the second was clearly a jerk. How can this be at a premium restaurant?  I ordered a steak medium and it was grey and overcooked and the 1lb potato was under cooked. My wife's sashimi was good but for these prices, never again.

I recently had dinner there with few friends. Food was amazing, service was great. It is pricey. The only "slight" negative is that we did no realize that NOT all the tables are inside the tree-house looking structure. We asked to be moved there but they were not very open to it, saying it will be an hour wait or so.

I didn't believe it when I heard the Ribeye was hard to finish.

From my experience, fine dining is hard to get full. This was not the case here. I was warned about the size of the steak and from the menu it was 22oz! That's ridiculous! Even if the bone was about 5oz, that's still a whopping 17oz!

All the servers here are exceptionally knowledgeable and professional. I felt like I was not treated as a kid eating at the adults' table. 

We all shared a portion of the lobster mashed potatoes and by far they are the best mashed potatoes I've ever had. I would highly recommend trying this dish.

For my main entree, I ordered the 22oz Ribeye cooked medium rare. Although next time I would probably get rare+, I thought the medium rare was still delicious. The steak was massive and amazingly flavored. By the end of the meal I felt overwhelmed and defeated. I have never been conquered by how much steak there was until Mastro's.

My brain kept telling me to eat more but my stomach fought against this decision.

Overall, Mastro's was a great experience. The steak here, so far, is only second to the Kobe beef I had in Japan. I would definitely come back for seconds.

This environment super friendly. Luciana- the Bar manager always manages to come say hi and chat for a minute. Randy- bartender treats me like family. I love this place. The drinks are so good. The buttercake is to die for. The Texans I brought have said the beef is v legit. Don't forget the Brussel sprouts!!

I AINT NO UPPER CLASS. I don't go out and spend $100 on dinner everyday. With that said.. I don't appreciate my waiter giving me attitude just because I don't know half of his fancy schmancy expensive food vocabulary.

We got there last Friday at around 730 PM. The waiter went over the menu with us and began taking order. We didn't know what kind of cooking style we want on the fish. When we asked him questions, instead of him answering patiently, he decided to just give us THE LOOK and say "i just went over all the cooking style with you.."BLAH..

The food was salty and whatever.. 

I don't understand why he's giving me attitude if I still have to pay him tip.

I'm gonna save that money for a nice purse next time.

We were in Vegas for a bachelorette party for one of my besties and decided on this place for our fancy dinner night. We had 11 girls and people ordered a variety of things from the sea bass to the bone-in steaks. This is one of those fancy places where you order just the protein and then sides are extra. Here's the breakdown:

Bread basket - GOOD. Normally, I'm not a fan of loading up on carbs, but we were getting bottle service the night and I was already starving, so I had to put something in the stomach. I was pleasantly surprised at the freshness of the bread! So soft and slightly warmed.

Lobster bisque - giant serving (probably enough for 2!). Rich and creamy with actual chunks of lobster!

Seabass - good and buttery. It was a big serving size and I only finished probably half of it.

Bone-in ribeye - good, but slightly under cooked according to my friend's order.

Lobster mashed potatoes - I'm not really a fan of mashed potatoes and these were okay. Small pieces of lobster mixed in.

Sea Salt & Vinegar Fries - pretty good! Nice little break between bites of our main courses.

Creamed corn - pretty good! Nice side dish without being overpowering.

The food was pretty good, but for a place of this caliber, I expected a lot more. They either under cooked or over cooked several steak orders, which had me thinking: What kind of steak house is this?!

The service was top notch at least and our bride-to-be got a special warm butter cake delivered to our table.

Would I return? Probably not.

It was either a off night, or they were training a new steak cook.  I ordered my bone in rib eye medium and at best it was medium well.  My buddy's filet tasted like liver, that really strong iron taste.  Should have ordered the fish at a place called "Ocean Club".  Or next time I will stick to Wolfgang's Cut.  So disappointing.  Service was good.  Should have sent back my steak, but I hate wasting food.

This time I had a plan: share a martini and save room for the warm butter cake!

Since our server, Leonard, kindly allowed me to split a martini with my friend, I actually remember my second visit to Mastro's in its entirety: from the amazingly addictive pretzel rolls, to the heirloom tomato and Campagna burrata salad, to the filet mignon (served with Bearnaise sauce, upon request), to the lobster mashed potatoes--and, finally, the famed warm butter cake.

This cake, alone, is worth 5 stars! The warm butter cake portion was more than enough for the three of us, served with a drizzle of berry coulis, sliced strawberries, a scoop of vanilla ice cream melting on top, and, in a separate bowl, enough whipped cream to frost a double-layer cake.

My first spoonful filled my mouth with warm brown sugar-sweet goodness, with the cake texture somewhere between a Genoise and a pound cake. The cake was wonderful on its own but we couldn't help but top our tastes with the whipped cream. We were so full from our meals (most likely due to that extra order of pretzel rolls) that, sadly, we couldn't quite finish the warm butter cake.

I plan to return for an all-carb meal next time: pretzel rolls and warm butter cake!

Since I had a good experience at the Mastro's Steakhouse in OC, I decided to try this Mastro's Ocean Club in Las Vegas and let me tell you, I had an even better experience.  It's probably due to the fact that I LOVE SEAFOOD!!!

I was tempted to get an appetizer tower but there were other things on the  menu that I wanted to try that were actually served hot so we opted out of the tower.  Instead we ordered the following:

*Seared Ahi Tuna - (just as good as the first time I had it in OC)
*Sauteed Sea Scallops - 3 pieces of jumbo scallops with three pieces of bread, in a rich creamy sauce.  AMAZING!!!  I just found out I'm moderately allergic to scallops but I love jumbo scallops so it doesn't stop me from trying them anyways. SOO YUMMY.
* Chilled Alaskan King Crab Claws - came out served is a cool bowl with dry ice.  Loved it.  Way A lot more tasty than shrimp cocktail or lobster option.  

This was definitely more than filling but it didn't stop me from ordering a Chilean Sea Bass for my entree since my favorite fish are chilean sea bass or cod anything.  I'm use to ordering these type of fishes miso style but since it wasn't an option, I decided to order it pan seared.  It came out nice fluffy and buttery.  I ordered it cooked medium.  I really liked the consistency of the fish and how it was cooked but wouldn't have minded some type of sauce to give that extra umph.

To be honest, I couldn't enjoy it as much because I was so stuffed!  I really wanted to try the infamous warm butter cake but I guess I'm just going to have to wait it out until the next time.  I will definitely come back :)

I've been a huge fan of the Ocean Club since it opened, and I always make an effort to dine here when I'm on the Strip. 

Top notch in every way: service, decor, ambiance, wine list, and happily- the FOOD! 

Highly recommended

Always a favorite stop for us when we're in town. I'm never disappointed, never leave hungry and never leave wanting more...

A feast for the eyes. Satisfying for the stomach. Yes!

We started off with crab cakes. Yes, pedestrian. But I was starving and wanted to keep it simple with my G&T. 

We dove straight into the giant grand seafood platter. It was delicious and amazing. But I was slightly disappointed. The Dungeness crab was a bit salty. (I mentioned it to our server, he admitted they boil it in salted water. I felt they should dial it back. Dungeness is briny on its own. I suppose it's okay to put it in a lightly salted water for preparation. But maybe it was a bit much?)

Then for the final blow: Kobe beef with foie gras and lobster mashed potatoes. Yeah. Stick a fork in me. I was sick with regret a half an hour later. But I did enjoy it! The steak was perfectly medium rare and so tender I nearly didn't need a knife. Truly amazing.

Jae wore a tank top and they still let him in. The sides were just okay. Gnocchi was the best side we had. Lobster mash potato, asparagus, Mack n cheese, and spinach. We ordered three different steaks and split it for the table medium rare. I like rare medium rare and my restaurant to have a dimmer light.

Took my love here for an early birthday celebration. Our waiter, Johnny, was the best, so funny and attentive. 
We started out with the lobster bisque and it was heaven! I had the petit filet with scallops, my bf had the Kobe steak with sautéed shrimps, we had the lobster mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts for sides. 
The filet, steak and shrimps was delicious! My scallops was a little salty and slightly overlooked but still yum! The brussel sprouts was also salty and could use some shaved almonds and cranberries but overall good. 
Would definitely come back despite the whole meal cost me an arm, a leg and probably my first born.

warm butter cake!

it is warm
and full of butter
and oh so sweet.

what more can i say?

thank you to the hostess for seating us without a reservation.  if you are just coming for the dessert let the hostess know so that they don't turn you away

Possibly the best meal we have ever had. Ahi Tuna Tostada was flawless. Also had the Sea Bass and Alaskan Halibut. Oysters Rockefeller came out with a strange smell but I think it was the shells on the 400 degree salt. Once it cooled off smell went away and the oysters were as fresh as I have ever enjoyed. Outstanding Restaurant.

Great food and service at the bar.  They served up my favorite turf and surf to order with garlic mashed potatoes and house special salad.  Perfect ending with black raspberry Sorbet and a cappuccino.  I highly recommend this place.   Glass of red wine was ok, not great, otherwise 5 stars.

This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I went here our last night in Vegas. We had made reservations and got seated right away inside of the beautiful architecture. Our server Megan was extremely informative and attentive. She went through the menu and gave us some suggestions.

 We ordered some drinks and they brought out the huge bread basket, which had at least 4-5 types of bread. I really liked the pretzel bread and the cheese crisps. Our server brought out our drinks, The Paloma i ordered was excellent, not over powering but had wonderful refreshing grapefruit flavor.

 I ended up ordering the Oysters Rockefeller, Clear Lobster Roll and the Alaskan King Crab Gnocchi with Black Truffle. My boyfriend got the Chilean Sea Bass, wedge salad and sautéed asparagus. The oysters were juicy and full of flavor and honestly this was the best gnocchi I've ever had. It was rich and was full of crab and truffle. The lobster roll was okay, had good flavor. My boyfriend's fish was cooked perfectly and almost tasted like lobster. It went well with the asparagus and gnocchi.

 Our plates were cleared and Megan brought out a dessert menu, we were way too full for dessert. However, she brought us out a little pair of chocolate covered strawberries with fresh whip cream for a little sweet treat on the house! Service was impeccable, our water glasses were always full and we were definitely catered to. Megan our server made our experience a wonderful one, I highly recommend this place for a special occasion, it's worth every penny!
The best steakhouse dining experience we've ever had.  Attentive server and perfect food.

BEST SEA BASS IN MY LIFE.  The portion was much bigger than I was expecting, and because I ordered it medium rare, the fish was cooked just right!  Everyone at our 8-person table had either the sea bass, rib-eye, or bone-in filet, and everyone's dish was delicious.  Would definitely come back here!!!

We had dinner here for my husbands birthday and it was not what we were expecting. We had reservations and came on time. They had us waiting for over 20 minutes before we got a table and wen we finally sat down, it took awhile for the waiter to come take our order. We got our drinks (lemon drop is my favorite and it was delicious here) fast but our dinner took way too long. When we did get our food we barely ate it because we were so hungry we are the bread and had our drinks. Then the alarm went off and all the lights and sirens were flashing. It just wasn't what we were expecting.

Excellent dining experience which started with the hostesses, bubbly smile and welcoming personality. Heard many reviews about the bread basket, come on its bread. Now I eat those words. Several choices, sour dough roll, kalamata olive, pretzel (my fav) and others. I had seared ahi tuna. Generous portion cooked to perfection with wasabi and pickled ginger. My date had the pan sautéed scallops. She loved them and my taste was wonderful. She also had the lobster bisque. It was so rich and creamy.  For sides we had mushrooms, sautéed with garlic we loved them. Also had creamed spinach. We both thought it was fine, have had better. Both portions were very generous, more than enough for both of us. Service was fantastic.

My first thought is, 'it was ok'. My wife agrees. While we had a great service, everything was just 'ok'.  We have been to many nice places in Vegas and nothing here 'wowed' us. overall it was a good experience.
Great restaurant excellent food! big portions, definitely for sharing..
Best Steakhouse hands down! Lobster Bisque and the Lobster mashed potatoes are a few to name the best ever! Filets to die for! Always a treat! Love you Mastros!
This my favorite steak house in Vegas, tonite I will be here for my birthday. Best place and my only place I'm vegas

Mastro's where to begin. Located in the Crystals mall just outside the main entrance to Aria, sister restaurant to Scottsdale & Beverly hills' location. we embarked on night one in Vegas.  So let's start with the drinks at the Piano bar a very nice opening where a piano man and gorgeous singer belt out a few tunes prior to dinner where we were seated in the Tree house so to speak.  Bright open and airy we were treated service wise very nicely.  8 Tonight and waiters and staff were brisk and efficient.  The standard push for bottled water well you get the drill. A High end steak house and fish place that needs no preamble.

Great Start bread basket with Pretzel breads and such excellent! 

I'll run it down.  Shrimp cocktail is a highlight with the dry ice making the fog come off the shrimp it's an eye catcher.  Asked for horseradish on the side oh boy the hottest dam thing I've ever consumed. one drop in the sauce made my dry stuffed nose wince and my head was cleared like a nitrate ammonia pack from my football days. Yea baby it was good! A lobster cocktail was also equally outstanding.  Multiple salads were also ordered and shared from a Chopped house salad, a Cesar salad and beefsteak tomatoes & Mozzerella.  Skip the last one. 

Entrees: 7 Steaks one piece of fish.
Every single steak was absolutely delicious From the bone in filet to the strip to the bone in KC Strip there were outstanding. One was cooked or shall I say undercooked and the handled it not only by fixing the dish but removing it from the bill.  The Hawaiian big eyed Tuna was horrible only way to describe it. Sorry but another get this out of here moments. 

Sides: All very generous in size and easily splittable among the group 4 sides way too much for 8 people.
Lobster Mashed potatoes a die for moment outstanding
Sauteed mushrooms yummy
Gorgonzola Mac & cheese another to die for moment

Creamed spinach excellent.

All and all a fine dining experience with the drawback of a couple of 1 undercooked steak and one bad entree both removed from Bill make this a nice experience.

First of all the calamari was as good as the stuff we get in Mexico and the butter cake was amazing. BUT, the ambiance wasn't that great. Too much crammed into one space in the middle of, what feels like, a mall. I wouldn't pay the prices again for the food quality. It was good and had good flavor and service was good. But it was not anything amazing. We had the crab legs, the KC ribeye, creamed spinach, and scalloped potatoes. It was good food, like I said, but I would never pay the high prices for it again.

I was so excited to try Mastros for the first time after hearing such amazing things about the place. Boyfriend made reservations here for our 8 year anniversary on a Saturday evening, requesting to sit inside the "treehouse" that everyone on yelp recommended. They even called him the day before to confirm if we were still coming. 

We arrived about 5 minutes early and the host immediately had an "oh crap" look once we gave her the name for our reservation. She said if we wanted to sit in the treehouse it would be a 45 minute wait.. I was so upset because we made reservations almost a month in advance and the fact that they called us the day before to make sure we were still coming... Whatever

We didn't want to wait the extra 45 minutes cause we were starving, so they sat us at a different table. 

We ordered cocktails, which were really good and strong! We got crab legs as appetizer and they were really fresh, I liked the cocktail sauce that came with it. We decided to share the bone in filet because we didn't want leftovers because the hotel we stayed at had no fridge, they were kind enough to split this for us. We also ordered scalloped potatoes as a side. The steak was okay, a little too salty for my liking. The potatoes were still hard, I wish we got Mac and cheese instead. Even though we split the steak we still couldn't finish it, we ended up taking it togo along with the potatoes. 

For dessert we got the infamous butter cake and it was delicious! They put and candle and wrote happy anniversary, which was really sweet of them. When the check came I noticed that they charged us for the anniversary cake, I was reading other reviews that people got their dessert comped?! Anyways, overall I'm not sure if I'll return, at least not this location. I'm still bitter that they couldn't accommodate our seating arrangement for our anniversary.

I am going to be 100% and not waste anyone's time.

Butter cake. Best I have ever had. So sweet buttery, that homemade whip cream adds a nice sugary surprise. That is all I get when I go here and totally worth it.

THE VERDICT: Butter Cake. See YA!

This place was recommended to me by a friend who lives in Las Vegas. We were celebrating a birthday. The ambiance and the service were just starters to a terrific meal. Our waiter was helpful with suggestions and the other waitstaff was BOMB!  When our appetizers arrived ( calamari, and dungeoness crab cocktail was oh so good. Dinner was delicious. We had the blackened halibut x3 and the other person had the lobster tail. Our sides were   Sautéed broccoli, lobster mash, sautéed asparagus , all were top notch. FABULOUS!!!  The service alone was 5 star. And the food was another 5 star.   We'll be back. Yes it's pricey, but who cares!!

I did not get to enjoy my meal as much as I wish... =( but I know for a fact that the food was really good..

Me & my girl friend (Amy L) made reservations for 6PM on a Saturday. After dragging ourselves over here from Vdara, we finally made it on time. It was an absolute drag because we were awake for 30+ hours & we felt really crappy from all the "beverages" we consumed... basically we felt like utter sh** and couldn't enjoy our meals =(

Located in the City Center, the restaurant is pretty much in the very center of the building. Service was good but a bit slow. I love the assortment of bread, my favorite is the crunchy cheesey-garlicky one =)

Here's what we ordered:

Lobster Bisque - comes in a huge bowl, tastes very very VERYY rich, not too many pieces of lobster but still pretty delicious

Seared Sea Scallops - I've had this before at Mastro's in Beverly Hills, same thing, still delicious, comes with 3 scallops & yummy cheese/garlic bread. Scallops from Mastro's comes in 2nd place after Providence's :P

 Bone-in Filet - cooked medium. Comes on a sizzling plate, very good rich flavors and good texture. I was only able to eat 2-3 bites. I did eat the leftovers the next morning & it was still pretty tasty. 

Chilean Sea Bass - blacken cajun flavored, I think.. It was pretty damn good, texture is very similar to scallops.

King Crab Gnocchi - big enough to be an entree on it's own, holy sh*t, I don't know how this thing can just be a side dish lol it's meant to be shared amongst 4+ people.. I thought it was pretty yummy, I love cheese and king crab meat... but this is super duper heavy, I probably would not order this again...

Garlic Spinach - tasty but a bit too garlicky for me, it was so infused with garlic that it tasted a bit bitter to me..


I am so sad that we were so full that I didn't get to try to butter cake, AGAIN! =( We didn't have much of an appetite at all, plus I think we ordered a little too much lol... we were stuffed after having a few bites of our appetizers.  Service was good, our waiter was a bit slow though. Our water glasses were never empty (thank goodness, we must have drank a total of 13 glasses each..)

Restrooms are located on the second floor, kind of a hassle to look for. Bad idea to go when you're intoxicated..



Lesson learned: do not attempt fine dining after a night of debauchery....excellent restaurant & food! Must try the butter cake one day.... =(

Very good food but I have to be hard on a place like this. You're paying top dollar for everything from environment to world class service and thus you'd expect the food to be equally top echelon, but I could nit pick my steak and the food's temperature. Sitting at the bar was not top echelon service attentiveness, just good. The chef and owner need to pay more attention to detail if they want to be seen as Las Vegas' best restaurant, which they very well could be.

This was a 5 star anniversary dinner for us!  Amazing!

Location:  You cannot beat dining in a "tree house" in the Crystals Mall.  Very cool!  I loved the live music that I could hear from the lower levels of the mall.

Service:  Mike R was our server.  He was completely patient and totally helpful.  He gave us a taste of two different wines when we were trying to decide on a bottle.  He was great with any questions we had.  Great guy and a huge asset to the restaurant.

Food:  The bread basket was amazing and beautifully presented.  Wish I could have tried everything without filling up before dinner!   Beef carpaccio, bone in filet, ribeye (bone in), au gratin potaotes, and compliementary butter cake (for our anniversary!).  I loved every bite of our meal.  The food was superb.

Drink:  As mentioned, Mike R let us sample the wines, and we selected the Earthquake, which he stated was from a boutique winery.  Huge thumbs up!!!!!  Next visit will include one of the cool looking cocktails!

This was a great, great meal!  Mastos hit everything on the mark, and have two satisfied customers who can't wait to return!

Love Mastros!
Pricey but worth it!
The Shrimp cocktail is amazing

I want to say that I'm a frequent diner at the Mastro's in costa mesa as well as beverly hills. 

The service there trumps the vegas experience. Disappointing. At one point the server dropped some of the gnocchi on my lap as he was serving it onto my plate. He knew because I reacted unfavorably since I had some pretty nice pants on. Not a single apology. 


meh. 

I don't hold it against you Mastro's... you're still my 2nd favorite place to eat in orange county :D

This shall be short because Mastro's is just plain awesome.

Lobster Tails = Delectable
Creamed Spinach = Delish
Scalloped Potatoes = RICH! Very yummy cheeses in the dish
Ahi Tuna = Yum! 
Chocolate Cake = Da Bomb

Corkage Fee - $35.
Service = IMPECCABLE

This is our go-to place whenever we're in Vegas for an expensive dinner. The boyfriend goes here when he's in Scottsdale for business dinners. It's just fantastic.  A pretty penny, but amazing.

I went to a Mastro's in Chicago with my brother. I loved their butter cake so much that after seeing a show in Vegas, I took my wife to experience the greatness that is Mastro's Butter Cake. 

If you haven't tried it and you are on death row, this should be your final meal (for dessert). If you are not on death row or in prison, you should definitely make a trip and try it out. The rest of their food is really good as well, but we came for THE dessert. 

I can't describe it, except it is scrumtralecent. I envy anyone who lives within an hour of Mastro's. If you live within an hour and haven't tried it yet you should be deported... to Idaho.

Having been to another branch of Mastro's in Beverly Hills, my boyfriend sought to surprise me by making a reservation in this location for my 21st birthday because he was confident that it wouldn't disappoint and he was completely right. Just like the one in Beverly Hills, this place had outstanding service! Honestly, it has better service than the one in Beverly Hills. Our server, Tanya, was amazing. She kinda resembles Chelsea Lately but way prettier.. anyways she was very accommodating even though she was busy with other tables. I was impressed by her. Since it was my birthday, we got a complimentary dessert of my choice and I chose the warm butter cake. It is so delicious. We got escargot for an appetizer following our main course which was a rack of lamb with a side of creamed spinach along with a sushi tower which consisted of hamachi sashimi and clear lobster roll. Every single thing we ordered was simply delightful and at times, I wish I can go to Vegas just to eat at this specific location of Mastro's. Because it's Vegas, it is a little more crowded but the ambiance still reflects an elegant and classy environment. Thank you Mastro's Ocean Club for making my birthday memorable :)
What a wonderful dinning experience! Everything from the hostess' and LR's outstanding service! Definitely coming back. A MUST the Seafood Tower and the Butter Cake.

PERFECTION!

Mary brought me to Mastro's for my Birthday dinner as part of my Birthday trip to Las Vegas in August.  Our dinner at Mastro's in Vegas, as all our dinners at every Mastro's we have ever visited was pure perfection.  

The ambiance and the food, the staff, the management.... Impeccable!

Called ahead to see if reservations were necessary, hostess said 9:15 pm is earliest res...but at 6:30 kids and wife were hungry!
Heard good things, so really wanted to try this place...glad we decided to walk over and take our chances...pleasantly Sat down right away in high booth...

Ordered 1 half dozen oysters and a few crab claws...wow, best claws ever, as fat as Tabasco bottle! Sweet n meaty too!
Server (Dalin) was excellent, made a mistake on our app order and punched in 6 half dozen oysters instead of the 1 half dozen...and when the tower came out, told us he made an order mistake and just said go eat as many as we can...36 oysters! 3 diff types, inc kumamotos, cushies from BC and the best Misty Points ever! First  time a server made mistake and left it on the table! We woulda totally understood if they pulled it off the table, but happily surprised to indulge...

Then came the fish...swordfish pan seared to perfection and sea bass that was breaded and baked...think of the biggest, tastiest  scallop you've had in your life...in a crispy, flaky, juicy...forget your name Ono form!
Winner! Best, most memorable dining experience we've had!

This may have been the best meal experience so far

Mastro's is absolutely by far the best fine dining you will find in the US. I have been to all locations except for Chicago. (Yes, I will get there someday.) It is expensive but worth every penny. The crab cakes are crazy delicious. Lobster mashed potatoes. Yeah, you read that correctly. The filet melts in my mouth. The chocolate covered strawberries are amazing even when ordered in the dead of winter! I'm heading there in a few weeks for my 40th birthday followed by Thunder from Down Under. Ahhh, what a fabulous evening that shall be.
Butter cake..... is heaven. Seriously everything here is so damn good!! Atmosphere and staff is amazing as well

Amazing restaurant. I took my gf here for her birthday, because she loves mall food, and this restaurant is in one of the most expensive malls I've ever been to. All jokes aside, the food is excellent and the service was impeccable. I had the lamb rack; it was mouth watering and the presentation was unique.

Decor was very nice, cool tree house in the mall.   

Service lacked as it was very slow and took a long time to get the bill...

Portions were HUGE,  wish we knew that before ordering because no one finished their meal and what a waste since we were out of town.  I hope the bus boy ate my wifes left over chicken.  It was a whole chicken it looked like!!  But it was sure good...

My wife did not like the live music nor the singer, she looked good, but really did not sound good.  Plus they ruined a classic REM song. 

Overall ok and a bit over the top, would I go back?  no...

We dined here just this past Monday 9/21/15.  My boyfriend and I wanted to treat his parents to a "fancy" evening, and let me tell you it was nothing short of fantastic! Paul (our server) was beyond knowledgeable and added so much more to our fun.  My boyfriend's mom even tried the escargot, (after much prodding) but ended up really enjoying it.  If I could I would come back 3 times a week.  Definitely save room for the Butter Cake, all of us being over-stuffed still ate the entire thing without complaints :)  They do have a more expensive spread but it is more than worth the splurge. Double date with the parents was a huge success, thanks Paul! ABSOLUTELY  ASK FOR PAUL... HE ROCKS!

This was by far the best meal and dining experience we had in Las Vegas. Daniel our waiter and the rest of the staff were very helpful, attentive, accommodating and professional. I highly recommend Mastro's  to anyone looking for an excellent meal and dining experience.

Our most recent dining experience at Mastros was 3/29/15. We were a party of 4. We were seated promptly upon arrival under "the cage". That is an open covering cavelike to soften the views of the Mall as it is located in the Crystal Mall in City Center. Crazy. Most of us ordered steaks and Calamari for an appetizer. The appetizer took FOREVER to appear! Ok, forgiven because it was excellent. Moving on. The steaks, for the most part, were fine except for one which needed less raw. Yes, I said raw! All side dishes are a la carte, so sharing is a must. The dinners are served on near bare plates with no presentation at all, so whatever. 
All in all, not bad, but for the price a little bit more effort is in order. I will say our server did her best to cover up the mis-steps and I appreciate that effort. Unfortunately, she should not have to.

Came here a couple weeks ago with my girlfriend and had absolutely the best seafood I have had in a long time.  We started off with a couple cosmos which are my favorite at the Ocean Club because they seem to be never ending and they use dry ice to keep it exceptionally cold!  For our entree we chose the seafood tower (see pic) which was amazing and a ton of food!  After that we could not eat anything more except desert and our waitress Shauna told us the Butter Cake could not be beat and she was right.  I would definitely recommend  Mastro's Ocean Club for a fine dining experience... the service is spectacular, the food is spectacular and the restaurant is very cool.

Food and service is impeccable! My fiancé and I went and can't wait to go back! I had the filet and he had the bone-in ribeye, both we great! Their twice backed potato was too good to just consider it a potato and the king crab claw on ice was delicious! We go to steak houses often everywhere we travel but this is definitely in the top for us.

Had a wonderful experience. The food is spectacular and the service was on point. Perfectly cooked filet. Delicious sides especially the cream corn. Albacore had a little too much soy sauce on top. 

Overall really enjoyed Mastro's

Today was our friend's birthday and our server Tanya was so friendly and really went out her way to make sure our dining experience was excellent! The food was delicious and Tanya was very knowledgable and friendly. We had such a lovely time at Mastros Ocean Club and next time we come to Vegas we would love to come back!!! Thank you Tanya and Mastros for ensuring that our lovely experience!!!

Everyone there made me feel welcome and part of the family. None of the smiles were fake which is important. Mario Lopez was the ultimate in gracious and professional services!
