The filet was cooked to flawless perfection, and now no other steak will make the cut. Thank you all for the complimentary butter cake! You made our honeymoon an incredible treat!

As a Vegas local, born and raised, I've been to many restaurants here. However, I had never been to Mastros, and was told I had to go. The food was delicious, but my experience was tainted due to the way the management handled an issue.

There was a couple sitting directly behind my husband and I, and the woman was visibly drunk. Slumping in her chair, etc. Finally, she throws up to the side of her table, which is about 2 feet or less from my chair. The smell is horrendous and I quickly flag over a waiter and tell him the issue. 
He gets a manager. I explain to the manager what has happened and he asks if it's the end of the meal or beginning. I say end, but we have dessert and coffee coming. He said "what would you like to do?" I thought it was obvious, but I start laughing and say, "I'd like a new table please." 
He escorts us to a new table and says "You know, this is completely beyond my control." 

I'm aware of this. I haven't yelled, complained, or blamed anyone for the situation. The drunk woman is STILL slouched in her chair, STILL vomiting, and I'm being moved by MY request without so much as a, "I'm sorry" or "I hope this hasn't ruined your experience." NOTHING. Then, the manager says he will tell our waiter that we moved. 
The waiter comes up some time later and says "oh, I see you have moved tables" We proceed to explain to him what happened since the manager didn't, and we finish up getting our coffee and dessert and settle our tab, while the woman still sits there and the puke remains. 

I wasn't looking for anything really, except maybe a simple apology on behalf of the restaurant that let a woman get increasingly drunk and throw up so close to me. Instead of a choice like "please let us move you to a better seat" I was asked what I would like to do....and then the only words spoken to me were "You know, this is completely beyond my control." AND nothing was explained to our waiter, so we had to wait until he found us. Poor management and I don't think I should be made to feel guilty for asking for a new seat away from puke.
Absolutely incredible restaurant!!!  You must have the warm butter cake for dessert!!!!!

We couldn't make our initial reservation and was disappointed but when we checked in to the Aria and noticed it was located in the Crystal shops, we decided to have a late dinner after shopping. 

The ambiance was unique, in a good way. Our server Daniel gave us exceptional service - he was very attentive and accommodating. We ordered the Rack of Lamb, Scallops and the Gorgonzola Mac n Cheese! Everything was cooked to perfection and well seasoned aka tasty. 

We were not disappointed and happy we were able to experience Mastro's Ocean Club before leaving Vegas.
Absolutely nothing to say except the service and food was great! My first time there and it's not going to be the last.

MASTRO'S Never disappoints, why would this one!

Best steak restaurant on this planet!

I have been to 10 different locations, all around and I always get the same service and quality of food. 

No matter what you get from the menu, you will never be disappointed (and if you are, there is something wrong with you head..see a psych asap)...

Absolutely amazing! Excellent service from the time I called to make a reservation (because open table didn't show availability for the time I wanted) to the hostess to the wait staff. We ordered the filet and it was cooked to perfection! The garlic mashed potatoes and spinach were generous and the butter cake lived up to expectations. We will definitely be back

The $100 up charge on the credit card was resolved through the diligent work of AMEX and it looks like the manager is the one who padded the bill after we finished dinner. So apologies go out to deon because the vitriol should be directed to the manager. Aside from that, this was one of the most perfect dinner experiences that I've had in a while in Vegas. I received an email from someone in corporate but have had no follow up after that. A gift certificate or something would have been nice because they certainly f***ed up.

Decided to book a table for another celebration with the hubby. Made a reservation a day in advance asking for preferred seating for the occasion (ample notice, for sure).

Once we arrived (15 minutes early),  we were seated in between the bar and main floor hallway that allows the food runners/waiters to run in/out of the floor.... Asked the hostess to accommodate us better than this and all we got was "this is the best table I have, sorry!" shouted behind her at us as she walked away. 

Meanwhile, the floor was, at best, 70% full. Not looking to complain, we just sat down and hoped for the best. Our waiter was a tall, bald, emotionally disconnected guy who seemed to be running through the motions of serving. Never got his name, but he warmed up towards the end of the service. 

Being as it was our anniversary we simply wanted to be left alone with our food yet know our server wasn't too far away, so this did the job I suppose. 

We ordered the $55 steak filet (after the waiter talked us OUT of the $125 Wagyu beef we requested, as if we couldn't afford it....LOL), the lobster mashed potatoes (eh...), lobster bisque (stellar-not hard to mess up, however), and the Smoked Salmon (forgettable and way too salty). 

We went for the cliché Butter Cake for dessert and it didn't disappoint- however, we were so full from the bisque we couldn't finish. :( sad faces all around. 

For a high-class restaurant, this one was filled loud and obnoxious diners (one table next us was revoltingly drunk and hollered at every female who walked past us) and another across the restaurant was the same but thankfully far away. Management seemed to just let them yell their heads off as long as they ordered more booze- hmmm. 

In all, nowhere near a 5-Star experience. Not a 4, either. These would require more personable and attentive service, as well as regulation of rowdy diners. It's Memorial Day weekend, not Fight Night or Cinco de Mayo. No excuse. 

The three star wasn't a two because our food runners and water/bread guys were awesome and always there to refill and clear away dishes, the steak filet was incredibly prepared and the sleekness of the restaurant's design helped us forget about out shoddy table. 


Maybe next time, Mastro's.

Freakin' Awesome!!! I have never had another steak like at Mastro's. I don't normally eat seafood but when I was here I had tried the crab legs and they were super tender and buttery and succulent. They serve these huge crab legs that are already split and cracked so you don't have to spend an hour trying to suck a little piece of meat out of the shell. 

My steak was ridiculously good, medium-well filet mignon, I don't even have words to explain it because I start to stttttuudder, it was that good. The Gorgonzola mac and cheese was excellent, I wish we would have taken our left over mac but we were in Vegas and we weren't going back to our hotel room right after dinner.  The mushrooms were soooo good, nice meaty mushrooms, I believe they were shittake shrooms.  Bread basket was awesome, all kinds of different breads to snack on. 

Ordered a vodka 7up and dang was that strong. The waiters were super nice and you feel like royalty when you dine here. I would definitely suggest Mastro's.

We ate at Mastro's at their Los Angeles location earlier this year. The steaks that we had were the best that we had ever had. We were in Las Vegas during part of the Labor Day Weekend and had long decided to eat at the Vegas location in a shopping mall leading into Aria Hotel/Casino and in a tree house. We were staying at The Cosmopolitan Hotel it was a breeze to get to the restaurant.
We were seated immediately to our table as per our reservation. The server was very attentive and informative. I had a bone-in filet for dinner with garlic mashed potatoes and a dessert in the end. All of the above with a forever flowing bottle of red wine.
The steaks at Mastro's Ocean Club (Whether in Los Angeles or in Las Vegas) are dry-aged and prepared to perfection. The texture is so soft and buttery with the flavors bold and bountiful. I have to tell you that the term, "Melts in your mouth", can literally be used at this establishment and it would not be over stated. We paid a pretty penny for this meal as well however it was well worth all of it and then some.

This is my 3rd time to this particular restaurant.  This time was kinda disappointing.  I have brought my over-sea clients to this restaurant and the service was 30% of what it used to be.  Our waiter kept chatting with other waiters and it took us 3 times to raise our hands to get his attention for both times.  When I had asked about the types of steaks, he answered as if I was supposed to know that with "Obviously", "of course this type of steak is more firm..."  we really do not appreciate that.  We pay high price to came to enjoy the food and environment, not to be treated as if it is our job to know the types of food.  The food was good, but our party of 9 people who are all business owners said they liked the food, but agreed that for this class level of spending, the service was very disappointing and substandard.  We did see that services were much better at other tables...seems as if our waiter has a little discriminative to Asians.  As a result, we gave 10% of the service tip instead of the 20% I usually give at this restaurant.  This will be my last time taking clients to this particular restaurant.

One of the worst steakhouse I've ever ate at.. Dirty dishes and knives to begin with. Had 3 of my friends order medium rare and it came out brown.. Told the manager, he had the chef to start a new order, and it came out again well done.. I was speechless. How do you mess up the order twice??? For a steakhouse this is pathetic. If your cooks can't cook steaks .. Please consider a new profession..

My first Mastro's experience took place inside the treehouse of the steakhouse chain's Las Vegas restaurant. I had never expected to take the plunge at Mastro's in Vegas, as I have been eyeballing its SoCal locations for years but never had set foot inside.

The verdict? In the overall spectrum of Las Vegas steakhouses, Mastro's was superior to Craftsteak but a significant step down from CUT. 

The high point of the meal arrived early in the form of the seafood tower, which was over-the-top but fantastic. In short, the seafood tower here crushes the one at Oceanaire. It's the best reason to have dinner here.

The low point of the meal was my filet. In fact, in an unexpected turn of events, I left feeling as though I should have ordered the salmon instead. Like everyone else at my table did. As for wine, order the duck horn merlot. 

Surprisingly, another underwhelming aspect of the meal were the sides. Mastro's take on mac and cheese was a bust compared to CUT. The lobster mashed potatoes were a let down too, especially given the hype and eye-popping price tag. As a salad, I had wanted to order the caprese, which generally is a favorite of mine. Our server talked me into the heirloom burrata instead, which I regretted doing after tasting it.

For dessert, the chocolate cake sounded like the best choice after skimming the menu, but turned out to be dry. The better option was effectively donuts with ice cream. Neither, however, were good enough to recommend with much enthusiasm.

The decor in this restaurant is pretty amazing even though it's in a high profile mall.  Who would've known!

The service, food, and drinks were all delicious.  They our large party of all ladies at the high tables with the high stools.  It probably would've been easier if we were seated at the regular tables as it was also very dim in that section of high tables. 

The steak and the fish were all very delicious and large portions.  So ladies it's ok to share!
We went there for my cousins birthday. It was everything I was expecting it to be. The food was amazing, the service was great, they even brought out her favorite cake for desert all decorated!!!!

This is my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. Although it's basically a restaurant located in the middle of a shopping mall (albeit an upscale mall), it is a very pleasurable dining experience. The food here is incredible. The lemon drops are fantastic and entertaining as they are served smoking and bubbling. Excellent wines on the wine list. The filet here is magnificent. The truffle lobster gnocchi is out of this world. The side dishes are excellent and feed about four or five people. The warm butter cake is spectacular and is served with a huge bowl of some of the best whipped cream we have tasted. Unfortunately, one of the people in our party ordered the crab cakes and was disappointed with them as she thought they were over seasoned and almost tasted as though they were seasoned with poultry seasoning. The last time we ate at Mastro's Ocean the service was tad bit better, but compared to the poor service that we've been receiving lately, the service was outstanding. Did I mention the live pianist? Some of the people in our party thought they were listening to some recorded Billy Joel music and were surprised when they found out that it was actually a young man playing the piano.

5 star class all the way. Not only was the food amazing and the design of the restaurant but service was superb too. All portions were very big. My lamb was to die for. Ambiance out of this world. I normally do not eat bread but I just had to here.

Went to Mastro's before a show. Scott was our server and was excellent. Had a full dozen oyster's on the half shell which were just out of the ocean fresh and delicious! I ordered Sea Bass blackened and it was melt in your mouth perfect! The lobster mashed were delish as was the house dessert, Warm Butter Cake, served with loads of fresh homemade whipped cream! Servings are large and we all had leftovers. Loved sitting in the treehouse. We do have a few suggestions: The entrance is so boring and the piano is shoved way back in a back corner that you would never notice it. How about putting the piano up front somewhere? Such a wonderful restaurant needs a a better first impression. Also, we had called and asked for a 7:30 reservation and were told it was not available but 8:30 was. That was too late for us to make our show, so reservationist suggested 7. We arrived and were seated at 7 and the restaurant was no more than half full until past 8 pm!! So why couldn't we have come at 7:30 as we first asked? I mentioned this to a manager who approached our table mid-meal  and he said, "Well, sometimes things change." HUH??? Terrible response. Nevertheless, we loved our dinner and the service was fabulous. We can't wait to go back. We're already saving up!

We spontaneously decided to eat here tonight for dinner and they seated us right away which was great. The table we were assigned was not one we liked and they had no problem letting us sit beside the balcony instead... I ordered the oysters on the half shell and even though the month of July has no r in it, they tasted extremely fresh. Their horseradish is amazing! For an entree I ordered the scallops. I have not ordered scallops in years because it's such a difficult food for restaurants to really have fresh but this was a worthy choice. My partner is vegetarian and her sides were homemade mashed potatoes, brussels sprouts and asparagus. Everything was so good that we forgot to leave space for dessert... Even the complimentary bread was irresistible. Thanks Mario!

Unbelieveable experience! Went there with a group of 8 and sat in the treehouse. The food was fantastic but it was the service that made the night. Our server knew the menu inside and out and made recommendations that everyone enjoyed. She even knew all the preparations inside and out. Some had seafood while others enjoyed the signature steaks Mastros is known for. Also the cocktails were great. If you have a group and are looking for an A+ experience while in Vegas this is a great choice.

To start, great atmosphere. The bar is very attractive with the artistic bottle layout.  The restaurant is set up with a patio like feel, so its a little loud.  Food was great, steaks were cooked to perfection, and the sides were spot on. I highly recommend the mac, it pairs very well with the steak. The service was good, the waiters were very knowledgeable and professional. Even if you are stuffed, order the butter cake to finish off your dinner, you won't regret it.

My husband and I have been to Mastro's twice, once for work and most recently for my birthday. 

1. Service is good.  

2. Caesar salad was over dressed and had too much cheese.  Gavin Degraw was also eating at the restaurant that night and shared the same feedback on the Caesar salad.  

3. Steak is the reason that this rating is 4 stars instead of 5.  We have had far better steak at Craftsteak. But the side of mushrooms that you can order with the steak is sooo good!

4. Butter cake was a great dessert but there chocolate cake was very dry.  Both you could share with someone else.

5. The lemon drop is one of the best I have ever had.  I will order it every time I am in Vegas. The wine list is also reasonable and has a lot of good choices.

As always, Mastro's does not disappoint! Their food tasted just as I remembered it, AMAZING. The service we received was great! I love how attentive they are with everything! 

We got the Chef's special - Ribeye with Maine Lobster and let me tell you, the food was so delicious. 
They also comped their famous Butter Cake since it was our Anniversary. 

Being that we've dined at their Beverly Hills location, this place seemed a bit more casual and less romantic since it's inside a mall.

Mastro's in las Vegas is wonderful.  Ate there for ten year anniversary.  Service is wonderful.  Food is delicious.  Warm butter cake for dessert(on the house for special occasion) will make you jump back flips.  Lobster mash is incredible. Steaks were fab.  Waiter mike r, was great.  Go and enjoy.

My friend treated me to dinner here for my birthday, and it was fabulous. 

I would've rated it as five stars, but I had a couple things that bothered me. First, we had a reservation, and came about 15 minutes early so we could grab a drink at the bar first. We checked in, but were not seated until about 20 minutes past our reservation. Not a big fan of having to wait that long past the reservation time. Second, I'm not a big fan of the dress code. It's supposed to be fine dining, and it is a beautiful restaurant. But, the fact that you see customers simply wearing t-shirts and jeans kind of ruins the whole thing. 

Other than that - all was dandy. Service was impeccable, but I would hope so considering the amount you pay to eat there. 

Food wise - we got oysters as appetizers. They were very fresh and tasted great. The clam chowder we ordered was decent, but nothing to rave about. I've had plenty of other clam chowders that easily beat the one at Mastro's. The steaks we ordered were cooked to perfection, and were complimented well by the sauteed mushrooms. 

Since it was my birthday - they did give us free chocolate cake, which was nice. Very light, fluffy, & moist. BUT, we did also order the warm butter cake, which I think most would agree is a must. Man, the chocolate cake was nothing in comparison. 

Overall, great place. Would definitely go back again, when I have the money to spare. 

And on a completely random note - they do serve Chilean Sea Bass at this establishment, which surprised me. This fish is known to be highly over fished and is on Seafood Watch's list of fish to avoid. Just thought I'd let you know.

We walked by the place early last week while shopping and exploring the City Center.  Love the ambiance, menu looked great, have heard great things about other locations so we decided to make this our last nights meal in Vegas.  Glad we did because aside from Mix, and JR's this has now become one of our favorite places in Vegas. I would not hesitate to recommend. 

Seated in the main dining area right in the middle of the coolest structure for a restaurant you will ever see. Warm dining room, very welcoming as were the staff. Ours were a attractive redhead young lady and a younger guy.  Piano playing jazzy christmas tunes, nice touch.  Immediate introduction by the servers, it looked as if there were two for every table. We started with the house special martinis, served chilled and shaken at the table and blended perfectly. Really, perfectly.  Scanned the menu,  server came back by to check on the drinks and announced the specials. Decided on the following:

Sautéed Sea Scallops
Warm Spinach Salad
Chilean Sea Bass
NY Strip w/o bone
Lobster Mashed 

Scallops arrived, great presentation. Now I love scallops, being in the PNW we have lots of choices on seafood and some of the best scallops I have ever had are at the barking frog near the Woodinville winery and home of the famous Herbfarm. These were excellent, large but not too, perfectly seasoned and prepared. All sitting on tip of the most wonderful cheese bread cracker in a wonderful sauce. Yum! 

Salad arrived, again great presentation, just made, plate warmed just enough you could smell all the ingredients. Now this was key. Onion, egg, bacon and greens all perfectly aligned to emit this wonderful fragrance that just made your mouth water.  None of the heat or tartness you sometimes get with places putting too much red vinegar on the greens.  And the taste, I shit you not this was the best salad I have ever tasted. The senses alive with the fragrance and the taste perfectly aligned. 

Steak and bass arrived, simple but elegant in preso.  Bowl of steaming potatoes with over a pound of lobster and a beautiful sauce. Steak done to perfection, one of the best cuts and flavors I have had. And I am a steak house freak.  Steak was severed still sizzling on the plate, little bit of butter on top on a simple white plate.  Wife's Sea bass was served equally as elegant. Simply in presentation, nice cut of fish perfect flavor.  

Service was just right, friendly, genuine there when needed. Asked the server to choose a wine for me to pair with the steak. Perfect choice came back again.

I don't work for this place, wish I owned stock or had ownership though. This was by far one of the best dining experiences we have had all year. We will be back. 

Thanks to the wonderful staff and happy holidays!

Yeah yeah, this place is great (ribeye, lobster mashed potatoes, truffle crab gnocchi, butter cake). 

Comparing CRAFTSTEAK??

Service: Waaaaaaay better at Mastro's. Craftsteak reminds me of being on a Caribbean cruise, and that's NOT a good thing.

Food: Larger portions and better execution at Mastro's. Craftsteak seemed oversalted on its steaks and lacking on everything else.

Ambiance: *see Service comments :)

I have been here multiple times and have brought multiple friends just for the buttercake. But today, the host was extremely rude and unprofessional. She wouldn't look up from her book to answer our basic question of if they are serving the buttercake that I will never return or suggest this place to anyone. Check your front desk host and make sure you don't ruin a loyal customers experience to the point of never wanting to return. Clearly management needs to teach customer service.

You can do a lot of interesting things in Vegas.  I had no idea fine dining in a funky abstract treehouse was one of them.  Mastro's is quite the experience -- from the structure itself, to the wondrous items and their presentations, to the exceptional and classy staff.  You salivate as you picture-perfect dishes being carried by.  

The seafood tower is a spectacle - double tiered dish with dry ice smoke surrounding it.  I have no idea how the waitstaff can carry that giant concoction.  It came to the table and shocked us at first sight.  The shrimp were the size of my fist, the crab legs were monstrous, and everything was overwhelming.  If you can eat after that appetizer, then hats off to you!  

As luck would have it, I was crazy hungry, so I went for the 22 oz Bone-in Ribeye.  It came out on a plate sizzling at 400 degrees.  Perfection!  Medium rare to the T.  That was the second best Ribeye I've ever had (first being V&A).  I wanted to pick up the bone and start gnawing.  

Someone else got the Halibut cheek which also looked very unique and delicious.  I really wanted to order it.  Alas, as a Texan, Ribeyes speak to my heart (on so many levels?)  

This is definitely one of classiest places that I've been to.  What an upscale Vegas experience.

This meal was FANTASTIC!
      We started with the calamari, it was so fresh with a spice on it and the sauce was tasty. The bread was fresh and I just love a good piece of bread yum! My husband had a salad and he enjoyed it greatly.

For the main course I ordered Chilean Sea Bass, OMG! prepared just right. My fish just melted in my mouth. I forgot what my husband ordered but he was completely statisfied. We ordered the Gnocchi and the sauteed broccoli as our sides, loved the Gnocchi and the broccoli was good. 

I cannot recall if we had desert, but if we did I'm sure it was great. As far as ambiance goes, the place was nice and they had live music going thoughout dinner and we enjoyed it.
This place is amazing I have the bone in ribeye, it was one of the best steaks I have ever had  , and the bone marrow appetizer.

Dined here while in town for the SEMA show. Now I do have an Ocean Club by my house in Scottsdale which I love, however Las Vegas location took it a step further. I mean the food was excellent and very similar you must try the Chilean sea bass with the crust/ lobster mash/ & butter cake by the way, but the service we experienced in Las Vegas was out of this world! Everyone from the hostess to server and manager really made our experience wonderful. Keep up the good work I will be back.

I just experienced a wonderful meal at this establishment. I would say there was a mid-century modern flair to the establishment, with an extremely classy twist. Our server was a gentleman by the name of Eric Baily, and I use the term gentleman loosely...kidding of course, as this man had a great sense of humor, and would truly appreciate a joke as such. He was amazingly attentive.  Our table was also assisted by many other staff members throughout the meal, who were also very helpful and attentive. Everyone was definitely friendly, and seemed excited about the restaurant and what they had to offer. We also spoke with a bar manager for a bit, Luciana, I may have spelt that wrong :(. She had a radiant personality.  They offer a great cocktail and wine list. We tried a key lime martini...yum, and they had Duckhorn Decoy by the glass, for a respectable price...so I had to try it. The bar is beautiful, several stories in height, layered with a beautiful collage of bottles. There was a great open air feel to the restaurant, yet it still maintained a  wonderful level of intimacy. 

Then of course comes the food, solid, simple, and of high quality. Judging from my one experience...that seems to be what they are going for. We had a chilled lobster cocktail and oysters on the half shell for starters. Seriously...amazing oysters...I am in the middle of the desert....eating amazing oysters. The lobster was also great. For our mains we had a steak that came out on a 400 degree plate, hot as can be....I know because I touched it, even after I was warned not to ;P Perfect med rare...perfect med rare for sure. My lady had a crab cake dish... a little ballsy to order such a thing coming from living outside of Maryland for some time. Yet...it was much success...top notch fresh crab meat. I guess you gotta thank modern times and next day air, cause everything we tried was super fresh and very tasty. Again, dishes were very simplistic...but with fresh flavors such as that, you'd only be doing an injustice by masking it with complex levels of flavors.

"First Timer" this was the best dining experience I have ever had! The ambiance was great, the staff was awesome and shocked we have never had Mastros. For drinks we ordered the Buddha Belly which was amazing! The bartender Sheryl was very nice and outgoing with great personality! We sat down our waiter was super nice and knowledgeable. I ordered the Seabass OMG!!! It was tender, seasoned just right just great. It had my taste buds so happy lol. My boyfriend ordered the Ribeye his exact words "we are just now experiencing life!" Lol his facial expressions were priceless. He also ordered the lobster tail loaded potatoes and the Mac n cheese I am definitely coming back here. Dessert we ordered the butter cake it was great!!!

This will always be my favorite place to eat & eill continue to be but, When I asked about the steak sauces and got a full description at the tail end or beginning I feel the waiter should've used the words, " At an additional cost or for a fee".  He said nothing.  So when I saw the $5 which is nothing really but I was annoyed.  In my profession I am require to tell clients everything I know.  The asparigus I chose said "Sauteed".  Which means to mean with butter and so it was but also with garlic.  Un-smiley face, I was hoping to kiss my date after words not after that little secret they brought to my plate. I forgot how far away the table was I missed my date he was so far away.  Ha Ha.....The food was delicious as always and I will be a fan.  I just didn't like all of the things I felt I could've been told & was not. Oh, well next time I will be prepared for surprises that's all.
Prettiest bar ever. 100 bottles of each brand lined up. Waitress made a teeny mistake with our oyster order.

Amazing! Incredible treehouse setting, stupendous service and great food. Las Vegas has a new jewel high atop the rather dull Crystals shopping center at the dreary City Center. I can't tell you how wonderful the entire experience dining at Mastro's is--it's magical. Go, enjoy and bring your camera and appetite.

I have been here 2 times in the last year  the staff is freely and very attentive. This time we got to sit in the Bird house which is really cool.  

The first time was great had the Herb Roasted Chicken*24oz, Lobster Bisque Soup & Heirloom Tomato & Burrata, Creamed Spinach, Creamed Corn, Grilled Asparagus but the best part was the dessert that Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake is by far the best dessert you will every taste.  

So on our second visit we wanted to see if they could repeat it.  Again we got the Herb Roasted Chicken*24oz - it really is very good and enough for two to share.  We got the Blue Cheese wedge and the  for the sides this time we stuck to the same creamed spinach, creamed corn but added the onion rings )which are fantastic) and the grilled Brussels Sprouts(i have to admit these were not bitter at all.)  then came the end that Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake was even better then I remembered its so gooey it melts in your mouth, you have to have it warm because we have stopped by just got the cake to go and it was server cold s not the same.  

I recommend to anyone weather you live in Vegas or visiting try this place you will not be disappointed.

Came here on a Saturday night, and although they were absolutely packed, the service was excellent. I ordered the Ribeye, and the first time around this particular slab was tough and stringy. I started to tell our server and he grabbed the steak no questions asked without even letting me finish my sentence..Could it have been that I tried my brother's Kobe beef steak prior to trying the ribeye, which set up unrealistic expectations? Possibly....but they brought out another ribeye fresh off the grill, which was nice, tender, and perfect. For desert, we had the warm buttercake, which was phenomenal. Also add some drinks into the equation, and for three of us, our bill was $385. I think it was worth it, though.

Love at first sight when the bread basket came out.. What does that tell you? Oh my goodness! This place was amazing! 

 My husband made reservations to have dinner here and he requested a nice table in the tree house! So much fun! We were treated like royalty here!! Everyone was! Their customer service here at Mastros was superb!! They know how to make customers feel like they're having a great eating experience. 

We started with a bottle of Moscato! Nivole Moscato D'asti is my favorite!! 

I had a little trouble deciding what I wanted to eat for dinner, but when I saw the Chilean Sea Bass in the menu, I was hooked! They rubbed panko bread crumbs and fried it lightly to perfection!! My husband had the rib eye cooked medium well! And guess what? It was medium well!! They had a long list of sides. We went with the Lobster Mashed Potatoes, which had big chunks of fresh lobster. The lobster and potatoes just melted in your mouth because of all the butter! And then we had the Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese! 

I was so sad that our hotel room did not have a refrigerator. I would have definitely took our left overs with me. As we left the restaurant, I was devastated! The food was absolutely delicious and I wished I had room in my belly to finish all of it!

Yes I know I am the only person on here to give them 3 stars but please hear me out for my reasoning behind all this. 

On Saturday, I had made reservations for a party of two at 730PM. When he arrived at 720PM, it was not really busy nor was it a ghost town in there. The hostess stand said it would be a moment as they got our table ready and for us to take a seat at the bar, enjoy a cocktail or two and they will get us. 

During our 30 minute wait (yes maybe they were short staffed, not ready yet etc.... which I am ok with) they sat multiple tables of walk-in's and a few reservations of small 2-4 tops. (I know this because a few sat at the bar whom we spoke to and others I over heard when I stood by the hostess stand to wait to check on my table. Off to a bad start..... 

Anyway, we had a nice table overlooking the garden down stairs in the back of the restaurant. All the back-waiters were very prompt and professional with regards to keeping the water glasses full, serving the bread, clearing the table from the right and serving from the left etc... (After working in this industry for years, I get picky about this crap at high end restaurants) The server was pretty on the ball and friendly but a little to relaxed with us. (Yes we are young and eating at a high end restaurant, I am ok with that)

On to the food, below is a list of what we ordered and what I thought about it: 

Calamari App: Lightly breaded with light seasoning. Dipping sauce complimented it very well. 

Fillet Mignon: Very tender and medium rare is more of rare. But it is better to under cook the steak then burn the hell out of it. VERY TENDER, cut with your fork status. 

Sea Bass: Parmesan crusted.... a little on the very fishy side for my taste which overcame the rest of the flavors

Cream of Spinach: Very creamy and just was not my style. Girlfriend liked it though.

Sea salt/vinegar fries: These shoestring cut fries were epic! Yes.... of everything I ate, I was most impressed by the large basket of $10 fries. 

Warm Butter Cake: Once again.... this was the main reason we went here for my birthday and because the other half loves this dessert more than she loves me. :)

Multiple layer chocolate birthday cake: Now to be honest, this was what saved Mastro's from getting the dreadful 2-star rating from me. In my reservation, I had noted "birthday" but no one had seemed to see it. Hell, we even ordered desert and were half way finished with it before they brought out the cake. Personally, did someone at the hostess stand go oops! We need to send a birthday cake over to Table XX immediately even though they already are half way through their dessert? But to be honest, they did and it truly made my otherwise mediocre dining experience in to a pleasant one. 

Overall Mastros.... maybe I set my expectations to high and I understand, you have only been open for a few months now so maybe all the bugs are still getting worked out. In the words of my girlfriend, it was not as good as the Crystal Cove, CA location yet on par with the one in Costa Mesa, CA. 

Sounds like I have to try all this again at the Crystal Cove location and compare! Granted.... thanks for the last minute birthday cake. It was nice to see those little comments on Open Table actually mean something.

Whoa... Don't waste your time or money. There are far too many fantastic choices in Vegas to come here. Shockingly horrible food experience we had for our pre Christmas dinner last Sunday. I do NOT recommend coming here. I can't believe we paid $270 for a mediocre meal... what a disappointment. Fail Mastro's Vegas! Again, I highly, suggest spending your money somewhere else. The one star that I gave them was for, Dalan, our awesome server. 

Now, I have been to Mastro's in OC about a dozen times and it has never failed me but in Las Vegas it was a major let down. What happened?! If anything, I expected more out of the Las Vegas location. We ordered:

1. Shrimp cocktail
2. Wagu 8oz. Steak $98
3. Gorgonzola mac and cheese
4. Creamed spinach
4. Creamed corn 
5. Key lime pie

The shrimp cocktail was the best thing my boyfriend had, served with their house cocktail sauce. The Wagu steak was cooked medium but was the texture of a pork chop. Unlike the buttery, melt-in-your-mouth goodness they boast of. The Mastro's in OC  Wagu steak was cooked to perfection so I have something to compare it to. Fail Mastro's Las Vegas. The Gorgonzola Mac and cheese was missing salt, it was rather bland. The creamed corn was a bit watery, unlike its usual creamy consistency. The corn was also mushy, probably over cooked. That is always a favorite but they seamed to mess that one up too. The creamed spinach was rich but tolerable. Aside from the shrimp cocktail and key lime pie, the dinner was meh.

Update: 5/24/15 
Mastro's reached out to me shortly after our visit but I somehow missed their attempt. After four months of not seeing their message, I immediately called back and spoke to the manager last Saturday. He apologized for our experience and told me that the GM would give me back a call on Sunday... Well, a week later and I hear crickets. No missed calls or messages. Nothing. Wow, this is an even bigger let down. The second fail requires that I update my review... Mastro's kitchen, staff (ie. Management) clean up your act.  I'd take away that one star if I could.
Mmmmmmm!  Best steakhouse in Las Vegas and there are a lot of them.  Everything was PERFECT at our meal.  Very pricey, but worth it.

Great restaurant!
I've never been to an Ocean Club, and everyone in my party loved this one.
Something different, their martini's are actually 2 martini's in one order for around $19, you keep your shaker which gives you the second. My staple is dirty with Chopin and blue cheese olives. Theirs was excellent!
All of the food was good, but much much bigger portions then expected - strange to me for this type of restaurant.
Didn't get desert, but the drinks and food was great. Everyone got something different and everyone love their dish.
Great place!

we did not have a reservation but they were able to get us 2 seats at
the bar.  The barstaff provided great service in addition to making
lots of drinks.  Busy Friday night.
The food was excellent and very large portions, we were able to order
half portions since we were a party of 2.
The meal was a good value given the portions and quality.
Also the restaurant had a very dramatic location.

Service was great hence the 2 stars but I don't understand what the hype was all about. Our steak was part dry part medium rare in some area, our Seabass was super salty. We also ordered cream of spinach they made it extra creamy but that's my fault, it's expected.

I decided to make reservations here for my hubby's bday dinner and an early anniversary dinner as well! Our anniversary is a few days after his bday. I had let them know we were celebrating both occasions and gave us one of the best seats in the house! We sat in the tree house. Our server was Hooper and he was very imformative, proffesional, and even split all our food for us without being asked to! We Hooper brought us out their famous butter cake decorated with "happy birthday" and "happy anniversary"  The best part, they actually comped the dessert for our occasion! I have been to Mastro's in Chicago and I can honestly say that this location is nothing less than exceptional. Great food and great service with attention to detail. I am a true fan and can't wait to come back to this location next time I'm in town!

I have been wanting to try Mastros Ocean Club for a very long time.  We were on a short vacation from Los Angeles.  I have to say that I was disappointed with food and felt it wasn't worth the money.   We were a party of 4.  Started off with the tuna tartar tower and escargot.  I thought they lacked flavor.  I've had better at other places that are not that expensive.  My daughter had the gnocchi with Alaskan Crab as a entree.  She enjoyed it.  My son and BF had the Petite filets 6 oz and 8 oz.  They were tasty but again nothing special.  I had the twin lobster tails.  They came out cold and were flat and just ok.  The sides we had were basic Garlic mash and asparagus.  I informed the waiter about my lobster and he gave us the butter cake on the house.  I thought that was nice.  But then again heard that it was amazing and I didn't think so and happy we didn't have to pay for that.  Our server was nice enough but nothing special.  Guess my expectations were to high.

What's not to love? We dined here for Valentines Day and it was lovely. Wonderful service, extensive wine list and stiff drinks as my husband put it. I had the Chilean sea bass and my husband the ribeye. What I love is they offer 4 ways to prepare your fish which gives you more options when choosing a lighter dish. We spilt the enormous sides and didn't have any room left for desert (next time). We'll definitely be back.

Visited this superb restaurant on Sunday.  Hostess & Wait staff were terrific.  The menu is a little bit overwhelming, but my friend highly recommended the bone in Filet.  SO I think more than half or our party of 10 did just that.  Also, the sides are served family style.  We had several different sides & all were delicious.

Just to let you know about the service.  I ordered the bone in filet medium and when I received it, it was bordering on well done.  When the waiter came back to the table (within a couple of minutes), he noticed that I was not eating and asked if there was a problem. I informed him that the filet was overcooked for my taste and he immediately picked it up and said he would bring out a 18 ounce (I had a 12 oz).  I told him that he did not need to do that, but he insisted.  

It did not take long for me to get my filet brought back out and this time it was perfect.  He apologized again.  I didn't think I could eat all of it, but after the first taste, I realized that I was not going to let this go to waste.  

If you go here, I would for sure get a reservation.  Also, be prepared to spend about $60 - $80 per person.  

Side note, one of our friends in the group had a birthday, and he was treated with this delicious chocolate moist cake.  I mean it was terrific.  It came with a big bowl of whipped fresh cream.  

If you are in Vegas, you need to try this place out.  I have eaten many steaks in Vegas, but this one has been the only one that has satisfied me.  

Dress code is business casual, but I am sure if you wanted to walk in with shorts and a t-shirt they will take your money.

I enjoyed this place a lot, I think everything I had here was fantastic
All I can remember was the fantastic beer battered shrimp. 
But I know it's a good find
I haven't been there in about 3 years, I will return

I have been here once, I have not one thing to complain about! The food was delicious, hot, and cooked well. Servers were so friendly, and willing to explain everything on the menu. everything is so over priced, but the atmosphere and amazing, its inside the Aria Hotel, cant complain would go back!

What are people smoking?!?!  4 1/2 stars!  Again, WHAT?!?!  

This place is pretty bad.  From the service to the lackluster food.  

Service wise: condescending and the dude was barely looking at me directly when I was the one addressing him.  I was def chop liver for the evening.  Until I whipped out the camera and then the plastic.  LAME.  

Food: Check the photos.  
-The Spicy Caesar looked like a free side of salad from IHOP.  'Cept it was over $10.  WTF?!?!
-Crabcakes were mushy.  Gotta have the crusty texture.  They were huge.  
-Filet had no crust and again was mushy.  Color was off too, pink on the OUTSIDE.  
-Berry bowl was MASSIVE.  Presentation sloppy just like the rest of the meal.

Great bottle prices for Pinot Noirs.  Oh the manager called me personally to thank me for my patronage the day after.  YAY.  I really don't get how this chain survives and where all the hype stems from.

I know many other restos my $250 could have been spent better.

OpenTable Bonus Point table currently.  Hooray for 1,000 pts!!!

Very few restaurants I've ever eaten in has ever left me walking away so satisfied feeling that they couldn't possibly top themselves... except Mastro's. From being ushered into the beautifully unique wooden architecture aka the "Treehouse" that housed the restaurant, to the exceptional service and, being, overall, treated like royalty, my party of three had pretty much felt that we had eaten at the best restaurant in Las Vegas. 

Nestled aesthetically inside the Crystals at the City Center besides Aria Hotel, Mastro's was incorporated within the shopping center, in the midst of luxury brand names: Vuitton, Zegna, Cartier, et al. The most striking feature of the restaurant was how the interior of the restaurant is actually built into a structure that resembled a treehouse skeleton, with no solid walls in the main dining room. This monstrosity emerged from the ground floor and grew at least eight stories into the air and eventually flowing symbolically into the ceiling. 

The dining experience was superb. Highly attentive, the staff reminded me of 3-Michelin star restaurants but at much lower prices and with sense of humor that made it fun and even more memorable. The maitre d', well-dressed in a fine suit, was always attentive over the entire dining space like a hawk and was quick to address diners' requests. Our waiter was especially quirky and cracked a few tongue-in-cheek jokes that were appropriate for our young, lively group.

As for the quality, it was on par with most upscale restaurants. Steaks were delivered in juicy perfection. The incorporation of seafood into potato dishes were noteworthy, especially the crab gnocchi and lobster mac and cheese. There wasn't anything else the chef could've done to improve these dishes.

These were the items selected by our table:

Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi ***
Roasted Brussels Sprouts **
Lobster Mashed Potatoes ***
Bone-In Filet ***12oz
Filet ***12oz
Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese ***
Clam Chowder **

*   don't bother
**  average/good enough
*** exceptional

Not realizing that we had ordered more than enough food for our small party, we opted to take the rest home, which the waitstaff briskly took care of and within minutes, returned with all of the food packaged in their own individual black to-go boxes with the Mastro's sticker label affixed to the top and neatly arranged in a shopping bag. 

Bathrooms were supplied with an assortment of items found in medicine cabinets had personal effects like Tums, men's cologne and mouthwash and someone to hand you a paper towel to dry your hands with. Again, Michelin-star quality without the Michelin-star price. 

Best $350 spent in Vegas. Worthwhile for a beautiful night out to impress your significant other, client or, perhaps, to just have the best fine dining experience in Sin City.

Who wouldn't love a restaurant that's positioned right next to Tiffany's??  Seriously.......

I went for a company dinner so cannot attest to the price (although based on other Yelpers, the cost is quite steep!)  Started with a lovely bread basket with a wide variety of different breads, including "pretzel bread" which is quite similar to Joe's Stone Crab bread.  The bruschetta appetizer came next which was VERY oniony, but it's a good thing I'm a big fan of onions because I absolutely loved it.  Caesar salad was just so-so.

Then the main course....I got the mahi mahi in this fancy butter sauce which was excellent, but not as good as my husband's salmon (I almost stole his plate it WAS THAT GOOD).  The fish portions were very large and filling.  Sides for the table included creamy mashed potatoes and creamed spinach.  The spinach was a little salty for my taste, but not grainy at all.

Dessert was cheesecake with whipped cream and berries which was creamy and decadent...A+ even though I was completely full I ate the whole thing.

Would I return to Mastros?  Absolutely.  Wonderful ambience and GREAT salmon.....after all it is an "ocean club" so the fish has to be good right?  Cheers!

One of the many indulgences of La Vegas. Mastro's is a well known stop for those looking to treat themselves. 
Food: We went as a group of 7 girls and all got steak with a variety of shared sides. I split a 16oz filet made medium (almost half the price it would cost to get an 8 oz filet on your own). It was everything I expected from a good steakhouse, well seasoned, tender, and perfectly cooked. Its only dressing was a melting slice of butter on the top. The sides were all generally well made. The lobster mashed potatoes had real chunks of lobster it in, though, between the 7 of us, not everyone got a piece. The brussel sprouts and asparagus were cooked to just the right texture but there was nothing really special about them. The creamed corn was sweet and luxuriously smooth but needed a little more savory to balance it out. 
Service: The service was excellent. The server was very accommodating and attentive. A few of us ordered steaks to split and they plated them separately for us. We also brought in our own cake since we were celebrating a birthday. They served the caked and repacked the leftover cake for us to go. 
Locations: Mastro's unique architecture has made it a near icon among the casinos on the strip. Floating in the middle of Crystals, it makes up a beautiful view and provides one. The decor is subdued in an elegant way and it generally draws a quieter crowd.    
While Mastro's wasn't a life changing dining experience, between the high class menu and eye catching locale, it certainly did not disappoint.

I'm not sure where their high ratings come from. At the price they sell main courses ($35-$60) which includes no sides at all but just a piece of fish or meat is ridiculous as even then it's just a piece of meat - no interesting garnish or sauce even on the plate. 

The quality of the fish was ok but we too don't live on the coast and the fish at our local Whole Foods is as good or better than here. Also their beef was just that - ok but I know our local store sells as high of quality. 

Was pissed that this place charged $20 for an heirloom tomato salad and served it with the tomatoes cold as if straight from a fridge. Who the hell does that? The tomatoes should be stored at room temperature anyway and I certainly don't want a cold tomato salad. Weak and almost embarrassing for the restaurant. 

The vegetable sides are about as generic as you can get and available almost anywhere. Brussels sprouts, green beans, garlic mashed potatoes -  not interesting nor were they very good. 

Not sure if their high ratings come from people that live way outside a major city or maybe in live the middle of the country where chain restaurants are the only option but this place was downright shameful for the price and for the generic food preparation. Almost like they have no head chef running things but just an expediter slinging out the same old stuff every day and never thinking to change or improve things. 

Bill was around $120/person. No problem if it was an amazing meal (or even above average) but again I could've cooked it better at home for 1/3 the price. 

I guess this restaurant will keep cashing in on people don't who know any better or want the most simple uninspiring food on the planet.

What drew me here was the treehouse! I've never dined in one in the middle of a mall so we figured why not? I like to people watch too. We went here a couple months ago so my complete recollection is foggy. The features that stick out are the ambiance really. The food was good but nothing that made me say wow, i need to come back and eat this again. I had the miso cod and escargot.  Both good but not memorable. What was memorable was the ambiance. It was romantic yet there were large groups around that worked well too. There was a piano man right next to the bar area that took requests all night. We even stayed and hung out bar side because he was so good! When dining make sure to request to sit IN the treehouse, if not there's not too much of a wow factor in your experience.

Best service and amazing food. My husband and I came for our anniversary and had a great time with good drinks and food. My sea bass pan seared was cooked to perfection. My husband had the bone in filet which was not only cooked perfect but the flavor  was fantastic. Simple yet flavorful and then the sides just amazing. The Mac and cheese could be a meal in itself with how cheesy and delicious it was. The garlic mash so creamy and almost melted in your mouth. Last but not least their signature desert, butter cake. To die for. Came with home made whipped cream and vanilla ice cream.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

Had one last opportunity in Vegas to try out a highly rated restaurant and left very disappointed that it was wasted here.  The warm spinach salad was drenched in sauce and the ahi tuna tostada appetizer didn't taste very fresh.  The entrees do not come with anything else...no side pasta, potatoes, or salad.  So, if you order a bland grilled dried swordfish, that's it, that is all you get for $40 on a large plate.  Presentation in the food was not there for a so-called high-end restaurant.  The blackened scallop was so salty that it was difficult to eat it.  We celebrated our birthdays there and got a very dried complimentary chocolate cake.  We did order their signature butter cake also, and that was decent.  But, for $16, we have definitely tasted much better for less.  Overall, the ambience is nice.  Service was nothing to rave about, and food was very average.  Cost didn't match the overall underwhelmed experience.  If you are willing to spend, go somewhere else.

Mastro's Ocean Club located in Crystals at CityCenter is absolutely the best place restaurant with the best service on the latest Vegas business trip. In fact, I was more impressed with the non-swanky mall location than its Orange County siblings.

The Mall is incredibly quiet and the piano acoustics are phenomenal, making dinner at the bar or at a quiet table a very nice experience. Victor is a great bartender and the service is wonderful. As with all Mastro's, the wine list is incredible and goes on and on. Tonight was a Darioush Cabernet starter night as I pondered this wonderful menu, trying to stay light and healthy, amongst some decadent alternatives. 

Eventually, I decided on a starter of Jalapeno Tuna Sashimi which is ahi tuna
sliced sashimi style, topped with fresh squeezed key lime juice, thinly sliced jalapenos, and ponzu chili sauce. This is light despite looking like a lot of chili sauce. 

Next, a salad of beefsteak tomato and onion with balsamic was a refreshing without being super oldtime steakhouse heavy! 

For an entree, I ordered another small plate: The lobster cocktail which is 1.25 pounds (including shells). Now after eating all of this, I have slowed down and am just enjoying my wine when a couple of friends show up and we decide to end the evening with the crab claws which are excellent.

What an incredible meal, great services, great music and very relaxing.

This place is phenomenal.

Breathtaking when you walk in... just like then 1st time i walked in to XS the nightclub. Absolutely breathtaking.

I had the bone in filet mignon. It was cooked perfectly!!! but honestly it really needs sauce. not the type of steak you can eat by itself. maybe next time ill try ribeye. But with sauce its good.

SEAFOOD TOWER WAS INCREDIBLE!!!! Lobster Cocktail & Oysters were great. They use blue point oysters.

Lobster Mash was good.

For Dessert, the CHOCOLATE PUDDING CAKE WAS THE BEST!!!! Very similar to a Chocolate Lava Cake. Outstanding.

I love this place. Its so beautiful and it really represents living the good life!!! 

Service is great. They have like 5 people waiting on your table, bread person, server, drink person. everything. Great great service.

Seating was quick. Probably because City Center is new. I am enjoying it though & i am not looking forward to when this place gets packed. LOVE IT!!! GOTTA TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE EXCLUSIVITY WHILE IT LASTS!!!!!!!!!!!!

I love love love the Chilean Sea Bass at Mastro's! Delicious! Mastro's maes my top 5 favorite restaurants list for sure!

Service was excellent. Entertainment (guy on the keyboard & a singer) at the bar was a nice touch, but we were right next to them, and it was a bit too loud. Sittng further away woulda been better, but it was okay.

Complimentary bread & butter: yummy! Boyfriend loved the pretzel bread.

Crab CakeS: yes, they give you 2 crab cakes. Lol! Hate when resataurants only give you 1 and charge you an arm and a leg. This is not the case here. They were big, chunky and delicious! Great for sharing with 4 people.

CHILEAN SEA BASS: really...need I say more? Like butter!

Petite Fillet: melt in your mouth good!

Warm butter cake served with ice cream and whipped cream: another must.

Was here exactly one week ago with a group- about 10 of us, girls and guys (what was left over from a combined bachelor/bachelorette weekend). My husband and I are from Chicago and the Mastros here is my FAVORITE restaurant in the world (see review)- so I came to this one with really high expectations. First off our server, Tim, was phenomenal! So friendly, quick, and informative with every question we had. Next was the food, which was just as I expected- amazing. Husband had the bone in filet, and I did the halibut. Both delicious! I tried my girlfriends sea bass and that was awesome too. We all split a ton of apps and sides, and finished off with butter cakes for the table. Food coma heaven! 
The only thing lacking was the atmosphere. (Why I knocked off 1 star) we were expecting a loud, energetic "Vegas" style restaurant (much like the one back home here in Chicago) But it was very quiet, bright, and just low energy. More suitable for a quiet dinner with your significant other, not a crazy group of 8 guys and 2 girls lol. But hey maybe that's the feel this Mastros is going for, which I can totally appreciate.
The meal I had was pretty good but it definitely wasn't mind blowing. I had the Pacific Swordfish cook perfectly but the taste wasn't making my tastebuds swoon.

The lobster mashed potatoes is absolutely delish!  We came here on a Wednesday night and there was live music which was pretty cool.  We ordered Kumomoto oysters and the scallops for appetizers and share the bone-in filet and the mashed potatoes.  Everything was delish and our server was super attentive.  Will definitely go back.

Mastro's had the blessing and the curse of being my second "fine dining" experience.

I appreciated the tap water so much more since I had been charged for a super-bougie bottle at Gordon Ramsay Steak.

The attentiveness of our waitress was exceptional. During the dinner rush, our meals got lost in the shuffle and when she realized we were still not served (bout an hour in), she made sure we wouldn't wait much longer. Our food was out  of the kitchen quite quick.

I started with the lobster bisque and it was incredible. Best lobster bisque I've ever had, hands down.

The steaks were very good. I'd say that they are much better than 95% of the steaks I've ever had.

I was divided on the sides. The sautéed broccoli was nothing special. It did a very good job of tasting like broccoli. However, the gnocchi was incredible. I could eat it all day, every day.

My sugar loving girlfriend was in love with the butter cake. It really was delicious, and that comes from someone who isn't into really into desserts.

Overall, not a bad experience. I'll definitely be up for a return.

My wife and I live in Summerlin, and enjoy all the amazing dining that it has to offer. What people who visit Vegas don't know is, our little West Side has eats as good as anything you will find on the World Famous Las Vegas Strip.

However, for special occasions, we still venture down to the zoo.

On this occasion, for our 9th anniversary we settled on Mastro's after hearing nothing but amazing things. Welp. In fact they are all true. We were absolutely blown away by the quality of the food product, and the attention to detail.

Yes. It was an expensive dinner. But man, does this staff and Chef crew nail it. From the soft breads offered, to the Caesar salad, to the lobster mashed potatoes. Yes. Lobster.

The star of the evening beyond the waitstaff who I can't say enough about, was the medium rare Rib-eye with truffle butter cooked to literal perfection. I have eaten many steaks, all over the world. This was simply one of the finest I have ever had the pleasure of tasting.

Well done Mastro's. Well done.

Wow, I've been to many steak restaurants but this one really takes the cake. We were a group of 7.
The intimate setting and fancy atmosphere made me expect a very large bill but the prices are very reasonable for the amount of luxury, excellent service, food quality, and professionalism.

Piotr was our waiter but it felt like the entire restaurant's staff was at our finger tips. We never felt like we needed to wait and it really felt like we were special guests at this establishment. I would highly recommend this place no matter your group size! I felt like they could handle anything we threw at them.

The food was amazing and all the meats just melted as we ate them. The portion sizes available were very appreciated since the group had various (stomach) sized people. Cooked to culinary perfection, we had a meal to remember for the rest of our lives.

Thank you so much.

Everything is always done perfect at Maestro's. The food, wine selection and a dessert with its own twitter site.
The only weird thing about this one is it's in the middle of a mall with very expensive stores. Steak place in the mall....hmmmm
Other than that, they are always spot-on with the best food and service.
If you never have been to one, you can't truly say you are a foodie. 
Warm butter cake!!!

Make no mistake, This place is AWESOME.  The service was excellent, the menu has lots of unique offerings (The lobster mashed potatoes are unreal).  Everything was flavorful and prepared perfectly.  I had a bone-in Ribeye.  It was seasoned well and cooked to perfection.  It was not the best steak I have ever eaten, but it was up there.  The drinks are aggressively poured (for what they cost, they certainly should be). Dessert was equally impressive and the attentiveness of the wait staff was some of the best I have ever seen.  The dining experience as a whole was in my top 5.  I very strongly recommend this place if you are seeking a top notch dinner in las vegas.  That said, be forewarned that it is also in the top 3 most expensive dinners I have ever had.  The entrees are not really that exorbitant, but when you tie in a side like lobster mashed potatoes for $40 and multiple alcoholic beverages, it gets expensive in a hurry.  Although expensive, the entire experience makes it worth every penny.

We stopped in on a Sunday early evening just for their warm butter cake. It was a meal for two by itself. Tasty and of course buttery smooth with a slightly crunchy/crispy crust. The bowl of whip cream on the side was massive and well appreciated. Overall a good dessert but not great. The Caramel Bundino from DOCG and the Toffee Pudding at Gordon Ramsay steak easily demolish this offering however. Nice service and vibe though.

I searched, for the perfect Vegas restaurant, for our anniversary dinner, by checking the internet, asking friends, and tallying #YELP, Open Table, and Trip Advisor scored. I started with a long list and ended up, with Mastro's. And, it was the perfect setting, to celebrate our anniversary. 
We travelled all morning. Checked in our hotel and walked all over the strip, during the day. So, we were a little tired, by dinner, but were up, for celebrating, with delicious food and wine.  
We had a table, in the "treehouse".
We ordered a bottle of The Prisoner wine, because we were splurging. It was delicious, and went well with our meal.
The bread basket they brought out was this bread lovers dream; huge, wide assortment of yummy goodness, with butter. 
We had the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were very large, and scrumptious, with not much filling, just lots of crabmeat. 
The Lobster Bisque was very nice. 
We shared Blackened Scotch Salmon, which was delicious, but thankfully, not huge, cut in half. The lobster Mac 'n Cheese side is sinful. 
They brought us a complimentary dessert, for our anniversary. We were able to squeeze in a few bites. 
The service was as you would expect, in a higher end, very nice restaurant. Our waiter and all the staff were courteous and helpful. 
Without the $100 bottle of wine, the meal was still pricey, but it was worth it. This is a great place to celebrate something/anything!

Mastro's is amazing. I had the best steak here (even though this restaurant heavily features seafood). We had an early reservation because we had an 8:30 show to go to. We were seated immediately and i think they gave us white or black napkins, which they placed across our laps for us, based on what color we were wearing. And that was just a hint of the level of service to come. We had a very attentive server, but someone in a suit, his supervisor (?) was also constantly checking on us. My water glass was never empty, a standard I use to base a restaurant's level of service. I had gotten up once to use the restroom and accidentally dropped my napkin. As I was leaning over to pick it up, our server appeared out of nowhere and immediately insisted that he would do it. When i came back a fresh napkin was folded at my seat. When the sides came, someone immediately offered to serve them to us. I was surprised no one offered to cut my steak...lol. The restaurant quickly filled up, but from the time that we were seated until we left, never once did the superb service lapse.

Ok onto the food: There were a few different types of bread and i think I like most of them. They refilled our bread basket, but I wish they didn't lol because I ate way too much bread. I ordered a berry flavored cocktail and it came in a martini glass, but they also set down a shaker cup by my glass, and to my delight, there was enough to fill my glass a second time! =D We ordered the steamed mussels appetizer and they were delicious, so fresh, not fishy at all. Just delicious. I could have inhaled an entire order myself. Everyone ordered the ribeye and it was perfect. So, so good. We were trying to be kinda healthy so we got sauteed mushrooms and spinach and creamed corn as sides. But afterwards I wish we had gotten the mac & cheese and the truffle gnocchi. Everything was so delicious and the portions were pretty big. I ate about a third of my ribeye and we didn't even finish all of the sides. Luckily our hotel room had a fridge so we could take the leftovers. 

It was definitely pricey, but for the amazing service and food, I think it was well worth it. I would definitely go back or at least go to one of the SoCal locations. Mastro's is the standard by which I compare all steakhouses and other fine dining establishments to.

this mastros was awesome!  it does feel like you're in a treehouse :)
ok, let's start with the bread basket...forget the other breads, go straight for the pretzel one that is fresh out of the oven still hot and steamy
this party of six had the chilean sea bass, petit filet, ribeye, bone in filet which was all amazing! except for one that didnt really eat the bone in filet - it looked a little dry for medium (maybe he should have ordered medium rare)
for the sides, we had the lobster mashed potato which had big chunks of lobster on top
the sweet potato fries were soooo good and still a little al dente which was nice
the gongonzola mac n cheese was really cheesy and good!
sauteed spinach was garlicky
and of course you can't leave mastros without having the BUTTER CAKE!!!
service was top notch as always

Great place and location in the upscale Crystal mall.  The service was great and matched what you would expect in a high end restaurant.  The food was good but not great blow your sox off.  We had crab legs (a little dry) and halibut also overcooked and dry.  Both had an ok taste however.  The tuna jalapeno appetizer was quite tasty and the serving size was nice too.  It was a great experience but I am not sure the meal matched the price.

! I've been here a number of times, and to the sister restaurants in Phoenix and have yet to be disappointed. 

Go ahead and order yourself the Butter Cake... Also give the Hennessey Sidecar and the Roasted Brussels Sprouts a try!

We were celebrating my wife's's bday, service was outstanding, we were in a bit of a rush to catch a show, and they were very accommodating. The scallops were out of this world and the ribeye was worth every penny. Only regret is not having more time to enjoy the moment.

Girlfriend and I celebrated our 3 year anniversary we each got a filet mignon steak which was great along with the lobster mashed potatoes, but bad thing was there were some lobster shells that I bit into.  Waiter was quite nice to comp us with a free butter cake desert which was delicious!

Thank you so much for an unbelievable dinner. This place really stands out in terms of food service. You guys rock thank you! 

Had dinner at del friscos the night before and it sucked.
Better food than most upscale restaurants, good service weird location and set up. I prefer to go to the Mastro's in L.A.
Best dinner ever!  Amazing food. Great service and they brought me out a piece of cake for my birthday. Will definitely be back!

Came by for dinner the other night and the experience left a lot to be desired. Made a group reservation and surprisingly, we were given a slew of small tables...

The restaurant has a unique venue but it was both loud and hot...in the middle of December...when it's 45F outside...

Started off with the bread and it was mediocre. Too hard and salty.

Moved on to the mixed greens salad and the vegetables weren't too fresh and the salad and plate both had some fridge taste...

Moved on to the Lobster Roll and again, it was pre-made, wasn't fresh, and had too much rice.

The seared ahi tuna came out really dark...didn't seem fresh.

My 8 oz Petite Filet was requested medium rare and came out as such. The meat had a strong flavor and was slightly salty...nothing spectacular here.

The sauteed mushrooms, creamed corn, and garlic mashed potatoes were all mediocre.

Service was okay. The wait staff slammed the dishes on the table and quickly split our side dishes...it was pretty rushed.

...the tap water had a strong chlorine smell...gross.

An exceptional dining experience from start to finish.  

Service = exceptional

Food = exceptional, executed well

Ambiance = Classy - but for people who come in and shorts and flip flops

I highly suggest the filet mignon.  As a meat lover, I ended up choosing the 12oz versus the 9oz.  In retrospect, I should have gone with the 9oz.  Nonetheless, it was a perfectly cooked medium steak.  I started off with a caesar salad, which was a bit salty.
The most amazing meal and because of Paul our waiter, it made it even better. Very fresh, delicious cuisine and excellent service.   Love this place and always looking forward to returning.

Came here 4th time, I didn't realized first two times, but third was very impressive so I came back again and was same experience.

Food? yes it was very good. 
Service? amaging! best service I ever experience in same class of restaurant.

Okay so last night I went on a date the place was nice service was good but 1 would not give 5 stars 4 okay we ask Sautee shrimp for an appetizer Delicious flavor was good shrimp were HUGE great then we ordered our ceasar salad not the best it had some kind of bad flavor to it.. Like seafoodish  and i must of ordered just the wrong meals because it was okay but NOT 5 stars

We went here for our annual Christmas Eve dinner out and experienced lovely service. The Arctic Char was wonderful but the Red Snapper was seared and dried out. No sauce and over cooked which made a bland meal. The butter cake was a rich delicious dessert and I'd definitely eat the cake and Arctic Char repeatedly. The worst part was that my husband (consumed the snapper) got food poisoning afterward. We ate all the same things and the only meal we didn't share was our entrees. Christmas Day was pretty miserable for him and I'm disappointed that we will not visit Mastro's again because the service and parts of the meal were great but to serve food that is not fresh is terrible.

The food, the service and the atmosphere were incredible. I've been coming to Mastro's since they opened and have never been disappointed. Their drinks are beyond incredible, and although they are expensive they come out in a shaker so you get a drink and a half or two drinks out of each order. 

Everything I've ever ordered has been fantastic, starting with the breadbasket that is brought out. Make sure you leave room for dessert because their butter cake is the most amazing dessert I've ever had!

I wish I can give them more than five stars!

This review is for the warm butter cake!!!

A friend of mine found out I was in Vegas for my birthday and all he said was make sure you go to Mastro's Ocean Club for the warm butter cake. I was like ok...I'll try it.  He was like no, you better try it.

So, I was on a hunt to try this warm butter cake.  To my surprise, my hotel is literally across the street from the place. 

We get to the place at 11:30pm and the hostess tells us we're closed and we're bummed.  Bummed because we're scheduled to leave tomorrow and wouldn't have the chance to try it.  We begged to just sit at the bar and see if they would let us order dessert. She said sure...YAY :)

Got to the bar, looked at the menu and the bartender said you have to try our signature dessert dish and we said ok but we're here for one thing and he said the warm butter cake and we were like YES!!!!!

When it came out it was sooo beautiful.  To cute to cut!!! The cuteness didn't last long.  We took our first bite and OMG...decadence!!!! It was mouth watering. It was fabulous. It was soooooooo sweet and so good.  i could feel my sugar levels going up but I didn't care :)

Gotta try it!!!

This restaurant needs 10 stars in service, ambiance and of course the food. This was my favorite dinner while in LV,  and Trista our waitress made the night even better! We had the hamachi with truffles, the bone marrow. For dinner we had the Chilean sea bass blackened. Now, the Item of the night for me was the lobster mashed potatoes!!! I would have a bowl of that daily if I could! The dessert was a representation of the perfect creme brûlée, seriously delicious! Overall, it was our best dinner in Vegas!

Mastro's Ocean Club is smack dab in the middle of the Aria City Center mall. Because of  this, the ambiance and setting is not as upscale as the one in Beverly Hills. This place has more of a casual setting to it but most people will dress in their casual Friday attire.

The food was great.. very similar to the food at Beverly Hill location but because of the Ocean Club name, they have more fresh seafood at this location.. I still think that Mastro's excels in steak so unless you don't eat beef, why would you order anything else?

Also, I recommend that you make reservations to this place. When I went, they were not busy (they had like 6 parties dining), they insisted that they were. Make sure you specifically ask to dine in the Treehouse. This is the middle part of the restaurant that overlooks the mall. Anywhere else, and you end up close to the piano, and the piano's volume can get overwhelming.

All in all, Mastro's in Vegas is a good steakhouse. But because of it's prices, I expected it to be a little more on the personal and upscale level. but the fact that it's in the mall makes it seem like they are a more casual restaurant with high prices. I personally prefer the Mastro's in Beverly Hills. If you are a local to Vegas, definitely give this place a try. All of you that did the 4 hour commute to Vegas, drive back and go to the one on Canan in the 90210.

This restaurant has to be my favorite! My partner and I ordered the scallops as an appetizer which were done to perfection in such a flavorful and savory sauce! We also ordered the muscles but weren't too impressed with those, not enough flavor. For our entrees we ordered the 18oz bone in filet to split and oh my goodness it was the best steak I've ever had!! So tasteful and tender! We also split the two 8oz lobster tails which were to die for! Dipped in butter it was seafood heaven. For dessert we chose the butter cake and it did not disappoint! With the ice cream on top it was the ultimate ending to the dinner. Our waitress Sam was very friendly and offered great suggestions for our meal! Definitely returning!

We've been to the maestros in Newport beach and Beverly hills a few times each. They are both better than the one next to aria that we ate at tonight. The bread was delicious, the crab appetizer was also fantastic. We got the escargot and it was actually terrible. It wasn't hot and the snails didn't taste good at all. I was very disappointed, because usually its one of my favorite things to order at other fine dining restaurants. My husband ordered lamb chops and they were very good. I got the prawn special. Each prawn was 8oz. Don't order this dish. Prawns aren't suppose to be that big. They tasted like bottom feeders. 

Our friends got the filet and the tuna, both were very good. 

Service was good.  Dessert was good. They brought us the butter cake for our anniversary. It was delicious. 

Overall it was good and management was great!!!!

I spend the majority of the month in Vegas. There are some good spots to dine at, but none compare to Mastro's. It's beautiful decor, great staff, timeless menu, and perfect good keep me coming back. The sea food tower not only has a wonderful presentation, but it is some of the freshest seafood I have found in the west. The steaks are superb and will not disappoint.
