When I first arrived, I was greeted by the front, she showed me to my table.  while walking towards our table, i was greeted again by another waitress passing by us.  when i arrived at the table, the front service didn't even bother to pull the chair for me.  The restaurant had unique architecture design. I looked around our table and noticed there were a lot of ... gold diggers in the restaurant. Lol table next to me were party of two females, they were trying to hit on "johnny depp" look a like singer/musican at the restaurant.

I ordered bone-in ribeye, sweet potato fries, and calamari for appetite. Few minutes later, our waiter brought 4 different types of cold bread. Petzel, fried, chatula, and other bread I can't remember. I wished the bread was warm it would have been better.  Finally after waiting 10 minutes, our calamari came out.. damn it was salty.. I couldn't finish the calamari, it tasted straight out of ocean.. my steak came out sizzling on hot plate and sweet potato fries were in big basket enough to feed party of 4.  First bite of fries were... f&ck its salty..  now on to the steak... omg the chef has lost his tongue... its also super salty...  and outside was a little overcooked, it had the crispy burned taste.  well ..that's end of my story.. the food was soo salty, I gave up trying to finish $100 meal.. chef probably thought that i was exposed to japanese nuclear radiation and i needed extra iodine in my thyroid. the waiter couldn't keep up refilling my water.. i ended up drinking total of 4 cups of water. my worst preminium steak house experience.

We made reservations for 7:30 pm for a return visit for our annual visit Vegas.  Last year our service was so over the top, the food so good, and the unique ambiance made it a great meal. 

It was still a great, er good meal. We arrived at 7:20 for our party of seven reservations. Both cabs got lost. 

We were seated at 8:30. The management seemed unable to deal with people camping at the table. We suggested they offer to buy them a drink at the bar l get them off their butts and get out!!  Once we were seated, we had the wonderful seafood tower. Our wait staff was good, not great (like last year). Examples is very pedestrian descriptions of the specials or main dishes. Our waiter went through the list rote. Our meals were deliverd together, but several times we had to ask for water, the bus staff made comments and interrupted conversations with their removal of plates. I think bus boys should not participate in table conversation, unless asked. 

My bone-in strip steak, ordered charred medium rare was neither, and NOBODY askede if I was satisfied with the steak, which surprised me.  My steak wasn't charred and it was rare.  I know, some people say medium rare and really want medium. I know the difference. I like 120 to 130 degrees max. My steak was rare or actually cool and uncooked in the middle. I'm in the food business and actually run a meat wholesaler. My steak was just so-so, it had some tough parts and the undercooked aspect make me leave at least 30% of the meat on the plate. 

The gnocchi and the lobster potatoes are worth the trip. 

I'm not sure how to avoid the hour wait for a table, but it was frustrating. 

Last year it was a 5 star meal, but due to average service, the long wait, my steak being undercooked and average quality, it was a 3 star night, and it was over $1,000.  Ouch.

Mastro's does hospitality right - I've been to their location in PHX as well and it seems that service training is very important to this group.

We went here just for dessert (Boss Man is a butter cake fiend) and sat in the bar area, but our service was as good as if we were ordering full dinners & bottles of expensive wine.

Don't take me to mean that anything here is cheap - that butter cake is going to be $16 but it's an absolutely enormous cake (like 6" round) and served with a literal bucket of Chantilly cream. It's easily enough for 4-5 people or one person who's been jonesing for this cake. 

Their wine list is well chosen and a pretty good value as well, all things considered. I had a French Cremant & for $10 it was an extremely generous pour.

I'm no stranger to Mastro's.  I have spent many a special occasion at the one in Costa Mesa.  This is now my local Mastro's for the time being, so my boyfriend and I decided to have a nice Valentine's Day dinner at Crystals.

All-in-all, as with the other Mastro's, the food and service are top-notch.  Our waiter was attentive, friendly, and patient; other waiters provided the same level of attention to us even though they weren't assigned to our table.  Like always, we shared a 22oz ribeye, and a side order of Alaskan king crab gnocchi with black truffle.  We grabbed a second order to-go because we love that dish that much.  For Valentine's Day, we also got a complimentary order of Mastro's signature warm butter cake, which is incredibly sweet and rich.  Love it.

My only complaint is the atmosphere of this location.  The main dining room is located in an open-air treehouse structure inside the Crystals mall.  Although for Valentine's Day we were seated in one of the private dining rooms upstairs, I would imagine the atmosphere between the two is similar.  I dig the dimly lit, quiet, romantic ambience of the Costa Mesa steakhouse.  Since this location is in a mall and (mostly) open-air, you get ... a mall atmosphere.  Which is okay, but not optimal.  There also seemed to be a lot of very loud, drunk people at the restaurant, but I figure they're everywhere on the strip on a Friday night.
OMG delish! Gorgeous atmosphere, incredible service and from the shellfish platter to spicy Caesar salad to perfection steak we were very pleased with the whole experience! Happy Anniversary to us!

This restaurant has become one of my all-time favorites! I've eaten here multiple times over the past 3 years, and that's says a great deal because the Strip has so many fine dining options. I've actually had the same waiter, Mike, a couple of times. His knowledge of the menu, and service to our table couldn't have been better. 

My favorite entree is the Fillet of Arctic Char Oreganata style. This is a flavorful fish like sockeye salmon or snapper, not bland or mild like grouper or cod. The portions are large at Mastro's, both the entrees and the sides, and this dish is no exception. They serve 2 fillets of fish. There must be 12 to 14oz of fish on the plate. I've ordered steak here once as well, an 8oz petite filet. Is was excellent, cooked perfectly, as one would expect at a high-end restaurant. 

For desert, I recommend sharing the Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake. It has an amazing smooth and warm buttery taste that intensifies as you near the cake's center. 

Lastly, with regard to the dining experience, the restaurant is located in the Crystals Mall, however, there is no "mall-feel" to the experience whatsoever. The wooden "tree house" dining area is an impressive sight to see, and a truly unique and beautiful open-air room to dine in.

Came here for a business meeting and my boss told me to try their martinis. 
I am not, what-so-ever, a martini drinker but, I cannot rave enough about their Dragonberry martini.

Off the bat, I was thrown off by the jalapeno in the drink but, I think that's what made the drink different, special, and delicious for me.
It had that extra kick with alllllll that alcohol.

I had made reservations here for my wife's birthday and when we got there the place was crowded.  The hostesses explained the wait, and offered for us to have a drink in the lounge until our table was ready.  They kept checking in on us until we were ready to be seated.  

We started with two cups of coffee and the Dungeness Crab Cocktail.  The crab came out on a cup of dry ice that was smoking and was a very good presentation, as well as being extremely tasty.

For dinner my wife had the 8oz. Petite Filet and I had the Chilean Sea Bass.  The waiter, Piotr, explained that the sides are served family style and that we should share a couple.  We chose the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and the Steamed Broccoli.  My wife, when asked how she wanted her meat cooked, asked for it to be medium, Piotr explained that medium would still have some pink in the center, and sensing the way that she likes hers cooked, recommended medium plus.  When it came out it was cooked perfectly, and was the most tender steak that she has ever had.  My Sea Bass was cooked so it had a nice, crispy shell of the outside, but was milky and soft on the inside.  The Lobster Mashed Potatoes has spoiled me, now I find it hard to not expect that kind of perfection from all other potatoes.

After dinner they brought out a complimentary Chocolate Sin Cake for us to share with a birthday message written in sauce on the plate.  

Overall, this was an amazing meal at an amazing restaurant, and I would highly recommend this to anyone.  The prices are high, but you will get what you pay for.  My only regret is not being able to try the Warm Butter Cake everyone raves about, but I guess that means I have to go here again next time.

My boyfriend and I came here to have a celebratory dinner. There was a bit of a mix up with our reservations (I used open table) but they were still able to accomodate us.

Mastro's is located inside the Shops at Crystals on the second floor. My boyfriend loved his Hennessy sidecar cocktail and always talks about going back just for drinks and to try their dessert.

We decided to skip appetizers and just go straight into the main course. We got the 22 ounce bone-in ribeye, the ahi tuna sashimi, lobster mashed potatoes, and sauteed broccoli. Since we were sharing, they offered to plate and serve everything for us. We ordered with the intention that the tuna would be for me, and the steak would be for him but by the end of the meal, I enjoyed the steak so much I ended up eating most of it. I'm a fan of ribeye steaks because i find them to be more flavorful than filets - and the steak here had a nice sear on the outside and perfectly tendor on the inside. The lobster mashed potatoes were yummy but a little bit salty to me (although my boyfriend said it was fine and he loved it). The amount that we ordered was more than enough for two people, we didn't get to dessert because we were so stuffed.

Great place to eat. Great live music. Great food. There twice baked potato was amazing. Little bit pricey but well worth it. If you are not a steak person like me they have other substatutions for seafood chicken and salad. I had the chicken breast something and it was very juicy and tender and spiced seasoning. Was well worth it. Great for anniversary dinners or birthdays. They had a huge selection of desserts at the end of you meal but I would order for 2 the portions on some of the menu can feed about 2-3 people. The service was great as well.

I love Mastro's the food here is FANTASTIC and the the atmosphere is very nice :) I love the vegetables here they are GREAT!!! The service is also very good and the prices may be up there...however its well worth the money :) WONDERFUL place to go for dinner :)

DELICIOUS!! The bread basket was warm and fresh out of the oven. I'm not a huge steak person so I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass. It was cooked perfectly. I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries. The mac & cheese was good and the lobster mashed potato was amazing!!! Not only was the food good but the location and being in a treehouse was fun. Service was top notch and I'll definitely come back for more.

AMAZING as always :)
Came for my Daddy's 60th birthday dinner while in Vegas for the weekend. Mastro's never fails to disappoint. Table for 6 in the treehouse, in the round white booths. Service was excellent like usual. The only thing was that they messed up on the peppercorn on my fiance new york strip. I know it's the ocean club but all the Mastro's are usually consistent. Can't take away a star for that b/c everything else was amazing. The server even brought complimentary THREE DESSERTs for the table for my dad's birthday. Usually they bring the slice of chocolate cake or the butter cake, but they presented a massive plate with those two and eclairs! AMAZING but prob a good 5000 calories. 
Love Mastro's and will def be back to this location next time we're in Vegas. 
Thanks for making my father's dinner a memorable one!

We went with a group of six and sat in the "treehouse". Our service team took very good care of us. We started with generous martinis. The generous side dishes are perfect for sharing. I really enjoyed my seared ahi tuna. The butter cake was a great way for the group to share dessert. The prices were lower than we expected and it was a good evening for our group.

Well we kept hearing about the lobster mash  potatoes so we had to see for ourselves and it was amaze balls the steak was pretty good not as good as Ruth's Chris but good but the dessert was really good the whip creme I could eat all day

It is no secret that I am a huge carnivore. Naturally I constantly get asked what the best steak is. However, one does not simply choose a best steak. True aficionados do not limit themselves to one choice. They are so in love with the subject they want to learn everything about it. So when you ask me for my favorite steak be prepared for a long response. I might ask you what you've liked in the past and what you look for in a steak. There are so many ways to prepare a steak that it can't be drilled down to just one ideal steak. 

With that said, Mastro's did not disappoint. It has made it on to my list of high quality eats.

Went on a Saturday night so it was very busy. However the service kept up with the demand quite well. There is a bar with live piano music where you can wait while they prepare your table.

We ordered the seafood tower with oysters and shrimp. Other available choices were lobster, caviar and crab legs. No complaints here. Just great tasting, fresh food.

I wasn't in the mood to have the meat sweats later so I ordered the modestly sized bone-in filet, medium rare. I judge a steak by how it's cooked more than anything else. I like mine almost rare and it was cooked as requested. Highly recommended. Other steaks at my table were the Tomahawk Wagyu Ribeye and the Ribeye. The steaks are huge so plan accordingly if you want to order sides and dessert, and you should.

As for side dishes we ordered the lobster mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. The mashed potatoes had a whole lobster mixed in it and topped with a sauce flavored with the juices from the lobster. Most creamed spinach I've tried in the past were way too buttery but they nailed it here. More cream than butter so it remained thick and didn't fall apart.

The service was first rate as expected for a joint like this. Our waiter, Craig, was professional and gave us a great tip when we asked if he knew a place to get cigars afterwards. 

To top it off the hostess sent us a butter cake on the housel! I normally don't order dessert but this cake changed my life.

Mastros never disappoints with fabulous food and service. Must haves: martinis, lobster mash potatoes, and the fried shrimp.
We were very impressed with the staff and general manager Luciana. Thanks for the memories! 
The lefties from Texas

Delicious food period. I take all my visitors for a meal here so I can gloat that I have this fantastic place in my town. Lobster and steaks supreme. Just love the food...getting hungry writing this. Go here for sure!

This place is the creme of the creme. Everything we tried on the menu was superb! I highly recommend the Oysters, Chilean Sea Bass & Filet. Everyone in our group of 6 walked away satisfied and very full.

Good seafood, excellent atmosphere is the Crystal Mall next to Aria. Everything is al a carte, the sides are very generous, we over ordered.  The seafood tower is a real show of an appetizer and can be customized to your table.  It's white linen and white coated serving teams, but can be a little slow.  The fish special was excellent, scallops too.   The butter cake for dessert is addictive!
Outstanding! Probably the best seafood restaurant I have ever visited.

Omg. Warm butter cake = better than most anything I can think of, yes including THAT thing! One serving feeds 3-4 easily. The steak was perfect as was the salmon. The twice baked potato was very good. Service like no other. Even an oops was handled with grace and gentle self-deprecating humor that made it charming instead of annoying. I had heard "it's in the middle of a mall" which is technically true, but I found the atmosphere lovely and private, so I would disagree with that criticism. Worth every penny of the splurge.

I fell in love with Mastro's in B.H. about six years ago. So, naturally when asked to make dinner reservations for an important business dinner, I didn't hesitate. 

Everything was wonderful. The ambiance was beautifully unique. The food was as amazing, as i'd always known it to be. 

We had a nice mix of Filet,  Seafood tower, Rib eye, and a delicious butter cake for dessert. 

They also have one of my favorite pinot noirs on their menu. Summerland. And it's not too pricey! 

Love, Love, Love MASTRO'S. And, when it comes to customer service both this one and Bev Hills location have that down pat.

Probably one of the most amazing dinners from start to finish. The food was excellent but what really topped it off was the customer service. I highly recommend having Juan@Tanya as your servers. Those two are top notch. I am very picky on customer service. It seems like a forgotten art these days. They were friendly, never let our glasses empty and even helped with pairing  food. Juan even suggested we remove some items from our order just because it would be too much and we would of been stuffed. So many times these days wait staff don't care what you order or how much. And they expect their 20% regardless. Not these two! We will visit Mastro's again in the future.

If I could, I would give it 3.5 stars. The food varied from excellent to average and while our server was very friendly a salad was forgotten, dishes were not promptly removed, drinks were not refilled promptly, and when alcoholic drinks were completed we were not asked if we would like another. It seems on the night we went the server just did not have the support he needed for this to truly be a fine dining experience nor did the food measure up to a true fine dining experience. We enjoyed the unique design of the restaurant and the atmosphere but will not be putting it on our short list of places to visit.

We came here for our mothers day celebration. My wife liked it the last time we came to lv so we made a reservation to come back.  We are big fans of Maestros in west LA.  We ordered lobster bisque and caesar salad to share for starters.  The lobster bisque was the star of the whole dinner and the ONLY reason for the 3rd star.  It was really really good and to find real lobster in it was great.  The caesar salad was good and the fact that they portioned it out for us was a nice touch. We  two ribeye steaks for mains together with mac and cheese and creamed spinach.  We ordered our two steaks med rare and medium.  The steaks came out med and almost well done.  I had to give half of my steak to my wife since it was her day and she forbade me from complaining to the staff so I'm writing this review.  The creamed spinach was really good and the portions were generous.  The mac and cheese on the other hand was a huge disappointment - completely tasteless and gummy.  Service was good and they really did treat us well.

We came for lunch & service was excellent.

First we ordered the Lobster Bisque, this was not too impressive it had 2 pieces of lobster in it. Then the Fried Calamari came & this plate was plentiful! We were surprised how much they gave us & could not finish it all. For my main dish i ordered Halibut Fish & Chips, this came with 5 small pieces of fish & the fries were too salty. My husband's main dish was Grilled Prime Burger, this burger was huge but again had salty fries.

I went for dinner in 2/15 for anniversary.  Wow this has been the best dinner I have ever had.  Expensive yes.  It's a lot even for Vegas.   It's worth it though for special occasions.  My wife (the boss) still talks about are dinner.

I went there to check out the venue for a private dinner.  The waitress was attentive and cordial.  The manager really turned my head because he called me after the meal with our small party.  What attentiveness!  The seafood tower was great as was the fish.  The steak delish~~~

Score!

This place is a short 5 minute Uber ride from the Venetian. It is actually located in a metropolis that contains a lot of high end stores. Its located on the second floor overlooking the shopping area. Don't let the location fool you this place is absolutely on the money. The food was absolutely delicious. The service was absolutely amazing. Our waitress was one of the best I've had in a while.The customer base is upscale which is what I expected based on the price. I took my wife here for her birthday so it had to be great. We had Belvedere Martini's, Oysters, Chilean Sea bass, and one of the best deserts I've ever had. They had blue cheese stuffed olives for our martini's which is a sign of a true upscale restaurant. We had such a good time we walked back to our hotel suite. Great food, Great service, comfortable atmosphere. I'm not picky I just know what good is.

Flash.......

I was out here celebrating my birthday for the second straight year (yes, it's cliché - I'm perfectly OK with that) with my baby brother. We wanted steak, but didn't necessarily want to spend an arm and a leg. Well, we succeeded at the former, if not the latter, but we left very happy and very, very full.

We settled into the bar and I asked the bartender about the dry-iced martini. It was at that point I discovered the bar was much more about the fufu martinis rather than classic. I'm partial to the classics, so I was a bit disappointed. That said, that's E-Me - I should have checked out the menu in advance, or read a couple more Yelp reviews. (Take note if you're looking for a classic cocktail here, you won't find it.) I wound up going with the on the menu manhattan, which was very good, but not great.

Now it was time to settle into the real reason for going - meat. We had a bit of a conversation with the very friendly bartender about what was good and must-haves on the menu. We already knew we were having the bone marrow, which she did recommend. We talked steak and sides, when she insisted we have the brussel sprouts. Now, I'm not much of a brussel sprout fan, but given the recommendation that was given I figured we had to have them.

The bone marrow came out and it was two huge bones. I could have slid down them - I'd have been a very happy man if I had. The marrow was plentiful and delicious. You won't have to scrape just to get a little, you'll be scraping just to get the last little bit of all that wonderful marrow goodness.

Now for the steak. I did the bone-in ribeye, which came out perfectly rare - if not maybe a touch too rare, which is very weird for me to say. That said, it was amazingly flavorful and near melt-in-your-mouth. And the brussel sprouts - well, I'm not a true convert yet, but if you keep serving me more like these I might change my ways.

Then, on to dessert. A huge, and delicious, butter cake. We couldn't stop eating it despite the fact that we were absolutely stuffed.

In the end, and for the money, I do think there are better steak experiences to be had on the strip. That said, you absolutely can't go wrong with a stop to Mastro's.

We had the king crab claws for appetizer.  They were fantastic; the spicy cocktail sauce was very good with them.  We tried the chopped salad and clam chowder instead of the shared sides we usually have and they were both very good. The best part of the meal was the wagyu sirloin, it was unbelievably tender.   For desert we had the butter cake, it's to die for nothing like it anywhere else.

I had by far the best dining experience of my life here! Truffle gnocchi and the wagyu steak are the way to go! Also the dessert martinis are killer! Beautiful restaurant and exceptional service. I will go back!

My wife and I are visiting from Austin for my birthday and wanted to have a special birthday dinner.  I checked reviews in yelp for a good steakhouse and came across this restaurant. I had not heard of it before but when I saw the very high ratings decided to give it a try. All I can say is AMAZING!  The service was excellent!  Make sure you ask for Mike. He was a excellent waiter. He took his time answering all of our questions and his service was prompt and personal. The food was super delicious.  I had the ribeye cooked hard medium. Talk about juicy and full of flavor! I'm a firm believer that a good steak does not need steak sauce and brother let me tell you absolutely no steak sauce needed. Same for my wife, she had a filet (Oscar style). I paired my steak with a grilled lobster tail. OMG, talk about good. For our sides (ala cart) we had the saute asparagus and mashed sweet potatoes. Both very flavorful.  We paired our meal with wine. I had a perfect balanced Summerland Pinot (flavor was heavier than some Pinots but not as heavy as a Cab). My wife had a Jaylor Cab (pretty sure I spelled it wrong). She loved it with the crab and steak.  By the way the crab meat was large whole chunks.  Amazing!  For dessert Mike brought me a smaller version of their butter cake. OMG, OMG!!! I'm a huge chocolate fan and very rarely do I eat anything else, but this cake was phenomenal.  You have to try it.  That's all I will say. 

Anyway I hope this helps. You can not go wrong with this restaurant.  Heck, we initially sat behind Shania Twain but moved because other people in her party were a little loud and we wanted a quiet dinner experience.  From what we were told, they always have celebrities visiting. 

Forgot to mention that we stayed at the Aria.  Which is right next to the Crystal Shops, where the restaurant is. Check them out too. 

Enjoy!

Food did taste delicious, but average among the restaurants at the similar premium price mark. Service was also up on par with other fine dining restaurants.

However, I'm not sure if all these are worth the week long food poisoning torture I have to go through. I nearly missed half of my Maroon5 concert that was right after the meal. Still carrying stomach ache as I'm typing this review. After finding another reviewer's complaint about food poisoning at Mastro's after ordered the same plate sea bass on Trip Advisor, I figured I should share my experience and warn the yelpers.

Being a sushi lover (eat raw fish almost every other week if not more often), I consider myself a foodie with a tough stomach. However, my trained stomach cannot win over this meal. My husband and I shared every other plate except for the entrées and the cocktails and he turned out fine. (For the record, I ordered pan seared sea bass and dream berry.) So I'm guessing it's either this sea bass that still cannot rest in peace and enjoys surfing in my belly, or it's the berries used in the cocktail that may not be as fresh as these should be.

Tried to contact Mastro's but so far no luck. I will follow up with an updated review if I do hear back from Mastro's.

I was here on a business dinner.

Didn't have any drinks so I can't comment on that.

The hostess was this beautiful brunette, I'd say around 21.

Got seated without any issues and our server was a guy in his 30's.
He was funny, quick and sarcastic. Can't recall his name but he had some facial hair and we tipped him well.

I went with a rib-eye and the wasabi mashed potatoes. Excellent.
Amazing shrimp cocktail and oysters. Crisp perfect sea bass. If you are looking for somewhere to blow your winnings, this is it.

Quite an exquisite appearance; I'm impressed! 

I came here on a short weekend trip with my hubby and was told that their steak is delicious from hearsay. So of course being the steak lovers that we are, we had to try this place out! We ordered two crab cakes, a steak entree for myself, fish fillet for the hubby & lobster mashed potatoes for our side entree to share. The crab cake appetizer was packed with ample crab meat; though I did feel that it lacked a bit in flavor. There was a side of greens topped with avocado which I didn't think complimented the crab cakes very well. The 22oz steak was DELICIOUS and yep, you bet I finished all 22oz of it! NOT! This hunk of meat was humongous and of course I shared it with my hubby! It was cooked to perfection at medium rare; nice and tender! Served sizzling hot on a scorching plate; I devoured every bite of my steak! My hubby's halibut was very good; soft and tender with a nice creamy sauce mixture. The lobster mashed potatoes was good. It was also super creamy with a hint of garlic. They weren't too generous with the lobster meat but  I wasn't expecting much beforehand.

Service here was definitely not up to par. Considering I had made reservations at 8:30pm TWO WEEKS prior to our arrival, I was hoping that we'd at least have to wait for ehh, maybe a good 10 minutes. NOPE. We were running a bit late that night and I called the restaurant at 8:15 to inform them that we were on our way and the lady confirmed that our table will be waiting. We get there around 5 minutes pass our reservation time (not as late as we thought after all!) and the lady tells us that it's actually going to be another 50 minute wait!? WHAT?! Though she did apologize that they were behind schedule, apart of me was just a wee bit frustrated. She should have at least have the decency to let us know ahead of time when I phoned in so we didn't have to rush over! Well nonetheless, we went to the sushi restaurant next door and surpassed time at the bar. 

The treehouse architecture of this restaurant is out of the ordinary and quite astounding! Built inside the Crystal mall - it has a unique structure to it. Entrance is accessible through the second floor; the restaurant is built from the 1st ground floor up.  

All in all, my hubby and I had a very scrumptious and fulfilling dinner together! I would highly recommend for all steak-lovers to be sure to check this place out if they're ever in Vegas! :)

Mastro's is our favorite  dining spot. Whenever we  can try a new location, we make every attempt. This Mastro's did not disappoint.  Oddly enough this one is placed in the center of a super high end mall. The restaurants construction is a work of art! 

The misses had the scallops and I had the crusted sea bass. Sides were Brussels sprouts and scallop potatoes. 

Dessert was non other than the butter cake.

Water was great! We had a primary waiter but everyone there is quick to help. 

We will be back at this one for sure!

Hooray pretzel bread!

Great steaks and sides, can't go wrong with Mastro's.
If you go anywhere, go here. Such a classic steak restaurant with a view that can't be beat during sunset. Be careful with the pomegranate martini, it's delicious but lethal!

I'll save you some time from reading and cut to the chase:

1. Request the Tree House
2. Cocktail: Mastro Mojito
3. Appetizer: Mastro's Seafood Tower (if you're a group of 4 or more, it's big)
4. Side: Lobster Mashed Potatoes
5. Entree: Bone-in Ribeye, medium-rare.  The Chilean Sea Bass is actually pretty good but c'mon this is Mastros!
6. Dessert: Warm butter cake

7. Walk it off at the Cosmopolitan next door.

If you're eating here, I'm happy for you!

This place is a tree house.. no really, it is!  Their main dining area is called the tree house; quite cute actually.  But regarding the experience:

Food:4 stars
Service: 1 star
Price:2 start
Average:2.5 star.. but I rounded up because my meal was courtesy of MGM... thanks casino host!

I was seated by the hostess.. then I waited.. and waited... and waited.. for menus.  After making continuous eye contact with the wait staff, displaying my need for service, I was ignored.  Then maybe after 10 mins, I received a menu, but still had to ask for water.  Shocking, as this is supposed to be a nicer restaurant.. You would think with these prices, would come service.  Also, during our dinner, I had numerous times where I was looking an empty champagne glass.. and no I'm not a fast drinker... If you are going to place the bottle in a ice bucket stand on the other side of the table, please be mindful of when to fill my glass... I know this may sound snobby, but i have no problem pouring my own glass.. however, I believe they should keep a close eye, especially since there was plenty of staff just standing around.

The mussels were probably one of the best I've had! This was a nice surprise, as most steamed mussels are quite standard with white wine, garlic and parsley.  But this had some sort of light and creamy sun-dried tomato sauce! it was thin enough to compliment these under the sea delights, but hearty enough to dip with bread!  The crab cake was also divine!  Definitely no fillers here.. instead, a cake-shaped form of literally pure crab!  The Chilean sea bass was prepared really great, especially for a white fish!

Overall, I would definitely check this place out, ESPECIALLY if you have a food/bev comp through MGM hotels.  However, I still prefer Sage over this place.  The service really stood out to me, and it was HORRIBLE!

Dear waitstaff.- please be kind to your customers, especially in the city of where splurge-worthy tips are common!  And to the tall, 60 year old server with some salt and pepper action going on ontop of that head.. stop winking at ladies.. you're creeping people out!!

We stopped by at Mastro's for our Valentines Day Dinner last night.  When we arrived we were sat inside their Treehouse.....a fairly unique dining experience.  The Treehouse is their main dining area which is shaped like a Treehouse that overlooks the center of the Crystals' Mall.

For starters, we ordered their stone crabs abd lobser bisque.....both were very average.   The bisque was watery....not very thick and rich.

For our entrees, we had the sea bass and rack of lamb....both very flavorful and super tasty.  For sides, we had their creamed corn and lobster truffled gnocci....both were extremely, extremely rich (too much cream and truffled cheese).....but very flavorful.

For desert, we had their famous butter pound cake with ice cream and chocolate starwberrries......the cake was very average......I can get more flavorful pound cake at Safeway...the chocolate strawberries were good, but nothing spectacular.

The service was average at best.   Overall, the food was good, not great. One extra star for the cool treehouse dining experience.

So I have to say starting out I am a Mastro's Ocean Club fanatic! I decided to spend Valentine's day dinner here because oddly enough I live in Las Vegas and never been to one of my favorite hotel chains? What better else day to try it out right? Booked my reservation through opentable.com and actually because of the level of high priority reservations, I had to put down a credit card just to hold my spot. Reservation was for 9PM and once we arrived we were seated immediately which was great because I was starving! Things started off a bit rough for the experience but they made things right and THAT's the part that counts. I know what the quality of food should look and taste like because I dine at the one in Beverly Hills all the time. So for our order we went with the Tomhawk for 2 which was running for $115 and added on a lobster tail ($36) to go with it. The steak is obviously sharing size but the cool part is that they can cook it to the temperature of what each person would like. I am more of the medium and my partner is medium well. So when the steak came out it was incorrect and we asked to have blue cheese crust added which didn't get added and the mac n cheese came out sub par as well, very dry with just no taste! Not sure what the chef was thinking last night but anyways. The fact that I was able to pull the manager aside and address my concerns with the presentation of my meal left me satisfied because he actually cared and fixed it. I commend the him and the staff for going above and beyond to make things right. My Valentines Day meal will now be memorable! Shot Out To Dan! Thanks again!

We went last night as a party of seven for a farewell dinner before I head to the middle east.  We requested the tree house and a round table and it was perfect.  The service all night was outstanding, water glasses never got less than half empty.  We all ordered apps, salad/soups, main course and dessert.  The escargot was great, very garlicky and the sauteed shrimp were excellent.  The Caesar salad was good, but you could really taste the anchovy, if you don't like anchovies, stay away.
  I had a bone in filet and it was the best, most melt in your mouth steak I have ever had.  All the steaks, sea bass, scallops and lobster were great.  The only critique I have is that my father's rack of lamb was quite under done.  We should have sent it back, but he refused.  Overall, a great place for fine dining, bring your $$$$.

The service at Mastro's was impeccable.  The restaurant is beautiful.  We ordered the crab cakes, tuna tower and salmon appetizers to begin with. We were already full with those 3. They have good sized portions so consider that when you order your appetizers.

You can never go wrong with Mastro's. It is the perfect place for a special occasion. We went to this location to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. The bread basket is filled with goodness. The ahi tuna tar tar was excellent. We both ordered the steak and it was delicious! Mashed potatoes and steamed asparagus were Good too. After dinner, they even included a slice of chocolate cake on the house for my boyfriend. Amazing! I highly recommend this place.

What can I say about Mastro. Easily the best dinner I had on my last Vegas trip, and I know that's not a statement that can be thrown out easily given the steep competition in the area.

We made a reservation for two and was seated in the 'treehouse' area, which was great for people-watching, as many tourists come filtering through the mall, stopping to gawk and try and make sense of this structure that we're dining in. We had the ahi tuna and bone marrow appetizers and both were extremely delicious, the ahi tuna notable for its thick and generous cuts. The fish entrees we had (Arctic Cod and Bronzino) were made to perfection, but left us so stuffed that we had no room to try dessert, unfortunately. Special kudos to their complimentary bread bowl which is undoubtedly the most diverse, delicious, and high-quality 'free bread' I have had in a long time at any restaurant in this price range.

The service was attentive. The drinks were divine. For the fruity girly drinkers like me who still want a kick in their drink, try Tiki Time, which was just FANTASTIC.

Next time I fly back to LV, I'm getting into an Uber and going directly to Mastro's.

Mika, your smile and phenomenal service made my first experience at Mastro's a great experience. Thanks to you and Brandon, I'll be back here next time I'm in Vegas. The food, the service and the ambiance was perfect. Couldn't ask for a better place to celebrate our anniversary. Thank you, Mika.  You're the sweetest and the best.

Five stars! Amazing food. The customer service is awesome. Our waiter was very helpful explaining the menu and helping us make our choices. Portions are large and perfect for sharing. You can also order half orders of pretty much everything.

There is nothing bad I can say about this place and my experience there. I could complain that it was too expensive, but I knew that going in. The steak was fantastic and the sides as well. 

The service was great. The waiter gave us great recommendations and shared a few jokes that I am sure he uses all the time. He also provide us with a good wine pairing. I was lucky enough to have someone else pay for the bill so all the better.

One thing I would say is that if you want a romantic dinner, this may not be the spot. The restaurant is in the Crystal Mall in City Center, and this place is pretty dead. I guess it will depend on the vibe you are after. I went for a buddy's impromptu wedding, so it was just 4 of us. Definitely one of the best steakhouses in Vegas.

Just wanted to update all of you and say that the manager reached out to me and apologized for the poor experience we had there.  He informed me that they would be opening up a location in NYC and would be sending me a gift certificate to enjoy on my first visit to the new location.  I will update after that experience, but I was very happy with the response I received from the manager.  He showed that the restaurant really does care about the opinion of its customers.

The atmosphere is unique, the food is succulent and the service is second to none!
The lobster mashed potatoes are a must! The bone in filet can't be beat! The warm butter cake is the best desert I've ever had! Mastro's is hands down the best restaurant in Vegas!

My friend and I were looking for a simple sushi restaurant near our hotel, Aria but the one inside the hotel was booked.  So we walked over to the next building and finally decided on Mastro's since I loved the one in Beverly Hills.  

It didn't disappoint..the service was A+..our waitress kept a close eye on us to refill any drinks and was very knowledgable about the menu.  The Maine lobster was exquisite and the asparagus crisp and seasoned.  My poor friend ordered sushi which she didn't like because there was chocolate in the sauce.  Chocolate?!?  The lemon drop martini was awesome.  It came to the table smoking and kept on smoking for awhile. . We shared a delicious dessert.  $250 dinner for two..well worth it.

Ambiance was superb in the treehouse..
Service was respectful, reliable and solid..
Food was delish..

It's certainly spendy, and there seems to be some debate here among the reviews on if the food is worth it, but the service and location certainly are.

We ate here around Christmas.  As mentioned, the service was phenomenal.  On the advice of my waiter, I ordered a bone-in ribeye, my date ordered the chilean sea bass.  As a side we had the lobstered mash potatoes.

My server Robert was outstanding.  It's the first time I've had a waiter observe my steak after I started eating, confirm that it wasn't cooked as ordered, and offer to send it back for another, without me saying a thing.

2 days later I received a phone call from the restaurant thanking us for the visit.  That just doesn't happen anymore.

Although it is called Mastro's OCEAN Club, I actually think that one may be better off getting Steak here.  I had the Sea Bass and felt as though it was pretty dry and maybe over cooked.  The appetizers / sides were all good, but the highlight for me was the dessert.  I had the vanilla cake, and it was outrageously good.  It was like a chocolate lava cake, but vanilla.  I never had anything like that before, and it was great.  If the main dish was better, Mastro's would be a 4 star meal.

The prices were what one would expect.  By no means is it a cheap meal, but it was "A-OK" (for the price).  This has to be rated based on cost / enjoyment.

Delicious! I started with Conundrum Mixed White from Cali, then had the Chilean Sea Bass Ponzu (FREAKING AMAZING) and the Jalepeno Tuna Shashimi... Both are amazing appetizers. I then ordered the Sea Scallops and the side of brown butter Brussel Sprouts... I've never had a side as good as THOSE BRUSSEL SPROUTS! Addicting. I was dreaming about them last night! The Scallops are in a butter sauce that I could drink! Thankfully they serve the dish with bread to soak up some of the amazing sauce! PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR and visit this restaurant! The staff is amazing!

I have to say, the staff was absolutely fabulous! We came to mastro's at the last minute after having a terrible experience elsewhere. We had to salvage our anniversary dinner somehow and mastro's was able to squeeze us in on a busy vegas night. Not only did they listen to our story(which is another review entirely) but made up for it tenfold. 

Our waitress was knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list, and helped us select the perfect dinner choices. I must say the gnocchi w snow crab and truffles was exceptional, literally the best I have ever tasted. We also ordered a pair of lobster tails that were also excellent. To our surprise they comped us their signature desert w a happy anniversary message written in chocolate across the plate. Everything we tasted was outstanding.

Again I have to thank the staff for a truly memorable experience. Every person from the busboys to the manager were very professional and treated us like regulars. I would give Mastro's my highest recommendation and encourage anyone to give them a try.

Ok, so my other half was raving about this place based on various peoples' opinions....we tried it out on vacation and I wasn't that impressed...the place itself is beautiful and innovative...but the food and service left much to be desired

It was decent at best, the appetizers were blah...we ordered sweet potato fries (totally can't mess those up) but the alleged "vanilla crusted something shrimp" were just plain old fried shrimp with no hint of vanilla anything...my steak (filet) was cooked ok but hers was supposed to be prepared medium-well but came out talking to us...

My biggest complaint was the service of our waitress...she literally rushed us like I've never been rushed before and I was born and raised in NYC...I was chewing my so- called "vanilla" shrimp when she brought out our steaks... with our appetizer plates still half full...

I think it was way too pricey ($250 spent) for 2 people (included a $50 bottle of wine)

We wanted to try the buttercake for dessert but felt so rushed that we left very annoyed...Such a high quality place needs to be stricter when choosing wait staff...not to mention another young couple next to us complaining about the same problem of being rushed and the place was not busy that night so it wasn't like they needed those deuce tables...

We had six in our party and had a great experience.  Great live piano player, cool ambiance, 5 star quality food, reasonable wine list, and nice staff.  I love this restaurant.

The only possible knock is the dining room, although sleek and modern with an amazing architectural tree house in the middle, is in the mall.  Even though this mall has the highest of high end shops, it still feels a bit like your eating in a mall. No biggee for me, just something to consider.

Food:
Steak 5 stars - ribeye was an excellent cut and perfectly prepared
Salad 5 stars - really simple but well done
Wine list and our selection - 5 star - great bottle at reasonable price
Desert - butter cake?  10 stars - best desert I have ever had - our group talked about it the rest of the trip 

Service:
Polite, professional and well trained.  What you get in a AAA five diamond restaurant.  Mastros should be proud.  This is even more rare than great food.

Ambiance: 
The piano player, ultra modern dining area and spacious layout make this a great place for a business meeting, special occasion or date night.  

Overall - awesome ++ Love it!

Wow...where do I begin?! We came here as a family just for the great Mastro's experience, and boy were we amazed. To start off, my two older sons shared the Boston clam and chowder, I shared the lobster bisque with my youngest(soup portions are big enough to share), and my husband ordered the escargot. All of it was the bomb .com.


   For the main course we shared the sides of corn in creme, mashed potatoes w/ lobster, and the best mac in cheese this world has ever seen. My oldest son got the bone in fillet, the best dish of the night.. (yes I said dish). I got the scallops as well as my middle one, perfectly cooked,and the sauce was heaven with the bread. My husband got the New York strip, which was cooked perfectly and very delicious!!!! My little one had a little of each of our plates ;).

   The dessert was really good especially their signature butter cake. Service was amazing, and our waiter George was awesome.

  Thank you Mastro's Ocean Club for the dining experience that I will never forget.

Mastro's Ocean Club Las Vegas - I think we just had a bad night!  I didn't think it was all that... Good but not oh my gosh good. What really made it bad was our waiter.  When you spend a lot of money at a restaurant you expect great service and our waiter stood around talking and laughing with other waiters and barely paid any attention to us.  Our drinks were empty multiple times for long periods of time.  Took him forever to take our order and acted like he worked at a dinner instead of an upscale restaurant.  I'm sure if we had a different server I would feel better about spending hundreds of dollars on our meal but we got what we got and unfortunately I have to base my experience on that.

The food is spectacular and the butter cake is perhaps the greatest dessert I will ever have. The price is consistent with the food quality. I had the Chilean sea bass and mac and cheese w lobster cocktail as a n appetizer and the presentation alone was worth the price. Also their drinks are spectacular feel free to try all the concoctions as they are all spectacular. However the service does falter a bit. They waiters and waitresses come off as a bit snobby and at times seem to be bothered by talking to the guests. Again its not that the service is bad its just that for a restaurant of their caliber there is better. Also because of the design of the restaurant it does get a bit loud.

Loved the live lounge music, the extensive bar menu and of course the food. At first I thought the location was awkward until I sat down.  The lounge act was a sexy male/female duo who played the piano and had a swanky voice. (Most are not this pleasing to the eye.) The appetizers we tasted were incredible, especially the calamari and grilled asparagus. I loved the flair our bartender used and hope he did not mind our flaky decision making skills. Can not wait to go back for a full meal.

We were celebrating my wife's birthday and decided that we would go out for a nice dinner.  After a couple of our first choices were not available, we did get a reservation at Mastro's.  I can see why they had availability on a Saturday night.

The night started out really well.  The live music in the lounge was very good, and our server in the bar recommended a fantastic Riesling.

Once we were seated, our server recommended a couple of salads.  I had a spinach/bacon salad.  Nothing special, but ended up being the star of the meal. 

For the main course, I decided to try the vanilla batter twin lobster tails, because I read that it was a specialty of the chef.  I should have known something was up when the server also said I could get the tails baked or steamed, or a combination of those options.  I chose steamed and the vanilla batter.  The steamed tail was just fine, as expected.  The battered tail tasted like something from Long John Silvers.  It was so salty, and greasy, it ruined what should have been a great dinner.  

We also ordered a twice baked potato to share.  This should be a very safe and tough to screw up dish.  They managed to do so.  My wife and I both commented that we get better twice baked potatoes from the grocery store, and we certainly prepare them better.  These must have been sitting out for a while, and were probably over cooked to begin with.  They were so dry, we could not finish it.

We had two waiters for the evening, and we never saw them.  I'm sure they saw our meal and did not want to check in with us.  No refills on our water, much less filling our wine glasses.  I did see the manager at another table, but she did not stop by to see us about our meal.

The star of the meal if there was one, was the portion size of the ahi tuna sashimi.  It was reasonably priced, but loaded with seeds, so bad that it was a chore to wade through them.

I'm a strawberry shortcake fan so my sister took me here as a belated birthday/ girls night out to try their dessert. All I can say is I was in heaven!!! Butter cake was one of the most delicious desserts I've ever had, and is plenty for 4+ people to share. Wonderful service from Elizabeth and perfect ambience. Can't wait to return.

If you want classy, high end, and delicious food.. go to Mastro's! My husband and I LOVE Mastro's. The crab cakes (appetizer) and butter cakes (dessert) are to die for! The atmosphere is very inviting and romantic, and the servings are VERY generous. I was full after eating just bread, my appetizer, and side salad! Lol Our most recent visit was on Valentine's day evening. We were seated in the private dining area upstairs and were very pleased with the service. Our waiter was extremely friendly and informative if we had any questions regarding anything on the menu. The hostesses were VERY welcoming and easy to talk to over the phone when making reservations. Our most recent visit was fantastic! They even gave us a butter cake "on the house" as a thank you for visiting them on Valentine's Day (Score!). We had a wonderful experience and overall, the food, atmosphere, service, experience, etc, was all top notch! Highly recommended. 

The ONLY thing I had a problem with, was halfway through our meal, we noticed there were so many servers and waiters, some of them stood around and walked around aimlessly (WITHIN the private dining area, instead of out in the hall) because, well... I don't know.. maybe they just couldn't find anything to do because there were so many of them? It made me a bit uncomfortable as I felt I was being watched or stared at. I'm sure this was due to the fact that Valentine's day was a busy one for them, so I'm sure it's not normal. But, still..
Probably one of the top 40 meals of my life, and I've eaten at some good places. The staff was attentive to every detail. The food was perfectly prepared.
Always great food! Very good service & dessert is yummy worth the price, big portions great value and quality food!!

This was the most over rated restaurant I have ever dined at.  The food was just OK. Actually the pretzel rolls were the best part of the meal.  My husband's lemon sole was over cooked and his clam chowder was just ok.  I had the tomatoes and buratta cheese.  The cheese was very good.  My lobster tails:  one baked and one in a vanilla batter were both over cooked.  We shared the Butter Cake which was good but not spectacular.  Along with this our service was horrible.  We had to ask for bread which eventually came had no butter with it.  We had a different person for each course and were totally ignored in between.  In the meantime a woman manager in a business suit and the waiter were busy fawning over the people at the next table.  Eat at Sinatra's if you want a first class meal and exceptional service.
Renee P.

This is as good as it gets. Three of us went to Mastro's after deciding on seafood and reading the reviews on Yelp. Everything was top notch, including the attentive service, the gorgeous presentation of the food, and the portions. Some of my favorites included the crab cocktail (with an abundance of crab meat), served over a bowl with dry ice, lobster bisque (creamy and with actual meat), and the black truffle crab gnocchi. I had that night's special, which was a fantastic John Dory with a chardonnay lemon sauce. 

Some of the other "little touches" to make the experience better? The server actually served side dishes on our plates for us, and we received a follow up phone call a couple of days later to ensure our satisfaction. Very classy!

Expect a hit to your wallet: Three of us walked out of there at $600, though we did splurge on Grey Goose martinis (shaken table side), wine and lobster. I can assure you it's well worth it!

Cool location inside a wooden sculpture... that is inside a high-end boutique mall.... in the middle of City Center.... on the Las Vegas Strip.... in the middle of the desert...  Should I continue? Anyway, the truffle gnocchi was tops in my book with shavings of truffle visible in the sauce. Our server was super friendly and we enjoyed the pretzel bread... Its VERY new trendy classy fancy Vegas.

One of my all-time favorite restaurants! If you have never tried the lobster mashed potatoes, you are missing out! Other items I would recommend are the shrimp cocktail, ahi tuna, and the cosmopolitan which is served with dry ice giving it an appealing presentation. The service here is the best and the food is amazing! I wish we had one of these in the 405, but until then, I will hit them up whenever I'm in Vegas or DC. If you visit the Vegas location, it is located in the Crystal Mall in its very own treehouse, which is very unique. There's no other place like it!

Definitely one of my favorite spots for dinner. The lobster mashed potatoes are a must! Make reservations and take your date for a nice dinner. Definitely a quiet romantic spot for a dinner for two. They have a singer and piano player that make this place even more enjoyable.

Excellent place to entertain clients.  This was not my first time at Mastro's and they never disappoint.  The Wagu beef was the best I've ever had.  EVERYTHING wasa absolutely delicious, and the staff is as professional as they come.  Unfortunately for me, after this visit, I fell ill.  I have no reason to believe it was because of Mastro's, but when they called to follow up on my dining experience, I told them, in the event others had also had issues.  They assured me they had not been aware of issues, but would talk to their chef, just in case.  They followed up with two more phone calls that rang true of genuine concern.  I live in the Chicagoland area and had no idea they had a restaurant in Chicago as well - if not for their phone calls, I may not know for a long time.  Class act, all the way around.

One of the top 3 restaurants in Vegas! Third time coming here this year and I have never been disappointed. Service from the waitress was on point and she was very thorough with explaining the specials on the menu. The shrimp cocktail is probably the best I've ever had along with the lobster bisque.  I had the rack of lamb as my main course which was amazing. Black truffle gnocchi as a side is brilliant also. The one thing you cannot leave this restaurant without ordering is the legendary butter cake!!
